Reviews.Title: “you almost had everything right”
Reviews.Author: Barry N Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the services, the staff, the breakfast and the location. The only fault was our unhappiness with the room itself. First, we were given a very small room, even though we had booked a superior room. It was changed right away, but the second room was not much better. It certainly wasn't what was shown on your website. It was very disappointing, but I wasn't in the mood to argue, and finally get a room that reflects your superior room. If you are to present a large superior room ( 226 square feet, as the site stated), then you should deliver that room. Ours was not what we offered. Very disappointing, but everything else was fine.

Reviews.Title: “good location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Canadauk2012
Reviews.Content: Our ratings are based on value for money...regardless of star rating. (i.e. Rating a 3 star as average means it meets the expectation of a 3 star property. Similarly, rating a 5 star as average means it meets the requirements of a 5 start. Any rating above or below indicates excellent or poor service/location or facilities.) We will always note whether or not we would return to the property. - good hotel for sightseeing and proximity to train station (10 min walk) - small rooms but clean - friendly, helpful staff - breakfast was average - good value in Rome - would return

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location but average rooms and expensive”
Reviews.Author: Katie7S
Reviews.Content: My teen daughter, 67 year old mother and I stayed here for 4 nights from the 2nd April 2012. Our stay was nice, but no more than that really. When we arrived we were greeted at reception by friendly and english-speaking staff which was nice, who took us through landmarks and routes on a map which was given to us, however, we were very disappointed when we got to our room which was on the first floor as it didn't have a bath which we requested for my mother. It was non-refurbished and as we had requested a refurbished room, it was obviously not as expected, this may be down to the tour operator not passing on information but not too sure. We went and complained and viewed other rooms which we arranged to change to a re-furbished room with a bath the following day as none were available, which the bell-boy did for us - he was very helpful and very friendly. The room on the first floor was a nice size, but had a small shower which was difficult when you're washing your hair as you kept banging your arms/elbows, and the drainage of the shower didn't take the water away quickly enough causing the shower tray to nearly overflow, but a large bathroom. The bed's were terribly uncomfortable and you could feel the springs, I hardly got any sleep. The room was very hot, and when we opened the window it stunk of sewage outside and had no view and was over-looked by other room's windows. We had AC (Air-Conditioning) on all night, which was fine. Also the wi-fi in the room wasn't easy to pick up and majority of the time, I had to stand at the window to get connection, which wasn't very quick or reliable. We went to reception to ask about our new room and moving times, and we viewed it when it wasn't ready, and although it was re-furbished, it still didn't have a bath, which was needed for my mother. After viewing other rooms, we finally managed to get moved to a room on the fourth floor which had both a bath and was re-furbished, but couldn't move in till our third day, so had to have another uncomfortable night's sleep in the other room's beds! When we finally got into our new room on the fourth floor, all of our possessions and cases were moved there for us. When we arrived in the room, there was no electricity, and we had to call for maintenance who sorted it out in a reasonable time. It was very large, had a double bed which didn't bother us, had a lovely bathroom - WITH A BATH - and had very comfy beds, although the third bed was an old mattress and uncomfortable for my mother. The room relates to those shown on the internet, not like the previous un-refurbished room. The wi-fi connected perfectly wherever in the room, the room still didn't really have much of a view, but it suited its purpose and our needs. The Air-Conditioning was very loud and had to turn it off as not being able to sleep, so we woke up roasting hot. Also, we had noisy arguing neighbours at 2am - walls are thin and not sound proof. But a very large and nice room for our last 2 nights. Both rooms and the hotel was very clean and tidy. Both rooms were equipped with a fridge which was useful but prices for food and room service were very expensive. Also, as it was my daughter's birthday, we asked for a cake but was asked for 35 euros for a small chocolate cake for 3 people, so we told them to forget it, which was a shame as most other hotels provide a card or small gift/cake. The breakfast was a nice spread, with a variety of food available. We went for breakfast around 9o'clock everyday, and also when we got down there, there were never any yoghurts left and neither was there ever any strawberry jam. The mini-danishes were very nice, but hardly ever any chocolate croissants left which was disappointing. Eating out: We went to the hotel's restaurant which was very nice for dinner but quite expensive, and had very few people and no atmosphere. There was a wonderful restaurant called Trattoria Pizzeria al Veneria, a minute's walk from the hotel, down the Via Veneria road next to the hotel (as you come out of the hotel, the first road on the right), which was small but had delicious food, good prices and a very friendly and caring atmosphere... definitely recommend! Also a great restaurant by Trevi Fountain called La Fontana di Venere which is in the top ten on trip-advisor which again was very nice food. The hotel has a SPAR supermarket opposite which was very useful for snacks for the room, and possible baguettes for lunches too. The Via Nationale road was a very nice stretch with many shops. The hotel was very near to landmarks such as the Trevi Fountain which we visited most nights, and we walked to the Colosseum comfortably as it was a short walk away. Near to the Termini - for buses and trains, metro too. If you get the 38 bus to Baseggio, it will take you to a large shopping centre with many fashion shops - such as H&M and Zara. We appeared to be mis-lead by the website about the rooms, and was very expensive for what was available and on offer. Overall, a very nice hotel but just hope for the re-furbished rooms. If you are put in a re-furbished room from the beginning you should have no disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but let down by average rooms”
Reviews.Author: UK-Based-Explorer
Reviews.Content: From a long walk from the main train station (taxi is better) the location is ideal for sight seeing but the hotel was a let down based on what was advertised. Staff were better than expected and were eventually able to help us swap rooms but a lack of functioning air conditioning in the eight of summer made the rooms a sweat box. Nothing remarkable from the hotel but for the cost involved more of a 3 star rather than the advertised 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Sojourn”
Reviews.Author: JusticeofthePeace
Reviews.Content: For our honeymoon, we spent 5 nights at this hotel. The hotel is centrally located along the Via Nazionale with easy access to the Metro (Republicca; Linea A), and bus. There are several restaurants around, and a Despar supermarket just across the street for your grocering needs (to save on essentials like bottled water and breakfast stuff). We tried the breakfast (Euro15/person), and the selection is quite varied. The room is quite spacious, clean and comfortable. Full bathroom with bathtub. All these amenities would usually come by at a steep price in Rome, and in such location, but booking months ahead of our trip (it helps to pay a little extra for rebooking/cancellation security, in case of any unexpected developments). The room was also quiet, just as we requested. Since we came during Spring, the heater is still on, so we had to open the windows for some cool air. The only downside, the hotel did not even bother to give us any gift for our honeymoon, despite booking 5 nights. This is dismal, compared with our other hotels Ibis Geneve Gare City Center (Geneva)- flowers, chocolates and bottled water; and Best Western Anjou Lafayette La Opera (Paris)- complimentary room upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “EuroSTARS”
Reviews.Author: ErikH319
Reviews.Content: I loved my hotel. The room was spacious and had a window I could open for airflow. The room was sound-proofed so the traffic never bothered me. The staff were wonderful and there was a metro stop within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “good location ,nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: karen m
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great base for our few days in Rome. It was well situated on a main arterial road that at the top was a main rail station and the bottom ,all the sights a tourist could want. There were markets near the rail station too that sold cheap, working electical adapters ( for those silly people who left theirs on a cruise) There was a nice modern art museum diagonally across the road, but watch out for the museum nazi's inside who try to direct you to the route you must take throughout the place. You might just find yourself outside on a side street wondering how to get back in. The hotel has a wonderful foyer and helpful staff. Breakfast is pretty amazing in the modern room tucked up the back.Theres a tiny office just off the foyer with 2 or 3 Computers that you can use for free which is handy. The room that we had was light and modern with a lovely bathroom...not the largest room but good enough for the small amount that we were there. There are some lovely nice little restaurants scattered up and down the road and down the side streets and its a nice place to stroll around after a meal..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: wilmac2117
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a few nights and it was our first trip to Rome so we chose it mainly because of the location. We were not disappointed and were able to walk to all the major sights easily. The hotel was also relatively simple to find from the Termini which made getting to and from the airport cheap and convenient. In the evenings we felt safe walking the area around the hotel when we went out for dinner. The room was clean and modern and the staff were helpful. Yes, there is some traffic noise but with such a central location it is difficult not to have some level of noise. We slept with the window open every night and the noise was not enough to disturb our sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for exploring Rome!”
Reviews.Author: lalapine
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly what we were looking for - excellent location, comfortable, clean, and safe. We would definitely return to this hotel and recommend it to anyone. I emailed the hotel in advance of our stay to confirm the reservation and to request a bigger/quieter room (based on Tripadvisor reviews which indicated that rooms vary quite a bit) as we were celebrating our anniversary. The hotel responded quickly and courteously, and to our great surprise, had a bottle of prosecco waiting for us in the room. Service at the hotel was nice. Check in and out was a breeze, and when we asked for anything, they were helpful though maybe not super friendly. The room was great - one of the largest we've ever had, with a separate entryway with a closet, large bathroom, and spacious bedroom, though perhaps somewhat dated. We were on the fourth floor and it was facing the street, but the double pane windows kept the street noise out at night. There is a small safe (not big enough for an iPad, but our passports, some documents and Kindles fit inside). There's also a minibar, which we emptied out so we could keep our bottled water cold. Only one outlet in the room, which was annoying but bring a plug expander (along with European adapter of course) and problem solved. Bed is on the firmer side but still comfortable. Flat screen TV in the room with only news channels - two in English, CNN and BBC. No clock in the room, which was unusual, but who doesn't travel with their phone these days? My only complaint about the room was the shower, which has to do with European norms rather than the hotel itself. We had a bathtub with a handheld shower head but no shower curtain and only a partial door (blocking one half of the tub). There's a hook to hold up the shower head to stand under (like an American shower) though it doesn't hold it very well. So you just have to take care to position the shower head well and not get water everywhere. Not sure why Europeans prefer this, but we've run into it at other hotels, so when in Rome.... Hotel is in a great location. We walked to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, and Colosseum (20-30 minutes strolling). It's a 10 minute walk from Termini, which made getting to/from the airport a breeze. Repubblica stop on Line A is 5 minutes away (you can buy metro tickets here and at the newsstand right outside it). The 64 bus stops right in front of the hotel, which you can take to the Pantheon and the Vatican (many buses with useful routes stop along this street within a few blocks of the hotel on their way to/from Termini - H, 40, 117). It's on a big street with lots of restaurants and shops and stores, including a supermarket directly across the street (Despar) where we stocked up on bottled water and fruit and snacks. There's a tourist information office a block away to buy the Roma Pass (consider carefully) and get information. Other hotel services: housekeeping was fine, the room was cleaned, towels replaced, typical toiletries + others on request. There's two computers in the lobby for guest use for free. Free wifi in the hotel, though we didn't use it (nice to unhook from the world while on vacation!). Two elevators in the lobby. Our rate did not include the breakfast, so we didn't try that or the hotel restaurant/bar (too many great places to go to in Rome!). There's also room service, which we didn't use. Overall, this was a great hotel and exactly what we were looking for. One quibble may have to do with the star rating - 4 stars makes me think it's a luxury hotel. I would liken it more to an American 3.5 star, slightly better than a Holiday Inn or Doubletree. All the nitpicky details I provided are meant to provide a complete picture of what to expect. I would gladly stay at this hotel again and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: Gonzalo G
Reviews.Content: The rooms are big, they are a bit not properly mantained but in acceptable shape. The bathroom is big and everything is very clean. The only problem were some people from the staff, they told me wrong pick up times for the excursions and once I waited for half and hour and the next day they called to told me the people from the excursion was there when I was still in bed, 45 minutes before the pick up time. Breakfast was awsome and the location very good, they just need to do something about the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good location close to sites”
Reviews.Author: onemoretraveller
Reviews.Content: Good location close to the sites and close to the termini for ease of transport into and out of the city. Room fine although fairly basic-side room so away from traffic noise which was good. Beds very hard which was a little uncomfortable. Room size adequate only. Bathroom good but shower head attatchment kept falling off the wall and hotel didnt fix it after asking. Hotel facilities adequate. Good taxi service from hotel with receipt and number-name of cab company and bookings taken for tours although not a full tour service there, just leaflets. Hotel breakfast fine with good selection, and evening meal reasonable too, although plenty of restaurants nearby to hotel also to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: jason m
Reviews.Content: I went in Rome with my wife for three days and we stayed at International Palace. The location was perfect, in the centre 5 minutes walking from Termini station. The room was very tight and small. The staff was not very polite but they didn't speak english very well. If you want to stay in the centre of Rome it's a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: nermacis
Reviews.Content: When I arrived the hotel was having problems with it's wifi. I was taken to a range of rooms to check the internet worked on my laptop and I was happy with the room. After changing rooms a couple of times I was given an upgraded room where I stayed for my extended duration. The 'tradtional' style section of the hotel I stayed in was lovely and the staff were always very helpful. The hotel is located on a very buzy and noisy road. As I wanted to be on the street side I needed to be on the 5th floor for it be quiet enough to sleep through the Roman sirens even though the hotel has double glazing. Other more quiet rooms open into internal atriums. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was spacious enough and had a bath. The hotel was very clean. The location is very convenient for both walking and access to public transport. The only thing I would have liked was a plumper pillow.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Hanrahb
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from spending 4 nights here. The location is spot on close to metro and train station direct from airport. Many of the sights are walkable with a good pair of shoes. The room was a bit shabby round the edges and the shower could have been a little bigger as not much room for maneuver also there were no tea or coffee making facilities in the room but I guess there wasn't any room for them. We didn't use the hotel restaurant or bar as there are many superb restaurants in the back streets behind the hotel so best explore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TinaHig67
Reviews.Content: Great hotel very well located in the centre of room . All the sights are within a fifteen minute walk . The rooms are lovely very modern with a king size bed. We had breakfast included it was the usual what you get on the continent. I can't recommend this hotel enough

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, brilliant location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: dicork2010
Reviews.Content: Arrived early and were efficiently checked into our Room at 12 noon. The hotel is perfectly located as a base for a stay in beautiful Rome. Lovely room with everything you would need for a stay in Rome- king size bed, big bathroom,bathrobe, air-con,and mini-bar etc. All staff were very helpful and friendly. The variety was excellent for Breakfast and set us up for a busy days sightseeing. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. Only negative would be the heat in the room even in January- we were able to leave our window open so didn't bother us too much! Thanks to all staff for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “A Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Beazley_A80
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasant surprise. We walked from Termini and it was easy to find. Rooms were quiet large by any standard not just Roman. Free wi-fi. Good size bathroom. Heating was very warm. Very warm!

Reviews.Title: “Look no furthet”
Reviews.Author: Amos B
Reviews.Content: If youare looking for a central-Rome hotel and not on a shoe-string budget this is the place. Conveniently located between the Trevi area, the Stazione Terminin and the Forum it is a nice, clean, and great value for money hotel. Thumbs up to Expeida for their recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Harpur
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the International Palace in June 2011. i would have no problem recommending it to anyone. The rooms are not huge, but none are in Rome. They are spotless and beds are very comfortable. I have to give 5 stars to the staff at Reception. They are extremely helpful and gave us very good recommendations for restaurants nearby. When I left my camera charger behind after our stay, there was no problem. It was posted to our home in Ireland without any fuss whatsoever. The location of the hotel was excellent; a five minute stroll to Termini Station from where you can get buses metro etc. There are many shops on Via Nationale if you do not want to go to the more crowded tourist areas. We will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: TexasJane
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Eurostar for 4 nights in January. We were impressed by the location, so very close (walking distance) to the Metro station and main train station (Termini) and to all the sites, especially the Trevi Fountain and the Colosseum and plenty of shopping on the same road, Via Nazionale. We had a large, carpeted room with a balcony on the back side of the hotel, which is what we wanted. It was fairly quiet, which was great, because Via Nazionale is a rather busy and loud street at all hours. The bathroom was huge and very nice! We opted for the breakfast to be included in our rate and we're so glad we did! What an amazing spread...a much better selection then you would get in American hotels. There was everything from eggs, sausages, cold cuts, breads, pastries, especially loved the croissants filled with Nutella. Plenty of drinks - coffee, different selections of juices and a fruit spread! The breakfast room was packed every morning, it didn't matter what time. We never went for dinner, so we're not sure on the quality. The room and hotel had free WiFi, which was rather important to us, because we wanted to surf the internet on our down time, along with research places to eat and see via TripAdvisor. The staff was very friendly upon our arrival and they also booked a private shuttle service for us for the day we were to leave for the airport at 5 a.m. Everything ran smoothly. The only reason we didn't give it a 5-star rating, was because of one minor, but annoying issue. Our hotel room smelled of cigarette smoke, not that someone had smoked in it before we got there, we could smell smoke coming from other floors and from other rooms. Some parts of the day weren't too bad, but mornings and evenings were the worst. I don't know what the policy is for smoking in the hotel - but this day in age, it should be prohibited. We didn't question or report it, we probably should have, but we didn't. The only other glitch we found is when you leave for the day, none of the plugs work. We couldn't figure it out, but we left our iPad plugged in during the day while we were gone, and when we came back in the evening and used the card to get into the room, the iPad sprang to live to let us know it was then being charged. A 10-hour window of time where it should have been charged to 100%, was still almost dead. Other than a few issues, I would highly recommend this hotel. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “does not deserve four stars...terrible service”
Reviews.Author: lisaraydan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon at the end of our trip. It was such a disappointment. From the start the service was terrible. The man at the front desk was really rude. Our room was so small our luggage wouldn't fit in it and the bed was in between a single and a double. When we asked for a different room with a full size bed the man we dealt with before refused to help us even after we showed him our confirmation for a full size bed. Then after finally speaking with a manager over an hour later we were moved to an amazing suit. The bell boy was very helpful and friendly and brought us to our new room. He was even more excited about it than we were. We left for dinner and came back to find that our room key didn't work. When we asked the same rude man at the front desk what was wrong he insinuated that we were idiots and that there was no way that was the correct room #, we were not checked into a "suite". Finally a half an hour later we learned that we were brought to the wrong room. We should have been given a double room, not a suite. This could have been an honest mistake, but after hearing the jerk berate the bellboy about it, it was obvious he did it on purpose. On our way to the correct room we told the bellboy to let us know if he was reprimanded for the mix up because we would talk to the manager for him since this was in no way his fault. The rest of our stay there was uneventful until we had to leave. We had requested a wake up call at 3am since we had to leave our hotel by 4am. That evening before we went to bed I noticed the same jerk was working at the desk and knew he wouldn't wake us. I hardly slept so that we wouldn't miss our flight. And of course we never received a wake up call. When I asked about it when we checked out the jerk said we never requested a call (not true...I confirmed it twice with two separate employees). I wouldn't spend the extra money for this hotel. At the start of our trip we stayed at the Hotel Quirinale which is on the same street, less expensive, and has much much much nicer employees. It may be a little more outdated but the service is wonderful, plus the breakfast buffet was only $5 extra and was amazing. Through out our trip we mostly stayed at little rooms that people let out to tourists rather than hotels and we had a fantastic trip. But we thought at the start and the end we would splurge and stay at really "nice" hotels. This hotel was the worst place we stayed by far!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city centre base, at a good price”
Reviews.Author: ELear
Reviews.Content: Near Termini Station, and very near the city centre, so it's easy to get there and to get to all the places you are likely to want to go to (tourist sights, parliament, business area) from there. Lots of buses and taxis stop outside. You can get the metro at Termini. It's an imposing and beautiful old noble palazzo, although that means that like all buildings of that type and age the floor plans are labyrinthine. Hint: always get the same lift (there are at least two), and remember exactly where to find your room when the lift arrives on your floor and the door opens. Good, very extensive breakfast - various sorts of cheese, sausage, salami, jam, marmalade, scrambled eggs, fruit, various sorts of fresh bread, etc.... There's a bar too, and a restaurant. Helpful, understanding staff. The only possible negative was that I found my room a bit hot at night, but that might have been because I hadn't asked how to turn the heating down and was too stupid to work out how to do it for myself! Next time I go to Rome I'll certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with elegance”
Reviews.Author: SueNY60
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights. The lobby area is beautiful --we were very impressed upon entering. We were given an extremely tiny room on the first floor. We were able to change rooms after one night , and the next room was very comfortable---renovated, hardwood floors, very clean. I was able to see one of their older style rooms--older furniture, carpeted. The location was very good. We walked to the Forum, Colliseum, Spanish steps , Piazza Venetzia, and more. There are good restaurants nearby. Free internet available.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean hotel, ok staff”
Reviews.Author: GrafZeppelinDublin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an ideal location for a short trip to Rome. Its within walking distance from the Termini and all major attractions. The room was fine (on the lower end of the 4-star spectrum). The front office staff were efficient, and not unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: ScepticDane
Reviews.Content: For a 4 star hotel I would expect so much more. The bed was uncomfortable and cleaning not sufficient. Breakfast was generally good - especially for Italian standards, but it's too low to put tap water in San Benedetto water bottles - not a very refreshing start of the day. The location is very convenient, but the area pretty boring.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: gregcorrigan
Reviews.Content: Booked an executive suite room 610 for the 11 until the 14 of Nov.cost 312 for the 3 nights.great location,we walked to all the major attractions,staff were friendly no problems there.however woke up the second morning with a bite on my head,thought nothing of it until this morning after we checked out early my back got a bit itchy.I now have 9 big bites all over my back,I thought i booked a 4 star hotel not a flee infested hostel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: bridgeen29
Reviews.Content: my husband and have just returned from a stay at this hotal.room was fine size bathroom was large in comparison to room but both perfectly adequate. Had a problem with few things no tea making facilities in room because of room service being available but on arrival first night room service was finished so couldnt have a cuppa after a long day traveling, the room had two single beds pushed together (not normally something I would mention as many hotels do this) but they were made up seperately not the usual putting a bottom sheet over the two was very strange to sleep in having seperate sheets etc. and lastly our room was at front of the hotel and the traffic noise was VERY loud didnt affect me as am used to noise but if your planning to stay there ask for room away from front. On the plus side staff were very helpful we had to confirm transfer but company wasnt opened when we had to leave for a trip, when we returned that evening confirmation had been done for us and left in our room,they were very good with directions and seemed to have a receptionist for every language,breakfast buffet was comprehensive although none of the staff there spoke english they replenished buffet as soon as things went low. Overall an excellent ,central,clean,friendly hotal

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: bongohannah
Reviews.Content: Good location easy walking distance to most places. room was small but very clean. safety deposit box did not work. would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: SuePeteSteph
Reviews.Content: We were a little hesitant staying here after reading some of the reviews. The hotel was conveniently located to the sites. Yes the beds were hard but the room was clean although a little outdated. We were with a large group heading for a cruise. The room was very sufficient for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “ELLEN Y AL”
Reviews.Author: ELENAMARIA43
Reviews.Content: i'dont understand who gaves the stars... because this hotel has a nice welcoming staff frendly, but rooms are lack of safety box. ours was aot of the wall and was so smal that even our passport doesn't fit. . beds mattress nothing soft, feels like wood. to hang the cloths must be a giant ,although there was a lot of sapace to get this down. carpet looks and were dirty. hair drier to old.. in the bathroom there were no place to hang your just washed sock or whatever tou wash at night. airconditioned doesnt work it was cold at night. that's why I'm asking myself who gives the stars. nothing to do with the eurostar berlin in friedingsstrasse . the only thing it's ok is the location

Reviews.Title: “Fair place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TheCamMan
Reviews.Content: If you don't need anything special then this hotel may fit the bill. The hotel is quite old and has little to offer other than a bed and bathroom for the night. (I had to laugh a little at their website that said they were newly refurbished.) Our room was small and the carpet was marred with what looked like bleach stains, but it was clean and that is whats most important to me. The hotel is conveniently located which is its greatest strength. We walked to most of the local attractions without any difficulty. The hotel has a modest restaurant. The buffet breakfast was well stocked. Overall, it was one of those hotels that will due for sleeping. Not much beyond that.

Reviews.Title: “Probably not going back”
Reviews.Author: CristinaDK
Reviews.Content: We read the mixed reviews on this hotel and in the end decided to go for it due to the location and accesibility. Indeed the hotel is conveniently located on a major street and on walking distance to most major spots, Upon arrival we were happy to hear that our room is on 5th floor, as some reviews commented on the noise from the street. The joy did not last too long. After finding the right elevator up, we came to the tiniest double room we ever lived in. There was no entrance space, no coat hanger, no bench for the luggage and generally no space .Luckily we only had one suitcase, and when we sat it on the floor it took all available floor space...we had to climb in the bed from one side. The bathroom was ok size, with sliding door, that we should remember to close unless you wanted to wake up facing the toilet little more than 10 feet from where your head rest on the pillow. Plus the terrible smell coming every morning from the bathroom. There was no soap holder, only two holes in the wall as evidence that once a soap holder fell and no one replaced it. Bathroom and room were properly cleaned every day, Even if one might say that in a place like Rome you only need the hotel to crash at night after a long day exploring the city, there has to be a bit more comfort in a 4 star hotel. That room should have been furnished and sold as single, not a double.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Brenda K
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located in a lovely wide street close to Termini station, shops and all the city sights. Previous reviews I have read comment on the size of the rooms - perhaps it depends on how much your tarrif is because ours was quiet, easily accessible by lift and was quite spacious. Out of all the places we stayed in southern Italy the buffet breakfast here had the best selection of both hot and cold foods. When it was time to leave we were welcomed a little earlier than usual to the dining room as we had a train to catch. We thought that was a nice touch. The staff were efficient, spoke very good English and were helpful for any querie we had. The use of two free computers in the lobby area was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Noneslee
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to train station and attractions. A few housekeeping issues, like scuff marks on the walls, but overall an excellent stay. Dont use Google Maps Directions! Easier directions from Termini, exit onto Via Giovanni Giolitti, turn right. Walk to the end of the Terminal, past the bus station, cross the road at the traffic lights at Via le Enrico De Nicola, and continue straight on Viale Luigi Einaudi. Just before you reach the round about, cross to the road, heading to the semi-circular biuldings, Follow Via Nazionale for 4.5 blocks staying on the left side of the road. You have now reached Eurostars!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Citybreaks12
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, 10-15 min walk to a number of attractions and close to metro.. Also close to restaurants and bars. Rooms are very small, however was prepared for this from reading reviews. Staff all very helpful and hotel and rooms were clean. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Spanishpensionista
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel initially for its location which is perfect - within walking distance of most sights. Hotel was a bit of a maze and we managed to take the wrong lift to our room but eventually found it. Room on the small side but perfectly adequate and comfortable. Bathroom nice and functional. Breakfast buffet was excellent - huge selection and everything delicious, however, dining area very crammed and noisy. We would happily come back to this hotel and recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located, Adequate Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, we dragged our cases for about a 10 minute walk from the Termini station which wasn't too bad, and it is centrally located, so you can walk to a number of attractions, or jump on the Metro. The hotel was clean and the service was great. It is a little bit of a maze with a couple of different lifts, but it's not too bad. The beds are ok, we had a room with 3 beds in it, and there was enough space. We had a room that faced via Nazionale so you could hear traffic and sirens - we are used to it as we live on a busy street, but it could be annoying if you don't. I would imagine the other rooms that face away from the street would be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, spacious bathroom, rich breakfast, poor service”
Reviews.Author: unickd
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Hotel is very clean and looks renovated. Though our room was really tiny (even smaller then we had in Venice - the least spacious before). But on the good side the bathroom is quite spacious that we could took a shower and wash ourselves normally. :) The bad soundproofing of the rooms is not a joke - we several times checked if the window is closed because every sound from the outside goes in. We asked for and got a room on the 5th floor facing the back street but still it was quite noisy. Breakfast has the best selection among various hotels we stayed in Italy. It was one of the reasons we chose this hotel and it confirmed itself. The only poor thing about it is that the breakfast area is really crowded. The location is perfect. He haven't used any public transport through our 4 day stay and were able to visit all the sites several times. Majority of sites are within 10-15 minute walk, Vatican - 30-40 minutes walk. The last is hotel stuff and their "private transfer service" which is 10 euros more than standard 40 euro taxi to the airport. We scheduled it a day in advance and when it was time to go they started saying that the driver is in a jam, will be soon, etc. Finally we got a car 20 minutes later then asked for. The driver told us then he lives nearby and they withdrew him practically from his dinner at home. They simply missed to arrange this private service at all. I would recommend this hotel because of its perfect location, good breakfast and overall good condition. Though be ready for tiny noisy rooms and unpredictable obstacles with the service.

Reviews.Title: “What a let down!”
Reviews.Author: YannLePentrec
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 331 at the Eurostars International Palace in Rome. Very well situated for getting around Rome and the decor was nice and modern. That's the good parts taken care of! I needed a shirt to be ironed for a night out. I ordered the laundry service at a cost of €6. They returned it the next day folded up and in a bag. Not on a hanger, folded up. It came back worse than it left. We ordered a room service breakfast one morning. It cost €32 for the pair of us. We got a luke warm pot of tea which had enough tea for a small cup each. 6 mini danish (and I mean VERY mini) and 4 small slices of stale bread with some jam. Oh and a small cup of juice each. This was the sum total of the €32 breakfast. What a rip off. The staff were generally helpful, apart from when you actually wanted anything from them. I asked to have a taxi ordered for the Saturday night. The receptionist told me there was no need as they have a taxi firm on standby and they could have one in 3 minutes. When we went down to reception to book get a taxi we were told that it was Saturday night and we would have to wait at least 20 minutes for one and it would be quicker to walk to the taxi rank (1/2 km away)! On the last night we could hear the sound of running water constantly. After 3 hours we had had enough and called reception. We were told that it was probably someone having a shower! We explained that it was 1:30 in the morning and it had been going on for at least 3 hours. He said he would look into it. That was the last we heard of him, though not the water which continued all night. The room itself was fine, a small double bedroom with an en-suite would be the best way to describe it. This hotel is apparently 4 stars. I don't know why. We won't be staying at a Eurostars hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing treatment”
Reviews.Author: Gina7891
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Eurostars for one night on September 11. Location: walkable to the Termini train station, Trevi fountain, and Pantheon; more ambitious walkers can easily walk to the Spanish Steps and Colosseum. Price:109 per night. Bottom line: good value. The room was too small for the furniture in it, i.e., queen bed, desk, nightstands, armoire. We are by no means large people but no one, not even a child, could make their way around the room without turning sideways. The bathroom,on the other hand was larger than average. The room had a funny bathroomy smell but it wasn't horrible. What was horrible was the woman at the front desk, Katia, who checked us in. She was impatient and did not even attempt a welcoming demeanor. Based on other reviews, before we arrived, I emailed the reservations department to request a renovated room on a high floor. Laura replied that she could "confirm a double room in a modern style on a high floor." When I asked Katia whether the room she assigned us was on a high floor in the modern style, she snapped, "No, I gave you what you booked, and that is a standard room." I explained to her the communications I had had with Laura about promising the type of room I requested, but she said, without even checking, "It is not guaranteed. I do not have anything available anyway." One of the other employees overheard her and said something in Italian, presumably that there was something available, and Katia begrudgingly switched our room. At that point, I waited for the bellhop to let him know that our bags should go to a different room. Katia noticed and said, annoyed, "Lady, do not worry. We will take care of it." Right, like you've been so willing to provide good service? I have no faith in you. That interaction ruined what could have been a better than average stay, because everyone else we interacted with was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: southkh3557
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eurostars for one night at the end of August on our way on to Sicily and can not speak highly enough of this hotel. We were upgraded to a large suite on the 6th floor with a private sun terrace that was a very welcome bonus, but for location this can't be faulted. 5 minutes from Termini, close enough to walk everywhere and easy to find on your way back. The hotel was spotlessly cleaned, air conditioned throughout at all times, staff attentive and very helpful. 55 Euros for a private car to the airport through the hotel (was billed as a cab!!) or you can get a taxi for 40 Euros in a white cab up the road. We will definitely stay here again if in Rome. Can't fault it. We stayed in the Gambrinus supposedly (moved to the Baileys Hotel on arrival for some reason) and whilst these are perfectly good hotels, they are just a little bit further out and not in the same league as the Eurostars International Palace. Just in case anyone is interested I booked this through lastminute.com as one of their top secret hotels. It is billed as a Chich Hotel Centrally Located and was only £103 for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janice165
Reviews.Content: I was a little unsure after reading mixed reviews on staying here, but so glad I did hotel staff were great and rooms where a good size and clean. very central to all main attraction. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BristolSindy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Eurostars International Palace end of August 2011 and we were very pleased with the hotel! Having read mixed reviews we were unsure of what to expect but were very happy when we arrived. Check in was quick and the rooms are not small at all! Had plenty enough room, the bed is a decent size and comfy enough, bathroom is clean and modern and there is also a wardrobe so plenty of room to put things! The road that the hotel on is a busy road but with the window closed there is barely any noise, but noise is to expected in a busy city! We didn't have breakfast so cant comment on that. Location is excellent, about a 20 min walk from the station and very easy to find, about a 15 minute walk from Trevi fountain and 20 minutes to the Spanish Steps. We walked to the Vatican from the hotel, took and hour but that did involve stopping for breakfast. All the litte streets are lovely though so worth the walk, you get to see much more than on public transport. Overall, this hotel is perfect of you want a clean hotel with a brill location for exploring the city. Rome is AMAZING, enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Drake555
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a family wedding (not at the hotel!) late June and after reading comments about the better higher floor rooms, emailed the hotel to ask if we could be on a high floor. We got the top, with outdoor space off the bathroom which was huge and unexpected so very nice. The only thing I would say was the bed was incredibly hard and although fine for my husband was a little too hard for me. The breakfast was very good and the staff friendly. There wasn't any outdoor space and nowhere really if you wanted to spend time inside the hotel but not in your room, but this wasn't a huge problem for us and the bar was tiny and took some time to find!!

Reviews.Title: “Like it a lot!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel S
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, verry clean. Great location and good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Could be so much better”
Reviews.Author: Travforfun123
Reviews.Content: With just a little effort this hotel could be so much better. Every request falls on deaf ears. It is in a very central area and you can walk to most of the major sights and attractions. The rooms are small even though we booked and paid extra for a suite. The staff are few and far between and the efforts we went to too get an iron and board to the room were just farcical.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: foxykate27
Reviews.Content: I just spent 7 nights at this hotel on a mix of business and pleasure. I'd read all the reviews online and wasn't sure what to expect. The hotel really exceeded my expectations. This definitely is not Rome's most glamorous hotel (there are some extremely upscale hotels in this city), but it's perfect for business or other travelers looking for a clean, professional hotel with excellent service. From start to finish, the staff were so friendly and helpful. My single room was small (as expected -- this is Europe!), but well-equipped with A/C, TV, a nice shower and even a bidet. The in-room free wifi was just what I needed to stay in touch with home. Best of all was the BREAKFAST! It was amazing. With all the great eating I did in Rome, I actually looked forward to that buffet every day. Overall, a very good hotel experience and I highly recommend it. Note that I had a room facing the very busy Via Nazianale. Windows are double-paned, but I still chose to sleep in earplugs. You may wish to ask for a room that faces elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “We won't be back”
Reviews.Author: brendan03
Reviews.Content: we paid with a credit card and as uasual the credit card was blocked which is fine because hotels need to protect their income,but on checkout we paid our bill which came off the credit card but our card is still blocked for over €600 and we're checked out almost a week,we rang the hotel and they're doing nothing for us and the bank have told us we need to wait 10 working days which is 2 weeks to get access to our money,this is unacceptable,the hotel was nice but the staff were using the elevators for transporting linens etc keeping customers waiting til they were finished,they had luggage blocking access to the internet facilities and i nearly fell twice while going to check my email,batteries run out in tv remote control,no iron or ironing board,they had ironing facilities where the housekeeping staff would iron clothes for €6 per item but when we rang reception no answer on the phone for 10 mins,we definitely won't be going back

Reviews.Title: “This Eurostars family will bring us back!”
Reviews.Author: mdonis
Reviews.Content: The Eurostars International Palace staff feels more like a family than like a hotel staff. Everyone has bent over backwards to make us feel comfortable and most welcome, from reception (Francesca is wonderful), to the Bus Person (Ramon is great and a hard worker) to the restaurant (Wilde and the rest are outstanding in their service and friendliness).The beds can be a little softer for American tastes, but the room was clean and well kept. My son and I were treated like royalty! The location of the hotel makes it very accessible to most places of interest in Rome and to travel outside of the city. I highly recommend the Eurostars International Palace to anyone traveling to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: magl85
Reviews.Content: Advantages: - on walking distance from some of Rome's landmarks such as the Colosseum, the Fontana di Trevi, the Trajan's Column, etc. - Very friendly and polite staff. - Great breakfast service! - Very clean rooms. Disvantages: - the size of the room. Not a lot of space, specially if you are shearing a room. - Bad computer/internet service (only two computers to be used by everyone). In the overall, I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are tinier than a broom closet and without any thought to usability”
Reviews.Author: DavidDouglasPortland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean enough and in a good location but the queen bed rooms have to be the tiniest in Europe. You can barely squeeze between the bed, walls, desk and closet. If one of you is using the desk, the other one will not be able to see the TV. The shower would not accomodate an overweight person (nor would it accomodate 2 thin persons). The one advantage you might expect in such a tiny space would be that light switches would always be in arms reach but not true. The only place in this broom closet sized room where you could not reach the bathroom light is if it were placed outside the bathroom and behind the closet door and that is exactly where it is. The buffet breakfast is larger than most BUT (and this is a very big BUT) the coffee comes from one of those awful Nescafe machines. In a country that serves fabulous coffee everywhere, the coffee at breakfast is so vile I could not drink it. Every day we left breakfast and walked across the street to get real coffee at the Wine Bar Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent value hotel near Rome attractions”
Reviews.Author: luizmachado2
Reviews.Content: Excelent value hotel near Rome attractions (colosseum, foro romano, Trevi fountain and Spanish steps). Train station is just 10 minutes away. The room was ample for european standards and clean. Staff was friendly. Breakfast had a nice assortment. Highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “definitely avoid”
Reviews.Author: andyc808
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 4 nights- never got wifi to work in my room which is an automatic fail for an upscale hotel. I was not the only person with this problem, as there were a few of us every night hanging out near the lobby using our laptops. Also, satellite TV did not work properly, and cleaning service forgot to leave soap. Finally, the doorman was rude to me - don't know if that was because I was dressed as a tourist rather than as a professional. I would have moved out, but I had pre-paid through a website. Room was tiny but clean. Decent location, but many other nearby hotels to choose from instead.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: hgaur
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two days. The hotel is located very close to the Piazza Venezia. The staff of the hotel is very friendly. They spoke very good English. The room is quite nice with a very comfortable bed. The staff of the hotel recommended us some good restaurants. On my next visit to Rome, I would stay here again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Cheated...Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lostinbelgrade
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a four night stay in this hotel. This is my review: 1.- 152 Euro per night without breakfast for a very very very small room, interior. 2.- When I review the bill, too late, I see that they have charged twice the tourist tax, 24 Euro. The whole thing was done 100% on purpose as they asked me to pay this in cash...(I had already paid for it when I booked the trip, but I was naive enough to ignore it) 3.- They tried to charge 15 Euri for 1 breakfast when they advertised price was 8 Euro. It is a pity that the management and indeed the owners of this hotel are not aware of the games going on with their staff. To summarise: DO NOT STAY HERE. Best regards

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ClaireWoods
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I have just returned from a 4 night stay in this hotel. It was a birthday present booked by him and so was just picked from a website with limited insight. He had asked for a room with a view and we given a room on the 5th floor at the front of the hotel with a balcony. The room was big, comfortable and the balcony totally made it. The position of the hotel was brilliant. Everything was within walking distance - and I am over 6 months pregnant! The road the hotel is on is a busy, bustling road with shops and restaurants and it was lovely to come back in the afternoons and throw open the balcony doors and listen to life outside. Just as good was the fact that at night you shut the doors and all the noise was blocked out. Down sides- the wardrobe was a bit smelly when we opened it (so we left the door open and that solved the problem) and the wifi dropped off in room (so I stood in the corridor!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TeenTone
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a short, easy walk from the main train station. Please remember before getting onto the train to validate your ticket, we are aware of someone who didn't and got fined (the fine is up to 100 euro's). We stayed in a Superior Double room on the sixth floor. The room was large, modern in style, lovely bathroom and to our great surprise had a terrace with two chairs, a sofa and a table. Normally on a city break we do not spend time in the room but it was such a welcome at the end of a tiring day to come back grab a bottle of wine from the Spar across the road, to sit and relax. Even though the Hotel is on a main road once the patio doors are shut there was no road noise. Only downside for us (but it's a personal thing) is that the bed is so hard. There is no tea/coffee in the room so if you want this (as we did) bring your own kettle and makings (again which we did). There was a minibar and we can't comment on breakfast as we were room only. The room has a safe and we went out for the day forgetting to lock it, we left it wide open with money, passports, ipods on display and all was as we left it upon our return! The hallway and reception area is lovely (the website doesn't do it justice). You are a very short walk to the Collesum, Spanish steps are a bit further. We found Rome quite spread out (but we did chose to walk everywhere). We felt food and drink no matter we you went, quite expensive (but we were expecting this). Just up from the hotel (turn right when you leave the hotel) is a lovely hotel roof terrace (look out for the advertisement board on the pavement) it's next to the bell tower. We had a bottle of prosseco for only 25 Euros, you have a fab view of the rooftops and road below and can watch the sunset. They were offering a set menu of three courses and coffee for 35 euros each or I guess there is a menu to choose other dishes from. We chose to just have a drink (with free nibbles). Definately have no hesitation to recommend the hotel staying in a Superior double room.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice other than weak A/C”
Reviews.Author: jonchines
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose this hotel rather blindly having never been to Rome before. It turned out to be a good location in close walking distance to sites, buses, metro, taxi stand, restaurants, Appian Tours, etc. The staff was friendly and helpful as well. The biggest issue we had was the very poor air conditioning in our room. I don't know if that situation existed in other rooms but ours was pretty uncoomfortable (shared areas were quite cool, though). Also, WiFi is very spotty and didn't work at all in our fifth floor room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but uncomfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: Eurotrippa
Reviews.Content: The biggest let down of this hotel was the beds. They were extremely uncomfortable. I could feel tje springs digging into my back all night! And when your out all day sightseeing, you really need a good bed to hop into. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Only 1 English speaking channel though :-(

Reviews.Title: “Good location very good service”
Reviews.Author: milanoswimmwer
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in the hotel and I was very satisfied with the room and the service. The location is great close to the termini railway station and at walking distance from the most attractive roman monuments. A particular thanks to the reception team that helped me for a credit card issue. Being a first time customer they where very nice in accepting my word that the payment would have been delivered by my company after I had left

Reviews.Title: “A home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Vampofvintage
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very elegant, staff friendly, elevators decent size for 2 and luggage also great staircases too! ..breakfast not included but wonderful and if you choose not to eat in the hotel there are many restaurants and cafes serving the best coffee and food within very little walking distance! The rooms are beautiful clean comfortable and air conditioning perfect, & a bathtub!! the bathroom was spacious very rare for Europa TV with CNN and great WiFi connections ... and beautiful draped windows that open to the city, our families room had a veranda! I felt so at home in Rome! The location is absolutely fantastic my husband researched perfectly!.. it is a breeze from the train station and buses are withing a few steps of the hotel. The subway is nearby and very easy to navigate my husband and I walked all over. The Fomo Roma ruins are within walking distance! we were there in minutes after we checked in taking pictures of the ancient ruins within the metropolitan city!!! Friendly people all around many spoke English very well, and helpful. If you are traveling to Rome choose this hotel you will not regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: vacay24
Reviews.Content: Reading other reviews, I was a little hesitant booking this hotel.. When we arrived we were too early for our room.. They tried to give us a room on the first floor, but reading another review, I knew not to take the first floor. We were given the 4th floor.. The room was clean and small, as in any European hotel. The air conditioning was ok. Not as cold as we are used to in the US, but we were comfortable at night. The only drawback was the tv. Only one station in english and it was the BBC news station. So every hour it was reruns. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location was EXCELLENT. We walked EVERYWHERE. The Vatican was the only place we took a cab. There is a little grocery store across the street where we bought our drinks. All in all.. nice hotel and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great city”
Reviews.Author: Ro8erts
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well located, within easy reach of the main station, which itself gave easy access from the airport. Just a few minutes walk from Trevi, a bit further to Piazza Navona or the Spanish Steps. Bus access directly across the street. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was on the small side, but as we only use the room for the bathroom and sleeping it was fine. Quick tip to avoid a queue. Instead of queueing for St Peters Basilica the the Vatican Museum (Sistine Chapel), queue for the museum first. After the Sistine Chapel leave by the door on the far right (from the entry point) and you leave straight into St Peters. It doesn't save any money, but it does avoid a queue. Tip for a scenic view. Go into the Vittoriano and follow signs to the 'ascenseur panoramic'. One of the best views in the city and no crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in great location, but bring your earplugs”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrs_snuffles
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business and unfortunately no time for sightseeing (not even a gelato!) However, the hotel is in a fantastic location and would be a great base from which to explore the city. The bedroom appeared to have been recently refurnished but there is already wear and tear and the finishing was a bit haphazard (sliding wardrobe door that refused to slide for example). However the design intent is there and the room size was adequate - quite generous in fact compared to other hotels I've stayed at for a similar price in Rome. However, there has been no attempt at soundproofing and the walls are incredibly thin. You can hear everything going on in the room next door. (To give you an idea, I could hear my colleague talking on the phone to his wife, and this was just at normal conversation volume. Goodness know what it is like if your neighbour watches the tv.) My answer in these situations is to wear earplugs which worked fine. However light sleepers, beware. The breakfast buffet was extremely good with a wide range of cold meats, fruit and cereals.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Gbreeze22
Reviews.Content: Cock Roaches Broken Shower Broken Elevator Rude & Unhelpful staff Internet not working No Manager in weekends running hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Helpful Staff, Disappointing Bar Area”
Reviews.Author: ItalianGoddess007
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my teenage daughter in April. We were transferrred to this hotel at short notice from another in the same street which we were told had building works going on, Not a great start as we particularly wanted to stay at our booked hotel, and we were initially a bit concerned by some of the comments about The International Palace. However we had a very enjoyable stay, we did'nt have the small room issue as we had a superior room which I would advise as this is only an average size.. Our room was located on the 1st floor and there was a smell in the bathroom as mentioned in other reviews,, but it usually only during the late afternoon when we returned to our room and it did'nt last long. We did have a broken window which did'nt shut in our room and the view was terrible, a cluttered courtyard with an old conditioning unit and rubbish in ! The staff were very helpful, we had a problem with a safe and reception sent someone to our room within 5 minutes! The location was excellent, most sights were within walking distance.If I had to complain I would say that the bar area was the worst thing aout the hotel. It is an old building and has been refurbished in a very modern style, which does not include a comfortable seating area ie sofa's, armchairs etc where you can relax in the evening. If you want a drink you have to sit at a table in the restaurant area with upright chairs,My daughter and I would have liked to have read or played cards, but instead had to return to our room after dinner! Other than that a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Tale of two rooms”
Reviews.Author: ravrudy
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a pretty convenient central location for sightseeing...colosseum area to the south is about equal distance to trevi fountain/spanish steps to the west. Close to train station (we walked to hotel with our luggage...about 10 mins) but not in the seedy part of town, it's on a busy major road. We stayed there for 3 nights and the first night we were given a horrendous room. It was on the 1st floor and was tiny. I don't know how many rooms have not been recently upgraded but this was not one of them. The carpet and walls were dirty and it was not good. Being disappointed I asked the front desk if there were any other rooms available we could switch to. Unfortunately there was nothing that night, but we were told we could switch the next day for the last two nights. The front desk was very helpful and even moved all our luggage over to another room the next day while we were out sightseeing. When we got back and checked into the new room on the 4th floor it was like being in a different hotel. It was recently upgraded with modern furniture, was much cleaner and bigger. At that point we were much happier with our decision to stay there, but felt bad knowing that someone is paying the same rate for the horrible room below. The only other negative thing to note is there is a bit of a nasty smell that sometimes creeps into the hallways, elevator and shower. While kind of gross it's not there all day...not sure why it happens. Overall for the money we paid (after switching rooms) it wasn't too bad. Not sure if I would stay here again, but if you want a good location at a pretty good price for Rome you could probably do worse...just make sure you don't get a room on the 1st floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bemma
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, service and breakfast was good. The rooms were small but nicely done, although avoid the rooms on the second floor as they have a bad smell problem with the drains in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Small and a bit pricey but worth it!”
Reviews.Author: djdutchess
Reviews.Content: Reviewers weren't kidding when they said this place had small rooms. Ours was barely large enough to move around it. However, it was exceptionally clean and cozy, with new, modern furnishings. The internet was free and convenient, and the location was unbeatable- near shopping, souvenirs, buses, metro and main train station, and major attractions. The staff were very pleasant. Oh, the beds were a bit uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice rooms!”
Reviews.Author: goodtraveller85
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice, both for business. The hotel is very nice, with nice rooms (not modern, very classical style), kind staff and central location as it is in Via Nazionale, which is good for the underground station. Rooms are clean and quite wide (I booked a single room and I got a spacious room with king bed), toilet was clean and nice. I did not had breakfast because I reserved a "room only" special offer. In general I recommend this hotel... good quality!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel lovely room central location near most transport points”
Reviews.Author: solosueUk
Reviews.Content: the hotel was a good choice and good value also very good location as it was ten min walk from metro and short walk to terminal train and tram station with bus stop directly out side main entrance

Reviews.Title: “My romantic trip”
Reviews.Author: Hryshay
Reviews.Content: We where there for romantic weekend. Rome is wonderful city. It was my dream. I have find the hotel in City Center and it was really in City Center. Very good location. Entrance in the hotel is beautiful. On the reception was nice girl without any smile and greeting. Elevator was very old and it was surprise about 10m2 dark room. I have try to find the window and when I have find it I have find also beautiful vew to inside cortyard with beg mantain with rubbish! So, there was not other way that come bacj and ask for change the room on the reception. We had more fortune with next room. There was everything o.k. vew to the street. etc. Breackfast was good in the hotel. Please, before to check in in this hotel go up to control room. Everything othe was great!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: val062
Reviews.Content: At first I decided to book this hotel because of its location and the price. Everythng else what either more costly and closer to the center or cheap and further away. I did not expect much and was thinking it might not be a 4 star hotel. I dont expect much from any hotel as I usually leave early and come back late. I do not spend any extra time in a room at all. So here it is: Its a 10 minute walk to Termini Station. It's 15 minute walk to Trevi Fountain. It took me half an hour to walk to Piazza Navona or Pantheon. I loved the location. The hotel has two computers for use at no charge, which was great. If you buy a calling card (near Republica metro station) you can use the phone in your room at no extra charge. The staff was great. Enzo and Franchesca were just wonderful. Very patient and helpful with our concerns. All members of the staff were great. I think this is what made the whole expereince pleasant. Thank you guys!!! The room was a little on a small size (we had twin beds), but that's normal, and I dont feel its a bad thing. The walls are little bit thin but again, that the usual. The beds were fine, did not have any issues, and slept like a baby... We did ask for a shower in a room instead of a bath and they were able to accomodate us. I dont have anything bad to say about it. This was a great choice and I would recommend this place to my friends and I will be staying here the next time Im in Roma. Thank you, guys!! PS. Cant rate the breakfast as we did not book it with a room. There is a supermarket right across the street with all the fruits and veggies. And a bunch of different restaurants in a neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location, Great Service. Would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Jemmy444
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eurostars for a 4 night citybreak. Nice room, big bathroom and GREAT Reception Service. I mentioned it was my partners birthday when we arrived. On the day we returned from site-seeing to a complimentary bottle of champagne in a silver ice box with flutes in our room. I would recommend this hotel. Fabulous location, great smily reception service (Nothing is too much trouble), nice big room. Excellent location and walking distance to most of the sites. For the Vatican, the train station is a gentle 10 minute stroll away. Perfect Weekend break!

Reviews.Title: “Smallish room, warm but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: cervelo_rs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night while visiting the tourist attractions of Rome. It is a reasonable hotel, elegant and quite comfortable. The room was smallish and looked out on the main street. It was overly warm and we did not manage to reduce the heat, and found it overly noisy with the window open. The bed was a proper double and although a little bit hard my taste, was comfortable. We did not take breakfast at the hotel. The location was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Nadiasabi
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, room was clean and I like the bathroom the most. I would stay here again. There is a supermarket across the road and it is a 10 minute walk to Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Decent quality hotel, great location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyAndPony
Reviews.Content: We had mixed feelings about staying at the hotel given some reviews we saw (after we'd already booked) about lack of cleanliness, but we were really pleased when we stayed there for an extended weekend. The location is great - 1/4 of a mile from the main rail Termini, 200 yards from the metro, on main bus routes and within a reasonable walking distance of the Forum/Colloseum/Trevi Fountain, etc. There are plenty of nice shops, bars and restaurants around the hotel. The Via Natzionale is a busy shopping street and we always felt safe, even late in the evenings. The rooms were pretty small but exceptionally clean and nicely decorated. The breakfast buffet offered a good selection of standard continental-style food. The only minor complaint is that the mattresses were pretty hard. Our rooms were to the back of the hotel on the fifth floor. We didn't have any decent view to speak of, but it allowed us to keep the windows open without having any noise at all. We'd definitely stay there again and thought it was great value for a central hotel in a major city.

Reviews.Title: “This is a 4 star hotel, if the rating was out of 100”
Reviews.Author: benben007
Reviews.Content: I was just in Europe for my honeymoon and booked mostly 4 star hotels. While I was in Italy, I spent my time in Milan, Venice, Florence and Rome. I must say, although this hotel was the most expensive all of all of them, by far it is the worst experience. The front desk staff was useless. We waited about 10 minutes before one of the staff actually greeted us. While she was handling our reservation, she was very slow, and actually kept chatting with the other staff members (in Italian, talking and laughing loudly). After another 10 minutes or so, she gave us a key to our room. I had booked a double room online but the room was barely large enough for 1 person. The bed was small, the room was small (almost no room to put our luggage), and the washroom only had one set of everything for us. We thought it was the wrong room so we went back to the reception area to ask. Of course we had to wait another 10 minutes for someone to answer us, and the answer we got was, "you booked an economy room.". That was the whole explanation. Personally I don't see the relationship between an economy room and having one set of bath robes/cups/soaps for 2 guests, but I guess she thought it made sense. Secondly I didn't think the economy room of that size was worth $175 euros at all. Anyways, it was late in October that we stayed in the hotel, and the temperature was hovering near 10 degrees Celsius at night. We were sleeping one night and felt very cold, so we called the reception to ask how we can turn the heat on. We then found out they have not turned on the heating system, so most guests just ask for a second set of sheets. But his voice sounded to me as if he was questioning why I was cold. Anyways, this hotel definitely is not worth 4 stars and definitely not worth the price they are selling it for. The only half good part is that it's relatively close to the Termini train station.

Reviews.Title: “Dated Room, Great Breakfast, OK Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGal62
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here in a double room and my Dad had a single room. The hotel was okay, but the room was extremely dated. The best part about it was the breakfast which was the best one we had in Rome. A great assortment, a machine that served cappuccino and every kind of coffee you wanted. The front desk staff was a little slow. They told us to come down in the morning and give them 20 minutes to get a taxi. So we came down, asked for the taxi, and then planned to check out and the taxi was there in under a minute and we had to wait for them to check us out. It is an okay hotel, nothing great to write home about, but it served it's purpose. Although we couldn't find a decent restaurant to eat anywhere in the neighborhood except for the little wine bar across the street which had a nice breakfast (which we enjoyed on our day of arrival because our room wasn't ready yet).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice hotel and staff, avoid rooms on traffic side”
Reviews.Author: jackcork
Reviews.Content: Just back after a 6 nite stay in this hotel and the only complaint we had was that our room was at the front of the hotel which was very noisy and traffic was constant, day and night. Staff were friendly, room was average but suited us fine, it was cleaned every single day and new towels provided each day as well. Perfect location, Via Nazionale central to e'thing and tube just a 10 min walk away..would stay here again..great street for high street shopping too.

Reviews.Title: “Waste of money!”
Reviews.Author: Rooster14
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and booked the hotel via internet. On arrival waited ages to be served as reception was very busy with only 1 staff member who seemed very flustered. Finally got served and he gave us our room key. Got to our room and found it was incorrect (we booked a triple and room only had one bed). My husband went back downstairs to rectify and we were accused of going to the wrong room and then for booking the wrong type of accommodation!!!! We had proof on our booking confirmation but they didn't want to know anything about it. No apology was given then they sent us to another room but didn't tell us we would need another lift (even though the room was on the same floor as the incorrect one), After searching for ages we finally went back downstairs and asked the busy and rude receptionist how to find our room, then we were directed to another lift. Do not stay in this hotel if you are claustrphobic! The lift only accommodated 3 people at once and then it was cramped! We got over the initial shock of rude hotel staff and settled in a very small and cramped room with no air con. Had to leave the window open for air circulation! Went to breakfast next morning and staff member said " Breakfast not included in your package". We said it was but she wouldn't let us in as we had to go to reception. Reception very busy again with only 1 staff member. Finally saw him and he looked up our details and said "yes, breakfast included!" We said we knew that but the staff wouldn't let us in. He said gruffly "I let them know it ok" and shooed us away with his hands. No apology! We returned to breakfast. For the next 2 mornings we were greeted with the same "Breakfast not included in package" which started to get on our nerves. No apology just a reply that she did not know everyone who entered the breakfast room! Our experienvce was quite bad considering the exorbitant cost and the rating of 4 stars. I would rather have paid more at a hotel with a lower star rating so long as we were treated with respect. It is a shame because the hotel is in a good location but is let down by rude and unhelpful staff. Also the rooms are too small and considering the temperature in Rome air con would have been nice! Cannot actually say anything good about this hotel....very disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Average one, just like what you think!”
Reviews.Author: Devilmasa
Reviews.Content: This hotel have a nice location, 5 mins walk to Piazza di Repubblica and about 10 more mins walks to Termini. And it's not far if you want to get to other sights by walk. Room is clean and not so old, but I don't like the design of the Bathroom, not so easy to keep the floor dry after taking showers, no matter how hard I tried. Breakfast is quite good, many choice but also many people there. Overall, this is average to me, I may try other hotel next time if I have chance back to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Moyglas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent central location in Rome. The is tidy but small for a four star hotel. The staff are pleasant and helpful and there a good buffet breakfast in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good stay”
Reviews.Author: MichaelArchangel
