Reviews.Content: Pros: nice big room (standard double), balcony on 6th floor (unexpected!), very central location, free internet access (via two desktop PCs), clean and quiet. Cons: breakfast was not very nice, bed was big but very hard and uneven, TV only had a few channels (BBC World, CNN, TV5 and 1 German channel). Overall: was very pleased, was a bit scared by some of the reviews but this ended up being a fine hotel for us and of good value (cheaper than most hotels we found in the area, including 3 stars).

Reviews.Title: “DONT GO!!! THE ABSOLUTE PITS!! COCKROACHES IN THE BREAKFAST!!”
Reviews.Author: Janey87
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip for my boyfriends 25th Birthday, so i paid a bit more than i normally would! But unfortuntely i did not get the standard i expected!!! Definetly not a four star.....it should be shut down!!!!! The problems began when the hotel did not have any internet cards and stated "It's not our fault another company does it" this was a minor problem but a simple apology would have surfised as i hate making a fuss! Second problem was when we got to room, which had a nice balcony & was overall quite nice (apart from a massive hole in the wardrobe door) i decided to have a shower and the shower door broke leaving me locked inside! we then had to get an engineer to come up and have a look, which he could not fix and reception staff were very shocked as to why we asked for another room!! the staff were very rude, and kept saying they would find a manager! so we eventually got moved rooms which this time the hole in the wardrobe was on the bottom meaning your clothes were on the floor so a bit pointless, and this room could not pick up the wireless connection that we had to pay for! Beds were rock solid, felt like sleeping on a bed of nails! went down to breakfast the next day only to see COCKROACHES in the food, on the toast table and crawling along the floor, we went to reception once again to at least get the money back for the breakfasts that i had paid for that we would not eat in a filthy hotel! the manager then added incult to injury by offering us a free meal in the restaurant, which did not go down very well!! other numerous problems occured....mainly because there was no manager in the hotel on the weekends so any problem that occured had to wait to be sorted out, there were lots of people complaining about various things. the reception desk was very full most of gthe times! Ironically the hotel booked us a free transfer back to the airport which the reception staff booked for the wrong time (part of me thinks they did this on purpose) and we missed our flights, when we arrived at the airport the driver stated it was not free and that we had to pay.,.... we then had to wait until he called the hotel and sorted it out which ended in the flights being missed!! Overall Rome was gorgeous, could not fault the city the Collusem is a must see, and defintely go inside there are tour operators outside offering cheap but insiteful tours!!! Would never return to the hotel and would not recommend to anyone!!! i have also launched an offical complaint with the hotel, and will be contacting the food safety and cockroaches in food is just not on!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches, Broken Lift & Shower, Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: Gavinbrz
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel at midday and our room was ready which was promising, but it all went down hill from there. The shower in our room was broken, the door wouldn't close. Unfortunately there are any baths in about 3 out of 20-25 rooms that are on ever foor. We decided not to complain and just make do with the broken door however i went to reception to request interenet access at about 1pm adn i was told there are only 20 euro vouchers left and they are expecting a delivery of vouchers, (which are required from interenet access as its run by an extrenal company), and it was suggested that i return later. I asked again at about 8pm with a different recptionist manning the desk, who was very rude and said it wasnt his problem and they would arrive the following day. Due to his hostility i took the opportunity to complain about the shower adn he said he would sent a handy man. When he eventually arrive and attampted to fix the door which fell off in his hands, at which point he diagnosed the door as broken. We retrned to the reception and were given a new room. But in this room when the shower water went down the plug it released a foul odour into the room, we decided to leave it and get on with the holiday. The next day we went for breakfast, the room looks great, really stylish. Until my partner spotted 2 cockroaches crawling across the bread. when i went to reception to coplain they told me there is no manager to talk to in the weekends he will be back on monday and i should talk to the head of the restaurant. After a while they agreed to contact the hotel manager at home. 10 hours later they offer me and my partner a complementary dinner in their restaurant, which was very insulting as we had seen cockroaches in their food! They also offered to book transferes for us. They misunderstood 7:30pm and woke us at 7:30am. we then asked them to change it to 7:00pm to allow us more time to get to the airport. The receptionaist then called whilst we waited and confrimed she had changed the times. But at 7:05pm there was no taxi/transfere they denied all knowledge that we had made an alteration assure us we would get to the airport on time and it would be there at 7:30. No one turned up until 8pm and that combined with an accident ment we missed our flight and had to pay 100 pounds each to change to the later flight. This is an appauling hotel, my partner and me do away for a long weekend every month for the last 2 years and we have never stayed in such a poor hotel. With such rude and unhelpfull staff who really dont care if you have a plesant stay. The location isnt great, and there are 1000+ hotels in Rome please avoid this hotel I have never felt so angry about a hotel that i have been compeled to leave a review until i stayed at the Eurostar international Palace Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Sorry this is no four star, its a three at best.”
Reviews.Author: TimandJaneT
Reviews.Content: We were transferred to this hotel by its sister hotel as they had cancelled the booking. Not a great start. The good points The hotel is in a relatively central position and most attractions are walkable although I would suggest it is quite a way if you are elderly or have young children. The breakfast was plentiful The staff were helpful The bad points The bed was easily the most uncomfortable I have ever slept in. It seemed to be missing mattresses the springs dug into our ribs, dreadful. The room was very small. Never mind swinging a cat there was insufficient room to swing a kitten! The view was dreadful as it overlooked an internal square which looked out over the other windows.

Reviews.Title: “Big bed”
Reviews.Author: Terror-MG
Reviews.Content: Hotel had a great location, our room was very spacious with a big king size bed, in which both of us slept like babies. Our room was on the right side of the hotel so the noise bwasn't too much to bear. Via nazionale is a lively and a busy street and a great starting point for exploration of Rome, Collosem and Forum Romanum are just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: joaniemmm
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Had read about renovated and non-renovated sections. we requested a renovated room and got one after reconfirming at he front desk. Walking distance to the colliseum, great shopping around and great place to rest after hours of walking. The room was spotless although a little small. but we didn't need more space than that. Staff was very friendly when we got a chance to speak to them at front desk (they were quite busy). would recommend this to anyone who wants to explore rome by foot. we even walked from termini but given our heavy luggage would probably take the short cab ride next time. Had amazing pizza at Da baffeto near piazza novana. ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but poor service”
Reviews.Author: LAWalker529
Reviews.Content: This is a very well located hotel on via nazionale with many great shops and restaurants around it (don't miss the trattora/pizza place around the corner on via venezia with the green awning!) and very close proximity to museums etc. Our room was very cold (yea!) and clean but on the small side and the shower was really TOO small. The service from the reception area was very weak and on occasion rude. The restaurant staff however was friendly and accommodating. I hesitate to recommend this hotel except to say that I found it average.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ishay27
Reviews.Content: Altogether, it's a good hotel. However, having stayed here a number of times, some rooms can be quite small. Location is very good. Rooms have wireless internet (10 hours for 20 Euros, but shorter periods can also be purchased). There's also one computer with free internet for guests' use. Breakfast is quite good. I only think they should improve their general service (both reception and reception) to match with the hotel standard and price.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located great hotel”
Reviews.Author: doka5
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very centrally located and within a walking distance to a lot of the main attractions. Outside the hotel was a bustop as well. Service and staff was very helpful and friendly. We got a double "budget room" and it was a small room with a 120 cm bed, but this was enough for me and my spouse.It was fresh, cleaned everyday and newly renovated as well. Breakfast was a classical continental brekfast and great. I strongly recommend this hotel, it is a expensive hotel but we got a good price in a special offer so it was worth 100 euros for a double room per night, but we had no breakfast included for this price. Aslo please note that the internet was not for free, you had to pay for being able to surf which is kind of bad for 4 star hotel to not offer this for free. But there was a computer in the lobby that you could use for free for half an hour. But the area is expenive and not good for budget shopping and there were only a few restaurant nearby that are not really worth going to to eat, but for a bear and a coffee it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel but Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mymymy18
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in Rome so we were not able to check in, but they were happy to take our bags. We forgot to print some items on our itinerary, so thank goodness for the free internet. The hotel was willing to print out our documents on their front desk computer. When we finally got our room, the air conditioning was light a warm fan. It was bearable to sleep through the night but it was probably because we were exhausted from walking around Rome all day. The second day, after the maid cleaned the room, we came back to a very cool room so I guess they fixed the AC. The Metro was a five minute walk and the Termini was a 15 minute walk. The Colosseum was a 15 minute walk so we got around on foot for almost everything (except Vatican City which was a short metro ride for 1 Euro each way). The room was a little small but clean and the hallway had a slight sewer smell, but the AC eventually worked and the great location made it worth the stay for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Rooms ok - Service not the best”
Reviews.Author: CaroNader
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived in Rome by train from Venice on June 15 and took the metro 1 station to Piazza Republica which is located just a 7 minutes walk away from the hotel. If you come from the airport, take a taxi direct, it's more convenient and around EUR 45 but it's more than 30 minutes drive and really worth the money. As from the train station, it was a little inconvenient to reach the right metro as there are a lot of staircases - luggage lifting a few times. The hotel is perfectly located, Via Nazionale has a lot of local brands next to each other and you can shop the whole day as well as they have really nice restaurants around. I read in tripadvisor to ask upon check-in for a new room which we received and it was definitely worth it. The room was spotless, big bed, new bathroom (if you are not running the fan a little smelly though), ask for a room on the 6th floor (our room was No. 632) as the street noise might wake you up in the night on a lower floor. Check-in went smooth, but the staff was not too friendly, this we felt our entire stay that they are rude and not too helpful. We rented a motor cycle as the distances between the major attractions where quite far, which was absolutely worth it (we paid EUR 80 for 2 days). All in all the stay was fabulous, even though the service could have been better, as we were out most of the time though, it was more than enough as the great location made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “One concierge ruined the stay”
Reviews.Author: mudsun
Reviews.Content: Too bad for Francesca. If not for the horrible service from her, we would have rated this hotel much more highly. The other woman concierge was fantastic (helpful, friendly, cheerful, patient), but Francesca was a jerk. She gave erroneous info on restaurant locations, and she would not get our TV fixed despite repeated requests.

Reviews.Title: “I would recomend to all”
Reviews.Author: Ernest1977
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with my husband. I was advised before I went to Rome that rooms are quite small, so I booked a superior room for only a little bit more than a standard double......... it was superb. The room was big, so was the bathroom and there was a sitting room with an espresso coffee machine. The room was always clean and the room remained cool, even when the days were quite hot. I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldnt do it again”
Reviews.Author: vinson7
Reviews.Content: Other reviewers are right, the first floor is the best part of the hotel. The entry way is great, you think you're in a 5 star hotel, but then you get to your room and you're in a different hotel from the lobby. The bed was the smallest "double" I have ever seen. It was probably about 5inches wider than a regular single. The room was tiny to say the least. The location is good, only a few blocks form the republica metro stop. Can walk to many sights from the hotel which is nice and plenty of restaurants nearby. They do have free computers with internet on the first floor but rarely are they open, I found early afternoon to be the best time to get on the computer for a quick email check. Hotel staff was OK, nothing to write home about. The bathroom was fine except for the shower being enclosed and very small, could barely turn around in it. I wouldnt stay here again due to the very small rooms and bed for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: ladymuck35
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel was in a great location, you can walk to every major site from here. We even walked back from the Vatican. We did take it easy and stop for the fantastic ice-cream. The hotel was comfortable and clean, the staff were more than helpful for all requests. Breakfast was very good with a great variety of food to suit many tastes, from scrambled eggs and bacon to all types of bread and even cakes and other such delicacies, fruit, cheeses, hams, the list goes on. Our rooms were compact but very comfortable and clean. The only negative was the road noise at the front of the building. Its inevitable as its a busy place but improved glazing could help. I would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it for the price you pay”
Reviews.Author: SyedYaz
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: The hotel is located in a very central location. The metro station is just a few blocks away, but I dare you to take the metro and not feel like a can of sardines. Most of the major sites are at walking distance, and I personally believe that it is the way to explore the beautiful city of Rome. LOBBY: The entrance looks grand and it does have a nice and expensive feel to it. STAFF: Once you encounter the staff, it seems that they are forced to speak to their guests. The male staff especially were not very friendly and cooperative, whereas some of the female staff were much more cooperative and understanding. When we entered our room, we were looking for a safe to keep our valuavles. Looking high and low, we could not find it. When we called the reception, they said all rooms had a safe, and asked us to look in the wardrobe or the refrigerator (???). We called again saying we could not find it. When the technician arrived to 'fix' the safe, he looked around and said - 'no safe'. Of course, after a while, the 'friendly' reception called again and gave us two choices - 'we can change the room for you or we can install a safe in your room.' Why would we want to change a room that we have already unpacked in, just for a safe??? ROOM: We were on the 6th floor, and access to the room was like walking through a labyrinth. We had heavy luggage and obstructive steps in the path did not help matters. The room itself was not very big - the day was warm and tha A/C would not operate at ideal temepratures. The bathroom was small, but adequate. However, there was this VERY unpleasant odour that was eminating from the bathroom on and off. Leaving the windows open provided a bit of relief. The TV channels were also not very friendly - it took a bit of experimenting before realizing that there were different settings for the analog and the digital channel. OVERALL: A pretty pricey affair - really not worth it. Nexy visit, we are definitely going to look out for alternative options.

Reviews.Title: “No Air Conditioning”
Reviews.Author: Zxc01
Reviews.Content: I am after spending 3 nights in this hotel and found it to be very disappointing. First impressions of grandeur with its floor to ceiling glass entrance and respectful reception are deceiving. If you’re the kind of person who expects what you paid for and need air conditioning then this hotel is not for you. The temperature in Rome, bar one day where it was raining (but still very humid), was on average 22-25 degrees. I booked this hotel on the understanding it had “air conditioning”. On arrival I could not work the air conditioning in the room. The unit would not switch on. So I called reception and asked for help. Someone came and told me that there was no air conditioning. I thought surely he is mistaken. This was 11pm at night and I roasting. So off I went to reception and asked and was told “that they do not have this service”?? I asked why was it advertised as one of the services on their website and why was it listed as a service the hotel brochure in the room and why was there a air conditioning unit on the wall in the room? And all she said was “that they do not have this service”. As I am one for complaining when it warrants it I told the lady at reception that I was so disappointed at the false advertising the hotel is doing and that I booked this hotel because it advertised air conditioning. The room was tiny, which I can accept as it was well appointed, a good bed and the ensuite was lovely. However when you spend your days sightseeing and come back to the hotel and you have to keep the window open (onto a main busy, noisy road) because there is no air in the room so you can sleep, to me this is not good enough. And to make matters worse, I woke up on my first morning eaten alive with mosquito bites (23 to be exact)….. or some other kind of bite!!!!!!! Now for you reading this post may think I am being a bit picky, well I feel I am not. I booked a hotel expecting to be able to sleep. I did not spend €435 for 3 nights of lying awake listening to the road traffic and water flushing down the walls……yes you read correctly. The hotel has pipes in the internal walls so every time the room above us flushed a toilet, ran a tap or showered we could hear the water rushing down a pipe behind the wardrobe…I kid you not!! To surmise, if you value air conditioning, like to get what you paid for and don’t want to have to leave the window open and risk being eaten alive, this hotel is definitely not for you!! We booked this hotel for location, but there are many hotels around Via Nationale, I will not be recommending this hotel to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: fred3116
Reviews.Content: Two words : NEVER EVER According to what we’ve been through at this place, Eurostars International Palace in Rome is not a true 4 stars hotel. We chose it for many reasons including its situation, and for sure because we know that Eurostars hotels are great. We thought we booked a four star hotel as indicated on the internet, but it was a nightmare! My husband and I went from surprise to surprise. Let me list the unbelievable events: 1- We requested a paid shuttle from the airport to the hotel. When we got no confirmation, we called them again and without confirmation after 3 emails... Finally, when we got at the hotel, they told us that it was a private cab, not a shuttle, that we had to pay cash right away, it would not be charged on our room as requested 3 times!!! 2- At the reception, while we were checking in, the bell boy took our bags to bring them to the room. Surprisingly, we didn’t see him; we had to go find the room ourselves, and after 10 minutes turning around in a labyrinth floor, we went back to the reception where we’ve been told that our room number doesn’t exist on this floor!!! Then, we took another elevator, this time there was no button that indicates our floor, it goes from 0 to 4, we were looking for the 5th floor: even the employee who was accompanying us could not find our room. Finally, on the third elevator, the button for the 5th floor was a big hole on the elevator’s panel… We finally found our room, but without our bags. We had to wait for them for 15 minutes. It took us 45 minutes to find it. 3- The room, called a superior room, was a narrow room . The bathroom itself smells very bad, like it has never been cleaned before. It was awful. The reception was trying to convince us that it was the normal standard for a superior room. 4- Again, they gave us another room, on the 6th floor, this time a little bigger than the last one, but we could at least breathe easily, that was the most important after a long day. 5- It’s impossible to order from the room to the restaurant because the restaurant’s phone was out of order; we had to call the reception that was telling us things that are completely different from the menu!!! 6-In the morning, we've been woken up by a loud noise, like a generator (our room had a view on the gargen), from 7AM until we checked out at 2PM. What makes us really mad is that the hotel was very different from the information posted on their internet website. We were not asking for a red carpet, but at least there is a “minimum” that such 4star-hotel should provide. No iron board: we’ve been told that in this country, the legislation prohibits the use of iron in the rooms (and this is untrue because we got one in another hotel in Italy).

Reviews.Title: “Stinky bathroom, tiny room, unflushable toilet, rude employees!”
Reviews.Author: terryl56
Reviews.Content: We were VERY disappointed in what we were told would be a deluxe room - as we opened the door to our room, we were assaulted by a HORRIBLE odor coming from the bathroom. The room was VERY tiny and HOT because there was no air conditioning turned on in the hotel despite the warm weather. They were stingy with their towels, soap & toilet paper. The glass shower door came off it's hinges when we attempted to close it. Our toilet only flushed about 50% of the time. The rude, unhelpful front desk employees gave incorrect directions to a parking garage and caused us to drive around the backstreets of Rome for 30 min. When we called the front desk & requested an extra bottle of water, no one ever showed up to bring us one. We were EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED in this hotel for the terribly high price we paid to stay there. To top it off, they refused to include the cost of breakfast because we had paid for the room with travel points. We were celebrating our son's graduation from business school & had hoped for a special experience which we DID NOT GET!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect : clean comfortable close to transport perfect breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Jehanniere
Reviews.Content: At first I'd read a couple of negative comments on Trip Advisor about the hotel, so was a little scared before getting there. It is absolutely perfect ! First positive aspect : excessively close to tube station republicca (which is very important) Walking distance to most places especially colosseus. Staff : very friendly, speak several languages. Helpful to call for us and book a shuttle. Rooms : though a little small (room 332), it has a massive very comfortable double bed, no noise from street (double windows), small bathroom but huge shower. Sheets and towels were changed every single day. Breakfast : until 11am weekends 10.30am weekdays. Wide range of choice on buffet breakfast. Full English breakfast, continental breakfast, German breakfast, plus a range of cheese, salad, tomatoes, etc... A lot of fresh fruit. etc ... and loads more. Luggage : when we checked out in the morning we were able to leave our luggage there during the day so that we cold carry on visiting, and collected our luggage in the evening before getting our flight back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with a good location”
Reviews.Author: NickName007
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Rome, so It's hard for me to compare to other hotels. Yet, we had a very enjoyable stay. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Rooms are not too big, but we spent most of our time touring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the extra money”
Reviews.Author: abuffone
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eurostars Int'l Palace with my sister, mother, and grandmother..The location was good, no more than a 10 euro ride from the train station, walking distance to a lot of the sights, and only a few blocks from the very convenient Metro..The rooms themselves were not impressive, at least not for the extra cost that we paid, as opposed to staying in a nicer hostel or bed and breakfast. There were not enough plugs in the room, the heat was jacked up to at least 75, with no idea of how to operate the thermostat..And when coming from a hostel that had a computer with free internet and a large flat screen tv, paying for Wi-Fi was not something I was happy about. My grandmother loved it, so I am chalking that up to generational differences. The front desk people and other staff were friendly and helpful, but overall I was not impressed with what this "palace" had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “great location and staff breakfast is one of the best”
Reviews.Author: erikleeindianaUSA
Reviews.Content: stayed 3 nights at Eurostars Rome in February 2010. The staff was helpful. There was free internet just off the lobby area. The room was spacious enough and the bathroom clean. The breakfast was ideal for variety and atmosphere. The attendent that seated guests was good if not better than most high end restaurants. Very professional and friendly. Would definitely stay here again. There are lots of restaurants nearby. Also the Forum and Colisseum within walking distance as was Trevi fountain area. You can walk to to Termini train station (10 min)

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a great price”
Reviews.Author: JayjayCM
Reviews.Content: We searched for a long time for a good hotel at a good price in a good location and i have to say this is the one! Its about a 10 min walk to Colasseum and Roman Forums! There are 2 streets next to this one with bars and restaurants on them at good prices. The hotel reception were friendly and helped us plan rome by pin pointing attractions on the map and telling us how to get there by bus etc. The hotel bar is quiet but nice. The rooms were great. We had a standard Double which was quite small and only had 2 English channels but thats probably me just being picky!. They were clean and bathroom was nice too. One thing I want to talk about is the Breakfast. Not many people have reviewed this so I will. .. The breakfast is American style so you will get normal Sausages (the pork ones not the usual horrible ones you get abroad) you get that weird Bacon thats not like the UK if you know what i mean. You get scrambled egg. Thats all the warm stuff. The cold stuff includes fruit cakes, muffins and cereal. NOW read carefully.. This hotel has the BEST DESERTS FOR BREAKFAST EVER!. I never usually try deserts for breakfast but once I had eaten the hot stuff i wanted something sweet so i tried the AMAZING MUFFINS! They are fresh, they have blueberry on one day, Chocolate on another and then White with Chocolate chip on another. These are the best Muffins i have ever tasted! Not hard.. there very soft and melt in your mouth. So Tasty! Try one youll be amazed! I cant really faulter this hotel as its in a great location.. (the 64 bus that takes you to the Vatican is right opposite the hotel - oh and you can by tickets for bus on the bus..you dont have to buy them from a newsagents like the hotel tell you!). The staff are friendly, hotel room was great and the food was really nice. The only things i could say bad abourt this place are little things like there only being 2 English channels and I wanted beans with my breakfast.. so thats the only reason im giving it 4 out of 5 as im a fussy bugger! We got this hotel for £160 each for 3 nights through Booking.com. Amazing Value and lives up to its 4 star rating! By the way if you want to go to Rome for nightlife dont.. as it doesnt seem to exist. Theres plenty of Restaurants with bars but doesnt seem to cater much for the young folk.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel , great location”
Reviews.Author: ab500
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for our honeymoon and the hotel was very cozy, nothing out of the extraordinary. We took the junior suite which was a decent size room but I would say you would be paying more for the location than the hotel itself. The train sation is just 5 miute walk from the hotel and there are plenty of cabs available . For those who like walking ( I think best way to see Rome) Spanish steps and the coliseum is well within reach. Overall rome was a very good experience and the hotel was not that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average staff”
Reviews.Author: colitar
Reviews.Content: The location is great, walking distance to most of the important places, we only took the bus or the subway to go to the Vatican, the bus stop to the vatican is just across the street. We didn't reserve rooms with breakfast, and we're happy with our choice, just across the street there's a cafe next to the supermarcket where you can take breakfast for half the price (the waiters are very helpfull and the food is good). The staff were not that professional and helpfull as they should be for a 4* hotel. For us it was ok, because we didn't spend that much time in the hotel. Next to the reception there is a room with two computers with free internet, but you can also buy wi-fi cards at the reception desk. I would defenately recommend this hotel to a frend who wants to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JZaragoza
Reviews.Content: Front desk people are rude. Two twin beds put together does not count as a king size bed.

Reviews.Title: “Perefct Location”
Reviews.Author: MaryAnneLo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very modern and perfectly located. Close to Termini train station but not so close that you have all that train station bustle. Near all the major sites.

Reviews.Title: “Well positioned hotel for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: AucklandTripper
Reviews.Content: We were put at the back of the hotel which was actually great the only downside was that we had to take our bag over a set of stairs to get to the lift. Staff were extremely helpful and courteous The room that we stayed in was quiet and well appointed and a reasonable size. The shower was smallish but as I weigh 100 Kg I was able to wash myself with little problem but I feel that if you weighed 120kg plus then you might have a problem. But strangely enough the actual bathroom was quite large. The breakfast was only OK and not what I would call fantastic, on the first day I decided to have the bacon, sausage and eggs and that was a mistake as they did not taste right and the eggs had a bad smell to them. After that I stuck to the continental type breakfast, the coffee was not great either as it came from a coffee machine that you would expect to find in a work place not a hotel. However the good thing about this hotel is that it is on the main shopping strip (sales are on in January), there is a supermarket across the road and plenty of places to eat. It is also in walking distance to Trajans Column (just down the road) and all the major attractions are within a 10 to 20 minute walk the Vatican is further away but the Metro is just up the road from the hotel. As we had journeyed through Italy by train the train station is just up the road about 10 minutes walk, do not take a taxi we were offered one at the train station for 15 Euros to take us 2 -3 blocks. Using the train system through Italy is great fun and even though my wife and I are in our mid to late fifties we enjoyed doing everything ourself and not having to worry about tours on buses. Tip Learn a little of the language and try to speak Italian they love it and it opened many doors for us and got us little extras like free Lemoncella after dinner ( not just a glass full but as much as you wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Not great but good enough, problem with noise”
Reviews.Author: appenaorte
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the center of Rome, nice location and many rooms. The one problem we had was that every time a cleaning lady was closing one door at our floor our wall was shaking and trembling so we couldn't sleep. Especially after arriving late at night our first night we needed some extra sleep. The breakfast buffet is amazing and very very rich! The staff gets you seated which is a little weird because they show you where to sit. The staff at the reception was helpful but not easily available because there were a lot of people needing assistance. Other than the noise thing we were satisfied. Also, the internet access was free.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite a luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: doctortrish47
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel, but could do better. Space is at a premium everywhere - small rooms, small lift, crowded lobby. The barman was very helpful in providing an ice bucket for my bottle of wine bought from the enoteca opposite. Well positioned in Rome for all sites.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: wheretonext10
Reviews.Content: After spending one night in an horrendous hotel my husband found this place and what a relief! We spent 5 nights here over new years and had a lovely, comfortable stay. The staff were friendly and helpful. Location is great and easy walking distance to the sights. Breakfast was amazing and we would definitely recommend this hotel as well as return again. Only down side was room service only starts at 4pm, so you can't get anything to eat in your room before then.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Hotrod10
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Lobby area is very attractive. Located well within walking distance of Piazza Navona, Trevi Fountain, the Pantheoin and the Colosseum. Also close the Termini Station. Two of our party of four were not able to walk long distances so we didn't see as much on foot as we normally do. However, one of them was able to walk (very slowly) from Piazza Navona back to our hotel. Lots of restaurants and great shopping just outside of the hotel door. Hotel staff was helpful - answered many questions for us and kept our luggage in a locked room since we arrived about 3 hours before check-in time. Breakfast was not included and was a very expensive add-on so we went to a local restaurant instead (still expensive though). Our rooms (for 2 people) were very small but the bed was worse - it was about the size of two cots. The other couple in our party complained and got a much larger room with a much larger bed. It may have been an upgrade but they were not charged extra. Overall, this was a good stay and I would recommend it - just ask about the bed size if there are two of you. Fabulous location and very handy for shopping and eating. Via Nazionale was busy so we felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LovetoTravel067
Reviews.Content: The location of the the hotel is wonderful! It is very centralized. It is about 7-10 minutes away from the Coliseum (walking distance). If you plan on staying in the room the whole day then you will feel cramped. The room is a bit small, but the bathroom is big and comfortable. The service isn't bad. It is not the kind of service you get in Mexico, but for Italy's standard it's ok. Remember Italians do NOT treat the tourist very well. So, if you are thinking in terms of Italian standards for service it's a 3 out of 5. The hotel is nice, not luxurious, but nice. The restaurant in the hotel was being remodeled, so the hotel sent us to the restaurant across the street for breakfast. The breakfast was excellent! It was buffet and the food was delicious. Next door to the restaurant was a grocery store, it was very convienent. I would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: candsNewcastle
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner have just returned from a four night stay at the eurostars international palace, we would find it hard to fault our stay. the hotel is very clean and the staff are friendly and efficiant, and the location is perfect. our room was quite small but we didnt mind this as all we really needed it for was to sleep! it was very clean (cleaned every day of our stay) and very modern, we had a room which looked onto a side street, and it was pretty quiet at night, i can imagine it would be quite noisy if you looked out onto the main road, via nazionale, as this is a very busy street. The location of the hotel is great, really central for all attractions! only a 10 minute walk to the colloseum, trevi fountain, spanish steps and main shopping area, and a 10 min ride on the subway to the vatican. the hotel staff are happy to give directions and kindly gave us a map with routes marked on it. we would definately stay here again, and would defiantely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Eurostar International Rome”
Reviews.Author: debycolson
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Nice staff & rooms. We would definitely stay ther agin

Reviews.Title: “Cool 3 nights stay”
Reviews.Author: WorldCitizenBR
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Didn't like the elevator... it's small. The hotel is an old building but renovated. It's worthed staying.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ikesmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my husband for three nights in a double room. The room was small as we expected, but clean and quiet. Getting to the room was interesting, up and over some stairs to a small lift in the back; but facing the back meant the room was quiet and that was nice! Location is terrific, lots of relaxing good restaurants around the neighborhood, and a grocery across the street. Easy to get to the metro, or to the hop on and off bus, which we used a lot. Had to go to the bar if you wanted ice, but we also found that the grocery across the street would sell a small bag and that worked for us. We requested more pillows and they delivered them right away; room was always clean when we returned from sightseeing, and the front desk staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mk17gr
Reviews.Content: Clean, good located, nice service I would like to go again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Free Internet... only bad is the A/C issue”
Reviews.Author: Stacie77
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! The rooms were small, and the bed was hard... but that seemed to be the same throughout Italy. They offer 2 computers with internet access that usually worked ok. The only issue we had is that they do not turn on the A/C until after 4pm! So if you get into your hotel early and it has been a hot summer day - you cannot really go back to your room because the A/C isnt working. That was REALLY annoying! The breakfast is also VERY expensive (15 euros per person), so we never ate at the hotel. There is a small grocery store across the street that sells cheap drinks, fruit, yogurts, cereals, etc so you can stock up your hotel room fridge and eat for cheap! The location is pretty good. About a 10-15 minute walk to the Republic Metro stop. And about a 20 minute walk to the main Termini rail station/metro stop. You can get almost anywhere on the metro in Rome, so it is good to be near the Metro. There is also a bus stop right outside the hotel lobby which is nice. I highly recommend the Roma Pass while you are in Rome if you will be there 3+ days. It gets you free public transportation (buses, metro) and into the Colosseum (no line) plus any other public museum for free. It really saved us a lot of time and you can buy it at the Termini station (they have their own booth just to sell Roma Passes).

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, poor service, not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: traveler8080
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room for 3 nights. Our room was so small you could barely walk around the bed. There was no dresser, and only a small area to hang your clothes. The bathroom was updated, but again extremely small with a small shower and a single sink. The hallways had stained and worn carpet. The lobby was always packed with people and the front desk staff was rude. The phones were out for one full day, too. The only plus this hotel has is the location. We were within walking distance to everything. Would never stay here again, there are so many choices in Rome, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A 3 star hotel, not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Lovingretirement47
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Eurostar at the beginning of our month vacation in Europe. The staff was friendly, spoke English. The location was good--walking distance to the sights, metro, train station and many restaurants. Our room was very small with barely enough room to walk around the small bed (we booked a double). The hotel is overpriced and should be a 3 star. There is a great, romantic, roof-top restauant a couple of blocks down the street at the La Griffe Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An A+ Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aphrodite1
Reviews.Content: Excellent customer service throughout the hotel. Helpful, courteous and friendly personnel to satisfy your requests, instantly. Very professional infront desk services, with fast check in and out. Big, clean and confortable rooms with luxurious bathrooms; our rooms were on 5th floor facing the infront of the hotel, and were noise proof with a powerful A/C. The daily breakfast was excellent, fresh and healthy and served in an elegant and tasteful decorated room. Its location is unbeatable, so its price. I will definately recommend it and planning to be back, again, next year with the rest of my family. Catherine Mitchell, Pensacola, Florida

Reviews.Title: “Need to lower their star rating”
Reviews.Author: similfea
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location. 10 minute walk to rail station, 15 minutes to Forum & all the sights, good shopping area, staff was good BUT for the money spent I was not happy. Their was no shower curtain so water went everywhere, towel count was different everyday & never enough, fridge did not work at all(yet it was full), AC was minimal, small rooms with no space for luggage & I hit my shin on bed corner almost daily, hangers in closet were at least 7 feet high & uncomfortable to reach. I would look elsewhere unless you can get a price reduction.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireRA
Reviews.Content: Stopped here from 30/08 to 04/09. Stopped with our lass and then her parents. Our room ( 509 ) very large room, good AC as needed, everything you would need. Yes there are no english speaking channels on the tv's but your in Italy why should there be. Didn't want to stay too long in room anyway and although we were at the front of the hotel facing main road, noise was to a minimum due to 2 windows and shutters. Our girts parents room was smaller than ours and didnt have a bath but they had no complaints. I found all the staff to be friendly and helpful. Speak to somebody nicely and with respect and you will get it back in return. Unfortunately it seems that people thrive to be rude and to complain about anything. Location was very good. If your reasonably fit, can walk to anywhere in the city. If not, plenty of buses outside hotel and radio car taxis are reasonably priced. Did not go into bar or restaurant so cant comment. Flew to Ciampino Airport, 30 euros each trip for the 4 of u, including 4 cases and 4 bags. Would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect friendly or AC”
Reviews.Author: JerrySAustin
Reviews.Content: Recently got moved from planned hotel to this hotel for 1 night due to AC issues at planned hotel. Well this room had no AC either! Location of hotel is good. The staff was less than helpful. Room was very small.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: legal_eagle554
Reviews.Content: I normally do not write reviews however i felt compelled to do so after our stay. This hotel was the last stop on our 3 week euro vacation and it was by far the WORST hotel we stayed in. My boyfriend and I are troopers and generally are easy going, but by the end of the stay we were so glad to leave. I originally choose this hotel for the location and the cheap price, as we were on a budget. I wish i would have listened to the bad reviews and stayed away. First the rooms were abnormally small, the smallest we had encountered on our vacation, which was ok because we were expecting it and we did book the smallest rooms they had. also the walls were extremely thin, just hope you arent staying next to noisy couple. Next, the air conditioning broke the 3rd night we were there. It dripped from 4am until the next morning when we called to have someone come look at it. We had to leave the room for the maintance man to come look at it. After it couldnt be fixed we were switched to a different room, which was basically a cheaper version of the room that we previously had. It seems that the hotel attempted to upgrade itself but did a cheap and terrible job doing it. i.e. the faucet BARELY reached the sink so you had to turn it on full blast, and the shower head was installed backwards so when you turned on the shower it shot back at you and soaked the bathroom. By far the worst thing about this trip is that after the housekeeping came, a bag of mine went missing, even though i make it a point to clean up the room and organize my stuff before they come. Unfortunately, the bag contained all of my clean underwear, we had just done laundry 3 days prior, and some items i had bought while on vacation. All that was left was a sock on the windowsill. When we went downstairs to attempt to figure out what happened to it, it seemed that we were the ones who were being the nuisance and that we were putting them out. Very unprofessional and not the way to run a hotel. They even suggested that maybe our room hadnt been cleaned!!! i had to "bother" the hotel staff because no one would tell me anything and even though they said they would call me in the room, i, on numerous occasions had to call them. needless to say it was never found. Thankfully, this happened at the end of our vacation so we only had to spend a little money on replacing stuff. Now i am waiting until i hear back from the manager to see if i get reimbursed. I would NEVER stay here again and would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to keep their stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; amazing location; wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: travel2622
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel! It is in walking distance to so many attractions including the coleseum and the forum. The subway is right there, and there are amazing shops, restaurants and cafes everywhere along the street. We booked through Expedia and got a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ws just what we needed in a great location for our engagement vacation!”
Reviews.Author: janicempeacock
Reviews.Content: Eurostars International Palace was located in the perfect location. My fiance and I stayed there for a week and the hotel staff were very helpful when we asked for directions to tourist sites and they suggested a nice beach in Ostia for us to take a day trip to! The beds were very firm but okay and the room was small but it was just what we needed! The two most important things to me were just perfect- It had great water pressure in the shower and the air conditioning worked very well!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel didn't live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: melissa328
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights after taking a Mediterranean cruise. I chose this hotel on the recommendation of someone else who stayed there and because of the generally good reviews on trip advisor. First the positives: Great location for walking to many things and not too far from the train station (we were able to walk with our suitcases from the station in about 15 minutes). Rooms okay, generally clean. Negatives: this was a very crowded hotel with many people checking in and out at all times. There was only one staff member at the reception desk most of the time, so you had to wait in line every time you needed to ask a question. We got in from a hot and sweaty train after taking a cruise at around 12:30. We were told we could not check into our room until 2:00. We really just wanted to relax and freshen up because we were so sweaty. They did take our luggage so we could go out and walk around, which we reluctantly did, beacuse we didn't want to sit around. We were told our luggage would be brought up to our room when we came back to get our key. We came back around 2:45 and could check in. We had to wait in a line to get our key and our luggage was still sitting behind the counter. We just said that we would take it up ourselves. There was a restaurant in the hotel, but we never were even told about it or told about breakfast which they offered. The staff just seemed rushed and didn't really care about helping the customer. We had a lot of trouble finding our room. We were on the 5th floor and had to walk through a maze with signs not well marked. Luckily, we fould a maid who pointed us in the right direction. Our room was fine, a decent size, as well as the bathroom. We had a small refrigerator stocked with things, but it wasn't cold. We tried to adjust the temperature, but nothing got cold. We wanted to fill some water bottles to take with us when we walked, but couldn't. I called down to the reception to let them know, and they said they would send someone up. They never did. The next morning when we went to explore the city, I stopped down at the desk and told a girl that we had called last night and that no one came to our room. She said that someone would check it out and get it working today. We thanked her and left. When we returned and went to our room, the refrigerator still wasn't working and we never knew if anyone came to our room. We just gave up at that point. We did ask at the desk about the best way to get to the airport and basically, they pushed their service which costs 50 euros. I saw a sign outside near the hotel about an airport shuttle service for 34 euros for 2 people, and the hotel said they know nothing about that and would not call for me. They said that I had to call from my room, and of course, pay for the call. I did end up calling on my own, and we got an airport shuttle for two of us with all of our luggage for 31 euros (a much better deal). I also inquired about having the front desk print out our boarding passes for us for our flight home. They told us that we had to do that on their computers in the other room for the guests and then e-mail the boarding passes to the reception. Then they would print them out. Well, we tried this and wasted an hour. Of course, I understand everything was in italian, so it was hard for us to read, then we couldn't get an e-mail to send to the front desk. Every time my husband went to ask for assistance, he had to stand in a long line. Finally, he got someone form behind the desk to come help us, but basically he said he didn't know what to do, because he couldn't figure it out either. The only thing we were told is that we could try back at 10:30 that night after the manager had left, because he doesn't like the front desk doing this and printing out boarding passes. We were really angry. Because it would have literally taken them 5 minutes. Then, we went up to our room at around 2:00pm and no one had been there to clean. On our way out again, I waited in a line and said that we did not get maid service. The person didn't really seem to care and lazily asked for our room number. Lucklily, when we got back a few hours later, our room was cleaned. The only bright spot was later that night we did ask a nice girl at the desk about printing our boarding passes and she was friendly and helpful and had no problem doing this for us. Also, the next morning, check out was fine. There was no line and the person at the desk was helpful. Now, I am not a picky person, and as long as I have friendly and helpful service and a clean room, I am fine. One of these things happening wouldn't have been that bad, but a combination of all these things really soured my feel for the hotel. We did have a wonderful time in Rome and like I said the hotel is in a good location and it is generally fine. I just found the overall staff to be very unhelpful and we wasted a lot of time that we shouldn't have had to. Maybe we were just there at a busy time, but they really should have had more staff working there when it is so busy.

Reviews.Title: “Faux 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: Bella_Donna11
Reviews.Content: The lobby of the Eurostars was very inviting with its Faux paintings. That was indication that this hotel was a Faux-4-star. We stayed in 2 other 4-star hotels in Rome and this one does not measure up. I believe that this hotel's true rating is a 2-star hotel. The rooms were dated - staples were showing on the walls. The floor plan was a maze of hallways. We rented 2 rooms and the basic CNN channel on the TV did not work in both rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: alan0056
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Eurostars in early July, booked through Expedia, paid for an economy room and received a double standard! We were very impressed with this hotel, the room was very spacious, clean, included air conditioning and was comfortable with a large window with a view over the streets of rome. The bathroom was impressive, spacious, with a bathtub. Free internet access in the lobby with the provided computers. We ate breakfast and Dinner at the Restaurant, Dinner was amazing! the food was delicious and the service was fantastic!- and the price was reasonable, would definitely recommend it to anyone. Breakfast was very much the same- yet breakfast was quite pricey. (If not included in your room price it costs 15 euro extra) The location was great, only a 10 min walk to the trevi. This hotel was fantastic, great value for money! would recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Norhing works... No One Cares...”
Reviews.Author: Travels_With_Laptop
Reviews.Content: Listed as a 4 star hotel we had expectations that this would be a good place to stay for a few days at the end of our trip to Italy. Upon arrival they were unable to communicate with us on how to find our room through the maze of elevators in the hotel. When we got into our room which seemded nice at first we found that several things did not function. The TV only got 1 channel and it was blurry. The WiFi didn't work at all and we got stuck with a 10 euro pre-paid card that they would not refund. We asked about the TV service WiFi and they said "Maybe better tomorrow..." I had to walk over to a two start hotel down the street to write this... Avoid this place

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and a Cental Location”
Reviews.Author: dfhenderson
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Eurostars Palace. The rooms though extremely small were very clan with modern conveniences. Our bathroom had an extremely large shower and included a hairdryer which was convenient. Room had a mini bar with items at a very fair price. Room had a great AC system that worked at the touch of a button. If you are looking for a spacious room this is not the place for you. Overall we really enjoyed our stay. 10 minute walk to Trevi, Pantheon and about 20 to Spanish Steps and Colosseum. I definitely feel we got our moneys worth.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB BREAKFASTS”
Reviews.Author: LeicesterActor
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel to celebrate a special birthday and our wedding anniversary. I had written to them to mention this two weeks earlier but nothing was mentioned at reception nor were we upgraded. No matter-our pleasant room on the quiet side of the hotel was fully refurbished, spotlessly clean, with very comfortable beds. Maid service ensured it stayed that way over the next few days.The air conditioning was excellent and quiet. The difficulty with any bedroom in an hotel is how noisy are guests in the adjoining room. On the whole we were lucky until our final night when we had a baby crying until well past midnight, very loud parents' voices trying to soothe it and then deciding to take a long shower at about 1 oclock in the morning....but this was just the one night. The hotel is elegant and very clean, however the reception staff could do with taking a training course on customer care. They are efficient but lack friendliness or warmth. On arrival we were not offered help with our cases, and during our stay received no acknowledgement by way of greeting or smile as we passed the reception desk. The dining room is spacious, spotless table cloths and linen, and a magnificent choice of food. You name it , they had it and with more to spare....absolutely superb. The hotel itself is wonderfully situated to all of the most poular tourist spots, and never more than twenty minutes walk away from The Trevi Fountain, The Forum, Palatine Hill or The Spanish Steps.Rome itself is a beautiful city.... (except for its litter and grafiti strewn back streets) and you cannot fail to be anything other than entranced. Do beware motorists however and the million or so motor scooters......cross roads at your peril!!!. As I said this was our second stay at this hotel and we would most certainly stay again. Having read some of the less favourable reviews I suppose it is fair to say it comes down to how things are percieved by every individual visitor at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Lovely Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DiandRuss
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our trip to Rome, I didn't know what to expect after reading the reviews but just wanted to put mine in. We stayed in a standard room at B&B rate, our rooms were lovely, bathroom superb and the location what can I say, very central for all the sites other than the Vatican and St Peters. The breakfast had everything you would need even for the fussiest person with lots to chose from, the hotel staff were very friendly and were very helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Rome as it was lovely!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Penthouse in Central Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jonster112
Reviews.Content: If you can, book Room 607 at this hotel. Walk straight through the modern elegance of this penthouse suite, fling open the French doors of your private 200 square foot rooftop terrace, and say hello to Rome! It might help if you have a bottle of something on hand, especially if you are with someone you (a) wish to impress, or (b) wish to become romantic with. Hell, even if you’ve already been romantic with that person, you will marvel at the classic and spacious (marble, of course) bath in your suite, give a nod to your own personal espresso machine, smile at the sitting area, relax when you see the two air conditioning thermostats, and laugh to yourself when you realize you’re getting it all for under 200 Euros per night, a real bargain considering this elegant hotel sits in the center of all the action. The Coliseum is 15 minutes in one direction and the Trevi Fountain is 15 minutes in the other, and all about you are the pleasures and surprises of this ancient city. This hotel defines elegance in the center of Rome and is not to be missed. The furnishings are more modern than romantic and they could use a chair or two for the terrace, but I loved this hotel and would stay here again in a heartbeat. The full breakfast, included in the rate, was delicious with an array of American and Italian dishes served buffet style in the restaurant each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Compromise”
Reviews.Author: berkshire_nomads
Reviews.Content: The key factor here is that I paid less than € 150 B&B for something acceptable in the middle of a Western European capital. There follow a few gripes but I would be surprised to find a similar level of quality in, say, London for twice the price. Good points first - location is fine; pretty central and in an apparently safe area. I didn't eat in the restaurant but I'm told breakfast was good. the room was clean and recently decorated and as I was at the back of the hotel there was no noise from the street. Clean as it was, the room was tiny - the distance for wall to wall seemed less than floor to ceiling. Furthermore there is no desk so I had to work sitting on the bed with the notebook balanced on my knees. The bathroom is also small. I was there for only one night and spent very little time in the room. If you have a heavy schedule and expect to be out a lot this place is great value for money. If you intend to spend a lot of time relaxing or working in the room though you'll soon start to feel very cramped. Most of the rest of our party of ten said they had small rooms too. Regards Paul

Reviews.Title: “Blah hotel - way too expensive”
Reviews.Author: MNDC
Reviews.Content: Pros: * Cleanliness * Location * Breakfast buffet Cons: * Way too expensive, given the quality of the hotel * Very dark rooms with heavy curtains that you can't move aside * No free wireless, and it's difficult to purchase time on their network * No iron is made available to guests - instead you need to hire them to iron your clothes for a hefty fee * No fitness facilities I was sent here by the Hotel Opera Roma, where I had a reservation because they said they were overbooked. I really did not appreciate this bait-and switch.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: Seanie_pc
Reviews.Content: Hello travellers, I have just returned from The Internation Palace, Rome. This wasnt a hotel I researched very well, rather I went with travel agent recommendation. For me, this hotel would be an average hotel in a good location. The rooms are unfortunately decorated in a very outdated fashion which gave it the appearance of being old and shabby even though it clearly was recently done. I found the rooms to be of a good size but with a small window making it very dark. I also found out the in this hotel (maybe others) they do not switch the AC on until may. Using the wall thermostat I could tell the it was somewhere between 25-30 degrees celcius.. Not acceptable temperature for sleeping. The next morning I asked for it to be switched on and I was given a story which a staff member later confirmed as a lie where I was told that guests have complained that the AC was too cold.. In reality they just dont turn it on to keep cost down. I was told to open a window to keep cool, however being on a very busy street it was too noisy with 27/7 traffic and sirens etc. I was moved to a quieter room which was just as nosiy but after being persistent with complaining they switched the AC on.. kind of !! We had breakfast every morning and 2 out of the 3 mornings the Maître de was very poor, not making eye contact, not chat and just pointed you to a dirt table. She spent most of the time standing around while the rest of the staff were falt out and couldnt keep up. As a result of what I would say being understaffed there was serious issues with teh breakfast. We had trouble getting plates and quiet often had broken plates offered, we couldnt get cutlery in general it was just a chaotic scene. No for the positives, the location of this hotel is excellent. 2-3 minutes walk to the main train station, I would say 10 minutes to the Coliseum, 30 mins to the vatican and easily with minutes of all the sites and shopping areas. Would I stay again? probably not ! Would I recommend it ? Maybe but its only ok as a hotel.. Happy travels.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: MOKenzie
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Rome yesterday. So sad to leave Rome behind and back to reality! This hotel was in the perfect location. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a central location for a decent price. Room we stayed in was a standard double. It was small but average for European standards. The bathroom was updated but the shower was the size of a shoe box! If you were to be over weight, you would have problems fitting in! That was the only minus staying here. You can walk everywhere! Just down the road from most of the main sites except the Vatican of course. A few reviews down gives great directions on how to reach important destinations-we printed this review out and it came in handy! Nice but VERY expensive restaurant is attached. We did not go in after looking at the menu prices. There is a wonderful cafe right across the street-We went there twice..once for lunch and once for dinner. Tip: If your room isn't ready upon arrival..there is a large restroom located on the first level in the back. This was a great place to change and wash my face so we could go out an explore until our room was ready. The free internet access was very nice however there was usually a line but it was great to keep in touch with family and friends for free from our hotel. The hotel arranged a ride for us to the airport on our last day. We took the train the first day, but found it to be a tad stressful. The cab was a Mercedes but the ride was a tad scary, very very very fast. It was 50 Euro. Scary but worth it. Front desk staff all knew English-the maids did not understand us but that was the only language barrier we ran into. Overall-great value for a good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Central, excellent service, friendly, very, very clean.”
Reviews.Author: light-traveller
Reviews.Content: Have just stayed at the Eurostars on our first visit to Rome. Hotel in very central, easy to reach and close to all sights. The staff were friendly, helpful and even gave us a detailed map on our arrival. The room we had (double) was large with a small balcony and the bathroom was of a fair size and was very, very clean. Our room was at the front of the hotel, obviously there is traffic noise but that was all part of the experience (it is a capital city after all). There is a Spar shop across and a little up the street which is inexpensive and enables you to stock up with water, reasonably priced wine, beer and other provisions you may need. The area is very safe and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great position and value for money if you find a deal”
Reviews.Author: watties57
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 24-28 March,first time in Rome and thought the siteseeing superb. Location of hotel is excellent,and most main sites within walking distance,you see more and some real hidden gems on foot.Bright ,mild weather overall obviously made walking more enjoyable. Hotel is quite welcoming,communal areas were always clean and room was presented well and clean. Room size was only average size and no view to speak of,but this is city centre so no real problem,i have to say the largedouble bed was one of the most comfortable encountered in a hotel.Breakfast offered very good choice

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: 20somethin
Reviews.Content: Can't really relate to any of the negative reviews here. Decided to pay a little extra to get a standard double room as I was weary from what other reviewers had said about the size of the economy rooms. Standard room was lovely, modern and clean (if maybe a little on the small side). Bathroom was great with excellent shower. Very little noise from outside (although I'd imagine rooms on the road side would have been very noisy!). Excellent location for all the sites. Slightly disappointed that breakfast wasn't included. Generally very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here only if every single hotel in Rome is booked”
Reviews.Author: nameme
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here a few weeks back and we have never stayed in such an odd place! First of all for those not in the know, a french bed is a single bed and is only suitable for two people if both you and your partner work in a chocolate factory owned by a certain Mr Wonka! So we upgraded (at €90) and got ourselves a superier room. Now the 1st room had a cracked and broken toilet seat and so we were begrudgingly given an alternative. The second room was much better as it only had half of the sockets broken and one of us had to lie on the bed if the other had to move around the room!!!!! I found it hard to believe that this hotel was recently renovated by anyone sober. The bathroom had a wonderful feature were the guest had a full length mirror right in front of the toilet........Believe me noone needs to see this! Well if my little tale still hasnt put you off maybe the fact that the beds are damn uncomfortable and that due to the lack of mattress protectors mean that you are sleeping on the bugs and cooties of the previous guests may swing things for you! We ended up staying out all day and only coming back to the hotel to sleep. The location of the hotel was fine, not too far away from the centre of things and handy to get to from the bus station. The day our room wasnt cleaned wasnt in itself a big deal-it just added to the whole experience. Im pretty well travelled and have realistic expections in hotels but this was really bad! I dont think I hate anyone enough to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tiffany Ring--Stolen!! Beware!”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyH80
Reviews.Content: Back in 2006, my wife and I stayed at this hotel for a few days. During our stay in Rome, I bought a Tiffany ring for her; the cost was roughly five thousand dollars. I had to leave Rome one day before my wife for a business trip. That’s when it happened. A member of the staff must have noticed her ring, because while she was out eating dinner that evening the ring was stolen from the room. She had simply forgotten to wear it or put it in the safe. Anyway, upon discovering that the ring was missing, my wife went to reception where she was told that she could not call the police and that she has no proof! The hotel staff intimidated her and told her that she could not report the incident to the police—unbelievable! My wife, who is not a US citizen, was there on a tourist visa which was very difficult to obtain and so she was afraid of jeopardizing her chances for future travel to Europe. I wish I could have been there, but they waited until I was gone and out of the country to make their move! Please make sure you always secure your belongings while staying at any hotel or resort.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: Dretjie
Reviews.Content: We had the best time in Rome. The hotel was perfectly located withing walking distance from all major sites, and the bus going to the Vatican stops right in front of the hotel. The staff are very willing to help with queries. Rooms very modern, recently refurbished and very clean. We'd love to go back someday.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: nippysweety
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. You can walk just about everywhere: Colosseum & Forums; Trevi; Pantheon; Spanish Steps. There is a bus goes from nearby to the Vatican. We were at the back of the hotel so there was no noise from Via Nazionale. The hotel itself, though, isnt really a 4 star by Irish standards. And what was supposedly a superior room made us wonder what the economy ones must have been like. The room was o.k. but no more than that. It was stark and basic. The shower was hand-held and didnt stretch to the hook on the wall. Not very clever! A welcome note from the manager said that tea & coffee making facilities were available on request. This request was made as soon as we arrived to a dour receptionist who glibly said she would try. It never happened. Basic things in the room were slow to be topped up (e.g. toilet rolls/shower gel). The a.c. didnt work but this may have been off due to the time of year. Would we stay there again? Eh......no!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: cris04NYC
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a fantastic choice for Rome! I was actually going to book the other one (Domus Aurea), but the reviews on this one were better, and I wasn't disappointed. I booked with a very low rate, and so I had one of the smaller rooms, but even that one was great: stylish, clean, comfortable, LCD TV, large shower (a surprise in Italy!). The location is also amazing - in the evening, we went to both the Colosseum and Fontana di Trevi to take pictures (less than 10 minutes walking). Had to take the subway twice only, which is less than 5 minutes from the hotel (once to go to the Vatican and once to go the Terma di Caracalla), but got back on foot both times! A plus is that it is 10 minutes from the central station, which has an express train to the Airport, much cheaper than anything else. Finally, the entire staff was very nice and helpful - once I locked my keys inside the luggage, and in less than 5 minutes someone was there to help me break the lock. If you want to be comfortable about booking a great hotel, at an incredible value for money, go for this one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MegaWat0
Reviews.Content: We (family of 4) visited Italy over Christmas in 2007 and stayed in Rome at the Eurostars International Palace. We arrived early Christmas morning, very tired and cranky after our overnight flight from DC...at check in we were told there is nothing available and they would get us a room in a few hours. We went out to the city and explored (which was amazing, it was basically a ghost town early X-Mas morning) then we came back very tired ready to take a nap...we had to wait around another hour or so until 1 of our rooms were ready, the 2nd bedroom wasn't ready for hours later. This was just frustrating being so tired. DON'T EAT BREAKFAST THERE...way too $$ for the assortment, walk to a little bakery nearby. This hotel is in the best location, we walked everywhere. The beds are VERY hard. The rooms were normal size for European standards, only 1 English channel on TV. Very nice little balcony in the rooms and the bathrooms are pretty good size. If I visit Rome again I might try another hotel out...all in all is a pretty decent hotel in a nice location.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Experience overall and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Alperian
Reviews.Content: Great base for our stay. The Hotel staff were friendly and professional. Everything that this hotel said that it would do, it did. The room was a good size and very clean. Two things however: the bar has a very sterile feel and is tacked onto the cafeteria. This is created and run as an afterthought rather than a core hotel amenity. The other is that there are no English-language TV channels in the rooms except for CNN.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Hotwire & Expedia Users”
Reviews.Author: maestro
Reviews.Content: No doubt this hotel has some 4-star rooms, but not for people who book on discount travel sites such as Hotwire or Expedia. In spite of reading the somewhat negative TripAdvisor reviews on the hotel, we couldn’t resist Hotwire’s $230 price and we booked for two nights in late August ’08. My confidence was shaken when we entered the room and found out that the earlier reviewers were spot on. The room has one double bed (not Queen sized) and there is barely enough room to walk around the bed. A gymnast will have little trouble accessing all the room in the tiny closet, but your average soul will struggle. My complaint to the friendly people at the front desk fell on deaf ears “your travel agent requested an economy room”. My best arguments were useless; the hotel was full. We sucked it up and took some comfort in our room’s fine temperature control. It was hot and the air conditioning worked well. Plus and minus: +Nice tastefully decorated bathroom, with a shower, toilet, bidet, and sink. There is a sliding door because there isn’t enough room to for a conventional door. +Quiet room with no sounds from the street below. +Reasonably comfortable bed, I’ve had worse beds at other hotels. +Great location, we walked to and from the Termni train station. +Good lighting for reading in bed. +Small screen plasma TV with English language news channels. +Clean and well maintained public areas like the lobby and washrooms. +Two internet stations (complimentary). +Helpful front desk staff with an excellent command of the English language. -Tiny room with a view of a decrepit courtyard -Insufficient room & lightling to work at your laptop computer -Tiny closet with little room to even stow one’s suitcase.

Reviews.Title: “4 Stars?”
Reviews.Author: PepeTours
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room through Hotwire and prepaid our four night stay. We were given a small room with a bed that was just a little bigger than a single twin bed. My daughter slept on the bed and I slept on the floor. I would have asked for a roll-away bed, but the room was so small you couldn't open it once you rolled it in. Advertising this room as a double room was dishonest. These are single rooms, not doubles! I offered to pay for a larger room, but since I was prepaid they just blew me off. The lobby looked great, but the rest of the hotel upstairs was half-painted. It seems their "construction" was still going on after a couple of years. The hotel is in a good location, but there are dozens of other hotels in the neighborhood that are better. There are other 4 star hotels within a few blocks that looked much nicer. I took a risk in booking with Hotwire and this was my first bad experience with them. But in the end it was the hotel's fault for misrepresenting itself. So, stay at the Best Western (only a block away).

Reviews.Title: “Average but good location”
Reviews.Author: Tracy613
Reviews.Content: When I checked in the bed was missing it's top cover. The mattress resembled the types found in a sofa "hide-a-bed" thin and uncomfortable, the only plus was it's size.
