It was a true double. the room was clean the bathroom was large. I didn't hear my neighbors if I had any. It's location was truly it's best feature as it was walking distance to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Good 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: molly111
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked in the sister hotel Domus Aurea but the air con and shower were not working correctly so I suggested a move to this hotel. They kindly paid for the taxi to transfer us and gave us the same rate so we got a bargain. The room was quite spacious and modern with a flat screen tv, minibar, really big bed. We were on the 5th floor and heard no noise at all. The bathroom was good and the shower was big and powerful. If you come out of the hotel and turn left and then 2nd right you will see the colleseum at the end of the road. There is a brilliant indian restaurant here too where you can sit out. We found the drinks very expensive in Rome and around our hotel - but if you walk around you can get it quite reasonably. The weather at times was unbearable - 39 degrees and 99% humidity - it got too hot to want to walk around by about 2.30. We got up early and were in the colliseum queue for 9.30 which went down in about 10-15 mins. Everywhere is closer than the map looks but if you do get public transport (which we did as it was so hot) a metro/bus ticket for 3 days was good value. There is a bus stop right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms but nice, great location”
Reviews.Author: c1airebear
Reviews.Content: The rooms were VERY small and cramped but clean and comfy. Staff could be a little stroppy but saying that, I would consider staying there again as it's ideally situated for Colloseum.

Reviews.Title: “Pity About The Renovations....”
Reviews.Author: Never2Happy
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant 5 - night stay at this central hotel, polite and helpful staff, clean and tidy rooms spoiled a little by ongoing renovation works starting at 8am each day, not a problem in itself although it would have been good to have been pre-warned about this. Our superior room was fine if unspectacular, it did leave me wondering what exactly made it superior but this is a minor quibble. About a 10 minute walk to most main attractions in one direction, the same to the Termini station in the other, although take advantage of the private car hire service to take you to the airport on your way home, it can be booked at reception 24 hours in advance and at 50 Euros it's cheaper than a taxi and a lot more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “4 star is being a bit generous!!”
Reviews.Author: butterfly1104
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in early March- she checked Trip Advisor and scoffed at my suggestions, this hotel was definitely out of my price range, but she convinced me that it was a four star and not some seedy little shack in some back street (her response to all my ideas!)- the only reason I gave in was because this was my first time going away!... The thing that swayed me was the location- this hotel is CENTRAL to everything- and that's all I was really impressed by. I loved the fact that I could walk to the Colloseum in 10 minutes! Some of the reception staff couldn't be any more helpful and others really couldn't care less!... the reception was always busy and I only ever saw the porter once. The staff can speak English, some better than others!...When we realised we needed an adapter plug, we were told someone would bring one up- a bloke came up- I showed him the adapter I had, he looked at it and threw it on my bed and left the room- not saying a word. We called reception and were told to come down at 8am the following day- the next day nobody knew what we were talking about- the reception staff did not seem to communicate to one another and every time we had an issue- it meant explaining everything all over again- very frustrating!! Yes- eventually we got the plug!!! It's a no smoking hotel- so we ended up standing just outside the doors to smoke at night or sat on the bench just outside the hotel- either way; it didn't create a good impression!! The room itself was okay- we got there and were presented with a double bed- we looked at each other and said "Hell no!"- the maid soon came and seperated the beds, but every morning she'd push them together again!? The decor was very dated and there was virtually no light in the rooms- like those energy efficient bulbs- where you can barely see a thing- maybe it was the dark decor!?... Wasn't impressed at all by that!... My friends throw seemed to have a yellow stain on it and they never changed that the whole time we were there- they just changed the sheets... Additionally, there was no heating and it was often freezing cold in the evenings- just freezing!!!! In the mornings there was no hot water until about 8am- and at about 7-7.30am drilling and banging would commence- it was enough to wake up the dead!!!.... They were doing some building work somewhere in the hotel- the clanging and banging was enough to drive you insane!!... Whilst I was there I couldn't dial out to make an international call- for the whole duration of my stay- I never once was able to call home!!! Everything in the mini bar was crazily priced (as they are) a can of coke for 6 euro's- so we'd go accross the road and buy a can for 65 cents!!... Being pounds and pence kinda gals, even we realised the difference!!! The bathroom was very modern and I have to give it that!... The people were generally friendly in the hotel, and out and about it wasn't too bad- apart from the moody cow in the de SPAR shop across the road, she had issues!!!... She was the unfriendliest person we met. The maid who cleaned our room was really sweet!... but some of the other domestic staff were quite scary looking... We never ate at the hotel- it was overpriced and was full of older people (Americans mostly!). There was a coffee shop across the road- where the staff are so friendly!!... we literally spent every day in the coffee shop!... they are so nice, they all speak English (our Italian is non- existant!- even the little phrase book wasn't any help!).

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: choccy78
Reviews.Content: The hotel we originally booked had double booked so we were moved to this hotel . The staff were lovely and the room was lovely - it was bit small but we spent most of our time sightseeing so we didnt see the need to have a big room. Even though the room was small the bed was massive much bigger than you would normally get on a 4 star european trip ! . The power shower was also very big so they met our expectations of a 4 star. Lots of bathroom freebies including toothbrushes , toothpaste . shower cap , shampoo , conditioner . soap and shower gel. The breakfast was lovely plenty to eat and drink . Lots of pastries , cereals , bread , cheese and fruit . There was a cooked breakfast but that wasnt very nice I wouldnt recommend it. The concierge were very helpful sorting out an adaptor plug , giving directions , and tea and coffee (for free) to our room . We only used the mini bar for water and it wasnt too expensive. It was a bit noisy of a night time although not so noisy you cant sleep and in such a central location what do you expect ? We walked everywhere there was no need for taxis - Termini station is a 5 minute walk, trevi fountain is 10 mins , colleseum is about 15-20 minutes - there is so much to see on every road you wouldnt mind if it took 1 hour ! My advice is take walking shoes and enjoy the sights of Rome. I would stay at this hotel again and would reccomend it for anyone looking for a base in a good location with a good shower and breakfast to start the day and a comfy bed to finish it off !

Reviews.Title: “A bit on the cheap side.”
Reviews.Author: Blondii
Reviews.Content: Like most European 4 star hotels, it really isn't. I would say it is closer to a 3 star. The location was very convenient though. There are 2 distinct parts of this hotel, the older part and the newer part. The rooms in the newer part are nicer. I would not book an economy room because they were very tiny. The reception upgraded us to a superior room after we complained. Our room in the older section was okay, but the furniture was a bit cheap. We had an overabundance of closet space for some reason. The bath was not exceptional. The toilet was right by the sink and towel rack! The shower head kept falling down. We were lucky to get one small bar of soap a day along with a few tissues in one of those travel packs. The TV was cheesy and there was no clock in the room. We noticed that the carpet in the common hallways was a bit dirty. The breakfast buffet had a large selection, but the staff had a hard time keeping it stocked on the weekend. We were disappointed that the hotel business room was out of order all 5 nights we were there. So we had to find an internet point a few streets away. I will say that the staff was friendly and helped us by ordering taxis. Overall, an average hotel, not worthy of a 4 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: Butters063
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a major disappointment. Nice reception area and in a central location but the good things stop there. The rooms are small and due to the location of our room, we hardly had any natural light. We had to keep the lights on during the day. The hotel boasts air conditioning as a feature. We went in March and the aircon did not work. The room was very stuffy. When we asked about it we were told that it was out of season and therefore aircon was not available. There was building work going on in the hotel which started each day at 7.30am (and one morning at 6.30am). Drilling, banging, shouting and cutting stone with an electronic saw were every day occurances. We asked reception to ask the work to start at a reasonable hour and they ignored it. Very disappointed. Wouldn't recommend it or go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Loved Rome”
Reviews.Author: KelKel32
Reviews.Content: ROME The Journey We flew with Bmi from Birmingham to Championo the flight was on time and leg room was ok , from Championo we caught the Leonard express to Grande termini station (central Rome) from the airport station which is easily accessible from the luggage collection point down an escalated to the lower floor. This direct service takes around 25 mins and runs every half an hour; tickets cost approx 11 euros each way, tickets can be purchased at machines on platforms or at the many ticket booths. The Train departs from plate form 2 (Best to ask at ticket booth , incase this has changed) Remember to get your ticket stamped by one of the yellow ticket machines before boarding. We found this a very easy and cheap way to get into Rome the train wasn’t to busy and we managed to get a seat. We also used the train on our return to get back to the airport again no problems brought ticket at the station and arrived on time to catch the flight home. Once at Grande Termini Station we had a short walk on foot to the Eurostars international Hotel, (exit the station and you will see a large area where the buses and taxi’s stop, to get to the hotel you need to walk directly past this area towards the Piazza Navona square and fountain the road Via Nazionale is just of this square, this is a busy main road with many shops, restaurants and bars, most major sites can be reached by foot although there is a very good bus service which is easy to use and stops outside the hotel (stop opposite hotel for Vatican area) – tickets can be brought at the many newsagent booths along the street. The Hotel The Eurostars has recently been renovated to a high standard of décor the reception area is very grande, the staff were friendly and helpful, the room was clean, quiet and the bed was comfy. (We did request a quiet room on a high floor – and that’s what we got!) Tea and coffee trays are available via reception just give them a bell and it will be delivered to your room (no charge) We didn’t eat at the hotel so no comment there, defiantly recommend the café directly opposite the hotel they served good food, there was a happy hour every evening with a large variety of free nibbles, worth a visit! Places of Interest The main suggestion I would give any 1st timer to Rome would be on your 1st day take a red tour bus from Termini Station , you can travel all round the city getting on and off where every you wish (even if you decide not to get off the journey takes just over 2 hours) the ticket is valid all day and it costs around 12 – 15 euros, your provided with ear phones and have the option of listening to a interesting commentary, this bus is well worth the money and gives you a brilliant idea where all the sites are in relation to the hotel – if we had done this on our 1st day, instead of are last we wouldn’t have walked around searching for the Colossum for an 1 hour! Another tip I would recommend is if possible choose to visit the Vatican museum on a Wednesday morning whilst the pope is conducting his weekly mass in St Peters Square he normal appears around 10.30, when we arrived (via bus caught from directly opposite the hotel, another option would be to do the red tour bus on this day as it stops directly outside) St Peters square was busy with hundreds of people, we went straight to the Vatican museum (around a 10 min walk from the square) and were able to walk straight in with no queuing! The Vatican museum is well worth a visit we are both in are twenties and found the whole experience really interesting. On leaving the museum the queue was right back to the square with really long waiting times, we even got to see the pope finishing his mass! Also I’d say if you’re planning to have lunch here, walk a little further into the city and save your self some money as the café’s restaurants right by the square were charging silly prices, for not very nice food. Shopping There is a nice selection of shops surrounding the hotel on the Via Nazionale, including shoes, clothing trinkets etc – There is also a Spar shop opposite the hotel – handy for a bottle!! There are more well know designer shops including Gap, Gucci, Zara etc in the surrounding streets of St Peters Square worth a look although the prices aren’t that cheaper to the UK. Also the Grande Termini Station has a lower level of shopping, and a Food Hall which is also worth a look , the restaurants in the food hall serve dinner in the evening also. Other Info Rome isn’t over priced when it comes to eating out, you can get a 3 course meal for around 30 euros, all buses cost the same for any route 1 euro. Take a good pair of walking shoes, especially as this hotel is so central to everything on foot. The hotel reception were really helpful, ask them for tea and coffee and they will delivery it to your room (kettle, tea, milk etc which is free), they were also helpful when it came to bus info i.e. which bus number we needed etc There is a Tourist Information booth 500 yards to the left, on the opposite side of the road to the hotel – which is handy for picking up free maps and other info We didn’t experience any problems while in Rome, it’s generally a safe place Obviously keep all purses/wallets in a safe place (not in back pockets) as there are pick pockets around especially at busy attractions like the Trevi Fountain (which is defiantly worth a visit!) There is a free mini safe in the room for passports etc. Have a Good Trip!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tidy, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Anon_Traveller_UK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is central and within easy walking distance of most attractions. It was very clean/ tidy, the staff were helpful, and there is internet access within the hotel. The room service was of a good standard, and the hotel was fairly good value for money. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: F4monty
Reviews.Content: Four days in Rome and there are plenty of reasons to question whether Italians are any good at customer service. One of the few exceptions - the staff of the Eurostars International Palace. Always welcoming, friendly and helpful, they were a pleasant change to the often rude and abrupt types who manned the museums, cafes and bars. We booked a superior room - reasonably spacious, modern decor, very comfortable and clean, bathrobe and slippers. Any complaints? The air conditioning was a bit vigorous but we got it sorted promptly and the view from the window was of a courtyard undergoing renovations! Breakfast was OK but nothing special - I find it bizarre that a country famed for its coffee and a four-star hotel uses a crappy Nescafe machine to serve up hot drinks. The location on Via Nazionale is very good indeed - a short walk from the Termini station and not far to the major sites. You can easily get to the Trevi fountain, the Coliseum and so on by foot although the Trastevere and Vatican are better reached by bus or metro. There are plenty of shops on the street too and restaurants abound. Rome, though, is a tourism factory. I've never been to a place where there are so many tourists - queues and crowds are everywere. And beware the hawkers. We fell for an apparent con at the Vatican - illegal tour guides who say they can get you in and beat the queues. It all seems very genuine until the police do a spot check and the realisation dawns that all is not well. There are plenty of these at the Coliseum too. Sometimes you may get in without problems but be warned...

Reviews.Title: “Great Base to Explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: Stig_8
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Eurostars International Palace for 4 nights and were very impressed with the hotel overall. We arrived at Rome Ciampino airport about 11:00 a.m. and got a ‘Terravision’ coach from the airport to the Termini train station which took about 40 minutes. Once out of the station head for the Plaza Della Repubblica and turn left down Via Nazionale and the hotel is on the left hand side. It was about a 15 minute walk from the station to the hotel. The desk staff were very helpful, giving up information and maps and even upgraded our room. Our room was at the rear of the hotel and overlooked the next building. But we were glad we were not in one of the front rooms overlooking the main road as this may have been noisier due to the traffic. We were upgraded to a larger room which was sufficient for us but the smaller rooms looked at bit cramped. The room was very tidy and clean and cleaned once a day by the room staff. The bathroom was also in good condition with a lovely shower (just what you need after a long day sight seeing). We stayed with breakfast included, which was served from 7:00 to 10:30 a.m., which meant you could have a lie in and still get breakfast. Breakfast was the usual mixture of continental and English (cold meats, cheeses, scrambled eggs, bacon) along with fresh fruit, pastries and cakes. We would make full use of this and have a large breakfast to last us until afternoon. We didn’t have a dinner in the hotel restaurant as we ate out in the evenings. There are plenty of restaurants in the area in you are willing to explore the side streets off Via Nazionale. I would say that the hotel was in a good location as you can walk to many of the sights and there was a bus service which ran passed the hotel. The service we received from the staff was good. If we returned to Rome we would definitely stay at the Eurostars International Palace again as it is a excellent base to explore Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place”
Reviews.Author: johnsodz
Reviews.Content: The International Palace was a nice place. First location. -Great location it is a ten minute walk to the Colosseum. It is also a few minute walk from the metro which can take you to the Roma Termini or the Vatican or any place else. We did a lot of walking, it was tiresome but doable. We even walked to the Roma Termini -20 minutes. There are several great restaurants near the hotel as well. There is also a grocery store across the street. This was wonderful. We bought fruit there which was great after coming from Egypt. It was also a great place to get water and snacks. Breakfast- we did have breakfast included with our stay. It was across the street at the cafe, but that was no big deal. It was a good meal and it kept us going until lunch. I thought it was nice to just get up and go across the street and not worry about going someplace else. Staff - very nice to us. We lost our key and they replaced it without a problem. We even had a slight plumbing issue in our room (stay away from the heater/rack on the walls in the bathroom) and they were very gracious about what happened. There was a small room with two computer where you could use the Internet. Room- We stayed in one of the upgraded rooms. It was a nice size with a large bathroom. It was also away from the street. We looked out onto the courtyard, which was not a nice view, but it did not bother us. They were upgraded the hotel while we were there with paint and such. You only get a few English channels on the TV but that did not surprise me. I have not stayed someplace that has a ton of English channels outside the US yet.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Customer!”
Reviews.Author: fellowtravelerUSA
Reviews.Content: Quiet. Clean. Good bed. Efficient staff. Excellent location. Thanks to TripAdvisor reviewers for recommending this gem! Thanks to the hotel staff for mailing the clothes I left to me!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good”
Reviews.Author: millomite
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome with a group of eleven people to watch the Rugby Union International. The hotel was clean, efficient and in a good state of repair. It is very close to most of the major tourist attractions and the main station (Termini). The reception desk will also get you taxis within five minutes. What was not so good was the bar closing at eleven o'clock despite the reception desk saying it would be open and there was no hot water one morning. The rooms at the front of the hotel are very noisy from the traffic and one of the couples in our party had to move because of it. We didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on the food but the cafe across the road called doveralu (I think) serves a good breakfast with great coffee. A word of warning, if you try to use the cash machine like we did at Banco Roma near the hotel it is likely that your bank will immediately cancel your cards because of the number of stolen cards used there. One of our group also had his wallet stolen so keep valuables in a safe place.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: day1420
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, great location to many sites, helpful staff, beds were extremely small, could not have stayed more than 1 night or would have had to upgrade to more expensive room with larger bed. Bed was maybe 3" wider than a TWIN size. My fiancée weighs about 170 lbs, and I'm a petite 100, and we barely fit without falling off! Other than the bed situation, this was a great location. Our tour guide met us here and in a one day walking tour we were able to see to the Forum, Colusseum, Spanish Steps, and Trevi Fountain. For ladies looking for a bargain...at night street vendors come out and you can pick up great "replica" handbags, but watch out they are always being chased away by the police.

Reviews.Title: “What a 4* Hotel Should Be - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: steampunkcat
Reviews.Content: We stopped at the Eurostars International Palace in Feb 2008. The location is EXCELLENT - on one of the main roads in the very centre of Rome. All the major sights are under 10-15 minutes' walk away, and it is not even a 5-10 minute walk to the train station/shuttle bus pickup points. In Rome, is is common for hotels to call themselves 3/4* and really not be anything like it. This was DEFINITELY a 4* hotel, on par with a very good Holiday Inn/Travelodge. The reception was upmarket and welcoming, speaking Italian, English, French and no doubt many other languages. The lifts were a bit small but ok. The entrance hall is lovely. The rooms are clean and well-decorated, with pristine bathrooms. Aside from one morning with a hot water problem, everything went like clockwork. We were on the 3rd floor, and heard no traffic noise, however because of Rome's horrendous traffic/driving you did get about 3-4 ambulances go past a night, which I quite happily was not woken up by. The TV has about 5 italian channels, 2 English, 1 German and 1 French. There is a minibar, laundry services and the room is cleaned daily. The breakfast was VERY good - a buffet with hot food, fruit, tea/coffee and juices, pastries, bread, meats, cheeses and more. Overall this was a VERY GOOD to EXCELLENT hotel, and I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: hw711
Reviews.Content: We ended up having to stay an extra day in Rome cause we missed our flight. Booked Eurostarts on Expedia at last minute for $109. What a bargain it was. The hotel is really nice, on par with the 4 star Trilussa Palace Hotel we stayed at during the same trip. It's a very clean hotel. My only complains are the shower, the bed, and weird noises at nice. There is no shower curtain, only a glass panel that covers half of the tube width so it's impossible to keep the water from going all over the bathroom. The beds felt a little cheap (maybe we were just really spoiled by the super comfortable bed at Trilussa Palace Hotel) but acceptable. And there is some weird construction noise going on throughout the night. Not sure if it was coming from the hotel (they were rennovating the center courtyard) or outside. The hotel is a 5-10 min walk from the Termini. It's on Via Nazionale which is a big street with lots of buses and seemed pretty safe to walk around at night. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant but it looked REALLY trendy and fancy. Probably would if we had more time to spend there. I spent a lot of time researching on hotels in Rome before I went. WIth US dollars not worth very much against the Euros, it's not easy to find a place in Rome that nice but won't break your wallet. If you want something that's cheap but not old/crappy, this is definitely the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Noodles1000UK
Reviews.Content: Just come back, Stayed 3 nights at this hotel. The location is brilliant, Could not fault anything really only the Bar was none existant, Dont think i ever seen it open but not a problem as there are many places on the door step ! Rooms imaculate, cleaned every day and was always emaculate every time we came back in the afternoon, Mini bar refreshed every day. There is a TV in the room but the only English chanel is BBC World News and CNN ! But you wont be watching TV anyway !!! 100% Recommended. Rooms very nicely decorated, Bathroom fully tiles with Marbel Sinks ect, looks amazing. Bed was a good kingsize, table, TV, Mini Bar & Free Safe ! All in All Very Very Pleased ! Oh... And what a gorgeous city !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: swickle8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in the middle of January. Getting to the hotel: We flew from JFK to Flumicino Airport and took a car service to the hotel, the ride was around 30-40 minutes. We used Rome Shuttle Limousine,www.romeshuttlelimousine.com. They were great, our flight was actually an hour early and our driver was right there waiting for us with a sign and for our return trip he was in the hotel lobby waiting. The cost was 35 euro each way and it was worth it not to have to lug our bags around. The Hotel: The hotel is located half way down Via Nazionale. This is the best thing about the hotel. The location can’t be beat. The entrance and lobby of the hotel are very nice and the staff was helpful at check-in. We arrived before the 2pm check-in and our room wasn’t ready, but they kept our bags for us so we could wander around the city until check-in. The Hotel Room: We had booked a superior room, which had plenty of space. Based on how people described the standard room I think the upgrade was worth it. There was a big bed, mini bar, safe, tv, and a decent size bathroom with a big tub. The bed was on the hard side, but it was bearable. We were on the 3rd floor on the Nazionale side and didn't have any problems with it being too noisy. Food: They had a buffet breakfast at the hotel each morning, which wasn't included in our booking price. It was 15 Euro per person, which seemed a little steep, so we decided to pass on that. Instead would either get pastries, pizza, or pannis at the snack bars near the hotel or near where we were sightseeing and it was a lot cheaper. We typically spent 5 Euro apiece for breakfast including a drink. We ate at the pizza place Ricci Est Est Est around the corner from the hotel. It was recommended by a lot of people, but it didn't really blow me away I would only recommend it if you don’t want to travel too far from the hotel for dinner. We also walked south down Via Dei Serpenti and found several good restaurants, unfortunately I can’t remember there names, they were probably a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel. We also went to an Irish pub on Serpenti on the way back, which was enjoyable. We used the Rick Steves and Lonely Planet guide books to find most of our restaurants. Transportation around the city There are plenty of buses right in front of the hotel and across the street. The 64 goes to most of the sights, but it’s typically really crowded. The 40 is the express for the 64 and was a lot less crowded, that stop was a little further down from the hotel. The 60 is another express bus that goes to the Forum and Colloseum, again that bus is further down from the hotel, but not too far. The Repubblica subway stop is about a 5 minute walk and the Termini station is another few minutes past that station. I preferred the buses when traveling around especially since they were right by the hotel and the subway doesn’t go to as many places as the buses. I had read a lot of things about pickpockets on the buses and subways, but I never felt unsafe. I think if you stay alert, keep your bag close to you, and not make it too obvious that you’re a tourist you’ll be fine. We had purchased the Roma pass, which comes with a 3 day transportation pass good for buses and subway (it also includes entrance to 2 sights (Colloseum, various museums) for 20 Euro. I would highly recommend this pass, we definitely got our money’s worth from it. We also walk to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish steps and some other sights, but I would recommend the buses since you’ll already be doing tons of walking once you get where you’re going. Sights Some of the must sees for me were: the Colloseum, Forum, Vatican Museum (get the audio tour), St. Peters, Scavi Tour at St. Peters, and the Appian Way. All of these places are easily accessible by bus or subway and I highly recommend them all. We never waited in a single line anywhere we went. Going in the off season was great. We also got really lucky with the weather. I believe the temperatures are generally mild around this time, but rain can be a problem. It was sunny and 60 everyday we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless and well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Raymondocanuck
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a main street within walking distance to all of the sights in the historic area of Rome. It is very close to a subway station and there are many restaurants and shops close by. We stayed for four days (in Economy Rooms) and although the rooms were small by North American Standards they were spotless and very comfortable. Check in was seamless and the staff extremely friendly and professional. Although located on a busy street our room on the first floor was very quiet in the evenings and overnight. It is a four star and deservedly so. You cannot go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Galtech
Reviews.Content: Just got back from seeing the New Year in while staying in Rome. The Eurostars International Palace is highly recommended. The hotel is easy to find from Termini Station (I'd also recommend Terravision for bus transfer from Ciampino to Termini for 14Euro return). The hotel is only ten minutes walk from Termini, although there's many taxis if you have lots of luggage. Despite the overly grand reception area, the rest of the hotel is standard decor, with everything clean and tidy. Although I didn't have many dealings with the staff, they seemed to be professional and helpful. Our room was slightly on the small side, but when there's so much to see in Rome who cares about that!! The room has a reasonably priced mini bar, safe, TV with CNN and BBC news channels in English. The bathroom was clean and looked fairly new, with all you'd expect hair dryer, shaver point, toiletries etc. We had breakfast included, which was faultless. A continental style buffet (croissants, rolls, bread, (doughnuts for breakfast!!), cereal, fresh fruit, cold meats, fruit juices tea and coffee) where you could eat as much as you wanted before heading out for the day. The best thing about this hotel is its location. Ten minutes walk to the colliseum, roman forum, Trevi fountain, and about 20 mins to the spanish steps or Pantheon. The Vatican is walkable too, but that takes a good hour. Less than five minutes walk, on the same street as the hotel is Republicca metro station which has direct trains to the Vatican. There's also busses available from next to the hotel too. Overall, this hotel made it very easy to explore Rome as it provides easy access to all the major sights. I'd definitely recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “International palace Rome”
Reviews.Author: beRed
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel for its price range - we seen many other 4 star rated hotels that looked old and chabby. Although there are better hotels in Rome, they come with price tag to match. We stayed on 4th floor facing main road - room was a good size, you could hear some traffic noise, but not enough to keep you awake. 5mins walk from coluseum and Trevi fountain(tip:for Trevi use the road tunnel as a short cut). Beautiful city. Nearly every site is within walking distance - We walked to vatican from hotel, took us about 30mins at a leisurely pace. Romans where the friendliest city folks I have ever met(even the taxi drivers), which came as a big surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base, lack of communication”
Reviews.Author: zinedine5
Reviews.Content: Quality position, off the plane at Fiumicino Airport straight on the Leonardo De Vinci Express (11 Euro each way) and a 10 minute walk from the station to the hotel which is central to visit all the famous sights of Rome, the hotel was clean but beware that you definatly check that you have booked your breakfast when booking your room due to us finding out whilst in the the lift in 4 differant languages that no meals are served in the hotel and that you have to be escorted accross the road to a local cafe without any word from reception on our arrival that this was going to happen and when you get to the cafe that you weren,t allowed any breakfast if you book through Expedia thus us having a ding dong with the hotel staff to explain we didn,t book through Expedia but Hotels.com and the receptionist saying "Same thing" and shrugging as though weve got your dosh hardest what you going to do about it attitude . This was a shame as the hotel and everything around it was lovely and I would recommend to anyone and that our inconvinience was a one off.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...would return!”
Reviews.Author: Singa
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for 3 nights at the end of September. We flue from Dublin to Flumicino Airport and caught the Leonardo Express to Termini station in central Rome (€11 single -non stop journey, easily accessible from airport!) We exited Termini station and kept left to the Piazze Del Repubblica, look out for the fountain and old basilica, the Via Nazionale road is just off this square down by McDonalds (see my photos). It was about a 10 min walk to the hotel from Termini, but there is a taxi stand just outside the Termini building. THE HOTEL is located half way down the Nazionale on the left hand side just opp the Spar shop (great wee shop that sells everything including wine!) Entranceway to the hotel is a massive gold gilded wooden door, lovely foyer and helpful check in staff! I had booked a superior room, plenty of room and wardrobe space, double bed, mini bar, aircon, tv, bathrobe/slippers etc. No probs with the noise from the street below! Only neg point was the TV had only got 2 english speaking channels MTV and CNN! Not that we spent that much time in our room we were too busy out exploring. There is no restaurant to this hotel, but I knew this from previous TA reviews. We didn’t bother with the breakie in the hotel recommended café across the road, instead had some fruit in our room or went down to the café opp Bata shoes (as recomnded in prev TA review) and got a coffee and pastry. Remem if you eat standing at the counter with the rest of the locals its way less expensive than sitting down at a table. They also sell the tics for the bus €1 per journey, the bus to the Vatican is Nr64/40 and you catch it opp the hotel or at this coffee shop. EATING OUT – We dined in “New Mary Meeting” – very nice (out of hotel, 1st road on the left) also “Est Est Est” same road – very nice…bit cramped, but food good! Down by the Trevi Fountain area there is a side street and we found “La Rosa” restaurant, excellent food, best meal! In the same side street we found another restaurant “Piccola Arancio” excellent also! The Vatican area tends to be a bit of a rip off for food, but we found a lovely wee café opp the Vatican Station in Cavalleggeri “Bon Caffe”, have never seen such mouth watering pastries! The shopping on Nazionale is pretty good, seems to be an area that’s trying to regenerate itself! Up by Repubblica can be a bit dodgy with drunks at night, but saying that we had no problems. We went to “Flann O’Briens” the supposed Irish bar in Nazionale, not an irish man in sight! The staff showed no interest in our custom, quite rude really, so we took ourselves across the road to the bar opp the hotel where there was a 1 piece band on for a bit of entertainment! There is no bar in the hotel, found this a bit strange at first! I can recommend the Hop On Hop Off Bus Red101, very good way of seeing the city. Rome is compact enough to walk around, the 101bus was a good way of getting your bearings! We booked Angel tours for our Vatican museum trip €45 saturday morn 3hr tour, straight to top of queue - saved us queue'n for hrs in a mile long line!! I would stay in this hotel again for the location, the rooms were nice and the staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base to Experience Rome”
Reviews.Author: testla
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here from 26th August as the first part of a 15 night stay in Italy. Arrived at Fiumicino and had pre-booked a shuttlebus that whisked us to the hotel in no time. Arrived at approx 7:30pm. Must admit were expecting a tiny room but were pleasantly surprised at ths size of the room and the bathroom. Easy to use safe in the room. The only moan about the room was the lack of a view as the windows were chin-height and looked across into an office block across the street. Rome was in the high 30's when we arrived and the air-conditioning worked very efficiently, although we only had it on low at night. The check-in staff were very welcoming. We were aware that there was refurbishment of the hotel and on our first morning someone kindly took us to the cafe across the road where we had our buffet breakfast. Huge choice of food for breakfast served by smiling staff in the restaurant. The only cause for complaint was the assumption that diners at breakfast needed to listen to MTV and there was even a projected image of the programme in the restaurant. Rome itself was wonderful and I think in the 5 days we covered most of the sights plus a few not on the tourist route - Janiculum Hill, Aventine, fantastic wanderings in Trastevere and Testaccio. Found some great restaurants, especially the oldest pizza restaurant in Rome, Est Est Est, which happened to be in a street next to the hotel. Will definitely visit Rome again in the future and would have no hesitation in staying at the International Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Eurostar International Palace”
Reviews.Author: travellingteacher149
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brilliant. I spent three days here with a friend, everything went fine. They have two internet terminals which isn't quite good. Its a good 10 minute walk to the Colliseum, 20 mins to Spanish steps. Close to train station up Via Nationale. We were on the 3rd floor and the room wasn't cleaned until 3pm, its not fair to base our experience on this. I would stay here again however it was quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Failte go Roma”
Reviews.Author: PaddytheIrishman
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the first week of August and the hotel was undergoing some refurbishment (although it was not obvious and no workmen were ever visible). As a result there was no bar or restaurant - this did not really bother us as there is a restauraunt just across the road and an Irish bar within stumbling distance just up the street. We wanted to explore the city anyway and found some lovely places to eat between the Trevi Fountain and the Piazza Navona. The hotel was an excellent base from which to see the city, and we tramped all over it for the week. Staff were very friendly and helpful and the room was comfortable and clean - we only stayed in it between 2.00 am and 9.00 am anyway so it was perfect. All things going according to plan, we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel in renovation”
Reviews.Author: didcrywolf
Reviews.Content: 46 via Nazionale is not a place to show up with a private car. We learned fairly quickly as the driving lanes are only reserved for taxis and buses. You need to drive perpendicular to the street and hope to find a spot. The hotel is in a perfect place for tourists, close to bus tour terminal but take a room on the courtyard side as the street side is very noisy. We took a triple but the room above us had a major leak in the bathroom and we spent three days telling the MGMT to fix it or move us and they choose the third alternative which was to do nothing... I Stopped wearing socks after two days walking on wet carpet... The price for the room though was right, There was no breakfast available on the premises and the prepaid internet cards were outrageously expensive at 20 Euros for 10 hours... This is at best a 2star until they smarten up. Room service had pasta but the salad had no dressing and even though we called room service they didn't bother sending it up. Very uneven service with bellhop service working 12 hours max.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: KnightsHols
Reviews.Content: When we stayed, the hotel was undergoing some work. This meant that there was no bar or restaurant - usually this would have really annoyed me, but as we were in such a great city it made no difference. The room was a little small but lovely and comfortable. The hotel was just a great base to see the city and a comfortable bed after a long day of walking, eating, drinking and seeing the city. There is a nice bar across the road and all the sites and shops are within easy reach. I am sort of glad there was no restaurant available as it meant we explored, and found some great places to eat!! very romantic!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Will certainly use this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: Gawdy
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a three night's stay at this hotel, it was great. Yes the rooms are a little small, the beds are firm and there is building work going on. However, the rooms were immaculate(we had three), well stocked and comfortable. I did book standard rooms so I imagine that we had larger beds than the economy rooms. The staff were pleasant and helpful and I didnot find the renovation work intrusive. I have stayed in two other hotels in Rome and would definitely stay here again because of its central location. Have breakfast in one of the small cafes - remember it is cheaper if you stand. There is everything you need around the hotel- including a super little supermarket just across the road.- you can buy lovely fresh food if you chose to picnic at some point Ask the staff and they wil direct you to local restaurants in the streets around the hotel, these serve food other than the tourist menu.There were six of us in our group , (mixed ages) and we all thought this was a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central to everything”
Reviews.Author: Yelm100
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here in March. A wonderful room with a huge comfy bed and beautiful marble bathroom. We had a little sitting room with a mini-fridge, two tables and a couple of chairs. The rooms are large for European rooms but smallish-to-average for American rooms (I didn't really care either way.) The lobby has newspapers in several languages and a little room with 2 computers for internet use. Via Nazionale is sort of a blah street; not many restaurants or bistros, but Rome is so tightly knit that you can walk anywhere (the Vatican is about 45 minutes walking) and the metro has a station right near the hotel. Unfortunately, while we were at the hotel, the dining room and kitchen were being renovated, so we didn't get a chance to try their food. Fortunately, there is a grocery directly across the street with anything you could want. And, fortunately, Rome has a million great places to eat!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but service is very unfriendly...”
Reviews.Author: citygirl-7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, and were disappointed with the way we were treated. With the exception of bellhop that brought us to our room upon arrival, most of the staff was unaccommodating and unfriendly. They almost acted as though we were putting them out when we would pop by the front desk and ask a question. They certainly didn't seem to cater to their guests, at least not to us. The room was very nice; however, we had an ongoing issue with the shower drain. The shower basin would fill up if you didn't turn the water off on/off between washing your hair, etc. It seemed ridiculous to deal with such an issue, considering the fact that we were paying $300 USD/ night. We did inform the front desk, and they allegedly sent in maintenance crew to repair it, but we noticed no difference. The location was great though. It was centrally located next to everything that we wanted to do in a short stint in Rome. Loved Rome, and would love to go back, but it would be hard to convince me to stay at this hotel again...

Reviews.Title: “Not For Me”
Reviews.Author: StevenNW3
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights here, and this hotel was NOT for me. Yes, it was centrally situated, but that was about it. First, non of the facilities were available as there are big refurbishment buliding works going on. Not mentioned at all on Expedia website. There was dust billowing around reception and the hall, with banging and thumping all day. Large parts of the hotel were cordoned off by large plastic sheets. But even if this wasn't going on, the room was awful. It was like a shoe box. It was soul less and quite depressing. It did nothing to enhance the 'Rome experience'. It actually detracted from it. I had a double room with one double bed (hard as a rock), a small wardrobe and a small table with a TV. That was it. I had to squeeze past the foot of the bed and the table to get to the window (with no view other than a wall) to pull the curtains. It really was a room to spend no time in whatsoever. I dread to think what the single rooms are like. The bathroom was worse. It was about 7 foot by 2 foot. It had a shower at one end, then a loo and a tiny basin. There was no room to lay out any items such as shampoo, soap, shaving cream etc. so I had to keep these in my case! It was so small I had to walk into the bedroom to dry myself down. It was so tiny there wasn't a door on it from the bedroom so it was pretty much open plan. It felt like being in a space capsule. I know Rome hotel rooms are notoriously small, but this for a 4 star was ridiculous. I also found it very noisy - people clanging their doors shut, running up and down the corridors etc. It was about the size of a train sleeper berth. Would I stay here again? No. There has to be far better hotels in Rome. I stayed here in the middle of a 2 week trip to Sorrento, and I coudn't wait to get back there to my lovely hotel - the Belair.

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: MichaelN66
Reviews.Content: You can never know what you are going to get but, with the help of the reviews I read on Trip Advisor, we made a great choice. I stayed there with a wife and two Kids 13 and 17. I gave up another 4 star luxury hotel reservation at the last minute to be closer to all the things we were there to experience and glad we did. The Hotel is well located to all the major sites and very convenient to Termini both for arrivals, as we came in from Paris by train, and day trips. The Hotel lobby is smaller than photos would lead you to beleive but all areas are nicely done and kept VERY clean by diligent attendants. With limited access and a watchful doorman, the Hotel felt very secure. Free Internet access was available but only two stations made for some lengthy waits while people checked ALL their mail ,so checking onto a departing flight was more tedious than I would hope, but it is there and it is free. The rooms were very reasonable in size, clean and comfortable ( the beds could use some help ) The shower was great with plenty of room and pressure. They provided all of the standard amenities plus some "in case you forgot" items.The staff were very pleasant, professional and helpful with tours and information. The rates were good. Note: A better rate was available by booking direct ( We could have had a Superior room for the same price we paid for standard rooms). The restaurant was closed while we were there but they had made arrangements with the restaurant across the street (Doveralu) where the food was excellent and the atmosphere livley. The prices were good compared to most places and the staff there equally friendly. Great Pizza and a nice place for an eveneing Gelato which my kids appreciated. The Hotel is undergoing some improvments, such as the courtyard, which should be very nice when done. It provided no inconvenience to our stay. Our rooms were located down a side street and with the double windows were very quiet . The AC worked great. All in all we had a wonderful stay and would stay again. I will post tips for tours on the message board / forum especially a 4 star guide for the Vatican. .

Reviews.Title: “Find Something Else”
Reviews.Author: SDteach126
Reviews.Content: July 2007 - Just came back from a Gate1 Italy trip and stayed 4 nights at this hotel. Bathroom door broke, toilet broke and no hot water all within the first hour of checking in. Took several hours to get all issues resolved and change rooms. Hotel staff rude, unfriendly, and indifferent. New room had stained bed sheets, cracked bath, and un-vacuumed floor. Beds are smallest beds I've ever seen and the most uncomfortable encountered ever. Terrible hotel and way over priced. There are far too many choices in Rome to ever settle for this.

Reviews.Title: “I am sure there are better options”
Reviews.Author: integrity1913
Reviews.Content: Hmmmmmmmm. The location is EXCELLENT. The hotel looks good on the outside and the inside. The people working at the front were okay-- some were nicer than others but that's just basic human nature and not necessarily specific to the hotel. We were initially placed in the room facing the front. I had read all of the reviews and thought that "it could not be that bad." My mistake for not listening to the advice of others because it was HORRIBLE. I could not sleep. The noise was truly umbearable. We asked be moved to a quieter room and we were moved immediately. Unfortunately, when we returned to the hotel after sightseeing, the room that we were moved to was tiny (which I would have been okay with) but the bed was also smaller. I traveled with my mother and on the first night we slept in the double bed with no problem but on the second night we were both falling out of the bed. I asked if the bed was smaller and they insisted that it was not. There responses were so annoying because I could clearly tell that this bed was smaller and I even had photos as well as the experience of falling out in the middle of the night. Any other hotel would have moved us immediately. I met with the manager and explained the problem to him. He insisted the bed was the same even though I had pictures to show the difference. Anyway, he had the maintanence man come up and measure the bed (wasting valuable sightseeing time). The measurement was not really useful because they did not measure the initial bed that we slept in. ON TOP OF THIS, the beds are SOOOOO hard. Inspite of the fact that I had the issue with the small bed vs the larger bed, I would say that the fact that the beds are hard is enough of a reason not to stay here. Yes, firm beds can be good for your back but beds that feel like you are lying on brick cannot possible be good for you. There are alot of hotels in the area, I would check others first. I also stayed at the Starhotels Michelangelo (Florence-- this hotel is excellent and I believe they have hotels in Rome) and the Sheraton Golf (Rome) please check those reviews as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Padare
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel located centrally in Rome. Rooms are a little small but well decorated. The hotel faces a busy road so ask for a non-road facing room if you can. Staff are friendly & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “unahppy with my stay”
Reviews.Author: larson82uk
Reviews.Content: I just came back from this hotel today, and I would like to say before I write my review I am in no way a picky traveler but I expect what I pay for. I booked the superior deluxe double as it was our wedding anniversary but I got only what I can describe as a low quality standard, we had twin beds pushed together which were hard (even though I had requested a double bed and the manager emailed me to confirm I would get a double) The mini fridge was broke and they told me they couldn't fix or replace it. I had no make up mirror, the view was over a courtyard or should we say rubbish/building tip. My room hadn't been cleaned upon arrival and had someones makeup powder over the floor which remained there for my 4 day stay. There was no eating facilities and were notices in the hotel applogising for the inconvenience as they were doing some work, but yet this wasn't stated prior to booking on the internet and we still had a leaflet telling us breakfast was available from 7am-10am but when we went to the restaurant there wasn't anything at all available. We paid a lot of money for this hotel but found much nicer ones for cheaper on the same road. and ones that also included breakfast in with the price- hotel is on a very busy road and although it is in a quite convenient location theres no view and you could be in any major city. where the hard rock cafe is situated theres a row of restaurants/bars/hotels and it looks a lot more Italian and has a abroad/holiday feel to it, I really cant remember the name of the street right now but if anyone wants to email me I can give you more information and get it as I have a leaflet down stairs with the address on. larson82uk@yahoo.co.uk feel free to email me if you have any questions. oh and Florence is a must what a wonderful place its an 1 and half -= 2 hour train journey from Rome to be honest we wish we had gone to Florence and just done a day trip to Rome instead of the other way around!

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Hotel in the Central Part of Rome”
Reviews.Author: TravellingGirl57
Reviews.Content: My husband & myself spent 4 nights in Rome in May . It is a beautiful city , Eurostars, International Palace a very nice Hotel. Location is ideal for walking and seeing all the main sights. Our Room was small , but very clean , at back of Hotel & very quiet , loved it !!! Really appreciated the use of the fee internet room off the main lobby, it was great !!! We found the staff always friendly & willing to help. We did not eat at the Hotel as it was quite expensive , as is usual at most Hotels. I accidently left my wallet in our Room safe , it was mailed back to me , everything intact , I was very relieved & grateful to staff. We ate at a lovely Chinese Restaurant at the end of the first side street to the left , across from the Old Pizza Restaurant mentioned in previous review, it was a wonderful place, staff wonderful , very nicely decorated & food wonderful. I would highly recommend this Hotel to anyone . JUst a word of warning , please watch out near train station , and crowded areas for pick pockets. Enjoy this beautiful , historical city !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Extra Touches and Eager to Please Staff make the difference!”
Reviews.Author: ABLer
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days (June 9-13) at the International to celebrate our anniversary so we upgraded to the romance package. Our room was immaculate, very spacious and in the back of the hotel so nicely quiet. There were fruit, roses, chocolate and champagne in the room and it was available for an early check in. From the robes and slippers in the room--to the free internet in a room off the lobby; from the maid who went and got us ice (since I couldn't figure out how to dial the front desk-hit 9 by the way)--to the doormen who walked us over to the restaurant for beakfast and rushed to meet our every need, this hotel went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and special. My only nitpick-Definitely don't take the breakfast if it is not included in your room. It is probably the only place in Italy where you can get a perfectly hideous cup of coffee (this is not in the upstairs coffee shop but the downstairs restaurant reserved for the hotel). As all the other reviews said, great location, safe and central area. I would definitely recommend this hotel and recommend the romance package which is a much bigger room in the quiet part of the hotel for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: msmr
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long wkend in Rome. The hotel is in a good location, close to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Colloseum - 10mins. We took the metro to the Vatican, just get on at the Republica stop and take the red line, only takes 5 mins. We had a superior double room, I changed to that after reading reviews of the economy double! The room was fine, view was on to the courtyard which was full of building works but that didn't bother us, at least it was quiet. The bathroom was really nice too with a nice big bath. We did just have 2 single beds pushed together so we asked them if we could change rooms, they said they'd put a double bed in for us. When we arrived back it looked as though this was done but they had just put a double sheet over the 2 beds!! :) Didn't bother us though, found it quiet funny. Air con was fine too. The restaurant was open when we were there but we didnt ever use it, there are lots of cheaper/nicer places around and we just got fruit from the shop to have in the mornings. Make sure you have comfy shoes cos you do do alot of walking!! We did our vatican tour with Angel Tours, they were really good but we still had to wait in the queue but it did go down much quicker than u think!! For the Colloseum we bought our tickets at Palentine Hill so u avoid the queues at the colloseum and just did the audio guide. Really enjoyed it and hotel is in a good location and staff pretty friendly and helpful with maps etc.

Reviews.Title: “Big thumbs down”
Reviews.Author: neda2000
Reviews.Content: here is why 1. air con was so noisy we couldnt even hear each other in the room let alone sleep with it on. staff refused to fix it 2. asked for ice. it arrive over 1 hour later, half melted 3. after our 1st night came back from sight seeing to find out the cleaning staff had REALLY cleaned our room. they took out personal razor and toothbrushed and thrown them away as well as the soap in the shower. but didnt bother to replace them not even the soap. we asked for soap and they brought 6 towels for us. 4. the staff would hang up while we were asking them Qs about the tourisy sites and if we went to ask them in person they would be talking to each other or typing on computer while we were talking to them 5. when i called to book a room (5 weeks before our arrival) i called them direct and asked for a room, i was told they dont take bookings direct and i have to do it via a website. so i booked throught the website, then when we get there i found out we were ripped off by the website by atleast 30 Euro, and the reception said "you should have booked directly with us, it is cheapper". well DAH 6. not woth the money. 200euro is way too much. location is good but you can find at least 50 other hotels on that street for much less. Now, for breakfast try the cafe across from Bata shoes (down the road from the hotel, opposite side). coffee is !.10 Euro and yummy toasted giant sandwiches are 2 Euro. dont sit down though just stand at the bar with the rest of the locals. good value and very nice staff. the sandwichshop that is not the hote. enjoy rome

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: FazSydney
Reviews.Content: Our last stop during a 20 days holiday in Europ thought to get a luxury hotel. Value for money does not really worth it. Room was clean but tiney, staff very unintersted and not helpful at all except for 2 ladies who were working day shift. As we got to Rome a day earlier we had to stay in a different hotel about 50 m away from this one 4 star,for about 20 EU cheaper got a great rome,well come drink,breakfast and the minibar was included. all together i really do not think this hotel worth the money you. Check other hotels, plenty around, will never stay there again and not recommanding it to anyone. My email is fazjaz@gmail.com if any questions happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “Good location/ Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NMNandDMN
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very nice, and well deserving of their star rating. Most of the staff was friendly, spoke English, and helped us with maps, directions, and made dining recommendations. Our room was very large, which was nice, but instead of having a king bed as requested, they pushed two single beds together and made it up as one bed. The bathroom was huge too, which was a nice change from other mini- sized European rooms we have seen. The only criticism I have of the hotel is that despite the website advertising air-conditioned rooms, we could not turn the A/C on because of the time of year. We were there in April and it got hot for a few days, we really did need it. I'm not sure if it is a hotel policy or a city rule that prevented them from turning it on. The hotel is in a GREAT location, a short walk from the Coliseum and other big attractions. My only concern about staying there again would be the air-conditioning, but that may well be a problem everywhere in non-summer months

Reviews.Title: “Good location, tiny bed”
Reviews.Author: HVDV
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Easter weekend 2007 - in retrospect perhaps not the greatest time to visit Rome as several million other tourists seemed to have the same idea! The good: The hotel is well located, relatively close to the Termini rail station (15min walk) and pretty central to many of Rome's main attractions - Trevi Fountain is about a 15min walk, Colosseum about 20mins, Piazza Navona about 20mins, Spanish Steps about 20mins. There are also plenty of cheap places to eat nearby. The rooms are clean and reasonably well appointed (tv, fridge, free safe) and the staff are helpful. A nice touch was the Easter eggs left in our room on Easter Sunday. Our room was also quiet, as it overlooked a small courtyard and not the main road (Via Nazionale, a busy and noisy road) - we could sleep with the window open. The not so good: The reason we had to sleep with the window open was that the room was too warm. It had aircon but we couldn't get it to cool the room. When we asked at reception we were told that the aircon hadn't been turned on yet (too early in the season although it was about 23C during the day) and that you could only heat the room. They suggested that we opened the window instead - glad our room wasn't overlooking the main road! The worst aspect of the hotel was the size of the room and, in particular, the size of the bed. We had opted for an economy room but the travel site we booked through omitted to mention that it was basically a single room - the bed was a very small double. As the hotel was fully booked there was no possibility of an upgrade. My wife and I are both pretty slender but there was little room to do anything other than cuddle in the bed. So a very cozy few days and really no comfortable lounging in our room. Nothing wrong with the room otherwise - it would have been fine for one person but was too small for two. If the bed size was not conducive to a good night's sleep, then the lack of internal sound insulation did not help - the doors seemed to be made with slamming in mind and you could hear all your neigbours' comings and goings through the night. The hotel is also clearly having some major renovation work done - we had to negotiate building work in progress to get to our room when we checked in. That said, they did tidy up and we can't say that there was any real negative impact after that (although the work hadn't been completed by the time we left). The building work meant that the restaurant was out of commission. The hotel had laid on breakfast at a café across the road (for €15pp, as not included in our room rate). We discovered that you could save yourself about half the cost by not joining the hotel guests downstairs - just eat at street level as if you were a walk-in customer. Or save even more by taking away (and back to your hotel room) as there is a tax deduction if you do not eat on the premises. In summary: The hotel manages to do many of the basics well but lets itself down on some other key points. If we stayed there again, we would want a larger room and I can't help thinking that, for the price of a larger room, you could do better in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Del2n
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Good location - an easy walk to the centre. Very clean and well equipped - everything from free toothbrushes to a shoe shine kit. Safe in room. Very helpful and friendly staff. Would definately stay there again. Only problem when we visited was that the restaurant was closed for refurbishment, so had to have breakfast at cafe across the road. But, excellent breakfast - everything you could want to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Neutral”
Reviews.Author: Kronberg
Reviews.Content: We spent a lot of time reading the Trip Advisor Reviews and must say we were a bit nervous about our decision to spend 4 nights at this hotel. It has a beautiful lobby and the room and bathroom were very clean and nicely decorated. There were several reviews saying the rooms are small. Ours was small but not unusually so for a city hotel. I read another criticism about the variety of TV stations available. It was no different than most European hotels. It was inconvenient to go across the street for breakfast and we were not happy that the breakfast was not included but we knew that upfront. The hotel location is great. The bus & train station are an easy walk. We would suggest not arranging for hotel transportation from airport. It was expensive. We took the train back to Fumicino for a fraction of cost.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: BethanyinDallas
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the International Palace in 3/07. We booked the room through Gate 1 Travel, and were quite pleased with all three hotels we booked through them during our holiday in Italy. This hotel is very conveniently located. We arrived in Rome by train, transferred to the subway within the train station, got off at the Repubblica stop, and easily walked the rest of the way to the hotel. Turn right coming out of the subway, then just head straight down Via Nazionale and look to the left after a few blocks. There isn't a large sign; you have to read the word "Eurostar" on the glass doors. It helped that I recognized the building from photos posted here. The room was lovely; tapestry drapes, damask fabric on the walls, marble-tiled bathroom. It was small, but it was on par with other rooms I've had in Rome and throughout Europe. The room was clean, and it was nice to have a tub in the bathroom instead of just a shower. Another plus - the hotel lift was spacious enough to accommodate several people at once. Unfortunately, the hotel's restaurant was closed for construction during our stay, but they had made arrangements for guests to have breakfast at a small cafe across the street. It was slightly inconvenient to have to cross over there, but the food and service was excellent and I thought it was a very good solution to the temporary problem. We also appreciated the free internet! Just ask at the concierge desk and they will sign you up. Overall, we had an excellent experience here and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Disappointment, Tiny Room”
Reviews.Author: kangaroo23
Reviews.Content: I've been travelling the world extensively for 2 years now and have a good idea of what to expect from hotels/hostels. It's rare that I write reviews after a trip but I was so disappointed with this hotel that I felt compelled to share my impressions. Firstly, I'm not sure how exactly hotels attain their ratings but I didn't consider this hotel to be of 4 star quality. During my last trip to Rome I stayed at a 2 star hotel a couple of doors down and to be honest I didn't see a vast improvement in this hotel. It seems to me some hotels get extra stars because the lobby looks nice, and that appears the case with this hotel. My main gripe with this hotel was the size of the room - it was tiny. Be cautious: I booked an 'economy' double but the room I shared with my fiancée was no larger than a single. Even the porter sounded apologetic (almost embarrassed) about the size of the room when he showed us to it. Against my nature I complained and requested a larger room for our stay (5 nights) but the receptionist insisted that the room was an 'economy' double rather than a single and would not accommodate me. The bathroom, bedroom and bed were tiny but the 'given' for me was the fact there was 1 pillow on the bed. (The receptionist was kind enough to send up a 2nd pillow on our 2nd night!) I did happen to catch a glimpse of another one of the double rooms on check-out and couldn't believe the difference in size compared to the one I'd shared with my fiancée. I'm sure our stay would have been comfortable in a larger room but a review reflects your experience at a place, not the potential, and I was not satisfied with my room at all. Moving on, the location is not great but reasonable, anyone who has been to Rome knows that it's full with hotels so finding something more convenient for the main attractions isn't hard. Overall it's hard to recommend this hotel at all because the truth of the matter is I wouldn't stay there again. There are plentiful hotels in Rome better located and I'll be taking my chances with one of those next time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel,great location, at first small room”
Reviews.Author: Trui
Reviews.Content: We just returned from this hotel. Had a great time. When we arrived we were not happy at all with our room. It turned out we booked a standard room. We think these rooms are very small! We could hardly move around our bed. In their leaflet they mention 178 spacious rooms. Well this is not correct, they have standard and superior rooms. After our complaint the very friendly staff gave us a superior room, (for my birthday I guess). This room was good, good beds, great bathroom, good towels etc. The view was terrible on a courtyard with rubbish, but it was perfectly quiet! Not bad for Rome. We were in the new part, of the hotel, room 333. There was a second elevator for this part of the hotel. The hotel was easy to reach from the airport Fiumicino. Half an hour by train to Termini station and from there 15 to 20 minutes walk to the hotel. Perfect location, everything within walking distance and lots of restaurants, trattorias and osterias, supermarket and shops. Breakfast was on the other side of the street because of problems in the breakfastroom in the hotel. Good buffet breakfast. We would recommend this hotel but beware of the roomsize.

Reviews.Title: “Good location,bad experience.”
Reviews.Author: DavosSwisslady
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel knowing that it wasn't a 5star but because it had a really good location (10 min walk to main train station, 2min to metro, close enough to the Coloseum and Trevi fountain). I wasn't looking for a breathless room, simply a cozy one. Well location is great, the room is ok but the service is simply horrible. First of all never ask suggestions for restaurants cause we went to one of them and it was terrible, the next day another person suggested the same again! And the desk staff just seem annoyed when you ask them to make a reservation, call a cab,etc. Avoid any rooms facing the street at all costs because if you open the windows,and you will because even in february it's steaming hot),the noise of the constant traffic is very loud. Only 2 channels in english: CNN and BBC, no payperview: not convenient on a rainy day. There is only one elevator, the slowest ever: if you are on the bottom floors, just give up and take the stairs! I would never go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern.....”
Reviews.Author: tryanythingonce
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on Nazionale, a vibrant shopping street in Quirinale, north of the city centre. It has an impressive facade and the entrance hall is impressively decorated with Trompe L'oile. Check in was efficient and courteous. I booked a superior room, and although it had a courtyard view, it was smart and nicely decorated in a minimalist style. The good points; comfortable new beds, smart shower room; nice cafe for breakfast across the road - excellent coffee, great fresh pastries and the best OJ; a good supermarket right opposite. The bad points; view over nasty courtyard being used as a dumping ground for the ongoing renovations; minimal storage - this is a hotel for a one or two night stay; not cheap - €150 per night no breakfast; TV old - an annoying whistling noise evident whenever it was used; no bath; no emergency route posted on the door; no bar; aircon not working tho courtyard room meant the windows could be left open - stay on the street side and the noise will drive you crazy. But the hotel was clean. Overall not spectacular. They are clearly making this into a boutique hotel, but it is just not that good.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarahvb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eurostars international for a weekend trip to Rome. As everyone has mentioned it is excellently located near several bus stops and a Metro station, as well as being within walking distance of most of the major tourist attraction, (take comfy shoes though, we walked until we could barely move our feet!) The hotel is around 30-40 minutes drive from Ciampino Airport (where the low costs airlines mainly fly to) which was a €45 taxi fare. There are also bus services that go into the Centre which are very good (and quick) or you can get a bus to the train station nearby. Out hotel room was clean and smart with a huge double bed, (although it did take up almost all the room). There was a large wardrobe too, a TV and stocked fridge. The bathroom was great with a huge walk in shower, although again there wasn’t much floor space. I suspect that as we only paid £190 (€290) for 3 nights (through Expedia) they may have given us one of the smallest rooms, but to be honest the size really didn’t matter as it was a nice room. We did not eat in the hotel at all as there are so many restaurants, cafes and bars nearby. The reception staff gave us directions to a place within 5 minutes walk of the hotel on the first night which was great, and there were numerous places on the Via Nazionale for breakfast so we were spoilt for choice really. Overall, I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Once more up the Quirinale”
Reviews.Author: WilliamOnTheFylde
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and me found this hotel after a good trawl of review websites and brochures and felt it looked good for our needs - a 3 night city break in Rome. After catching the Terravision shuttle bus to Termini Station, it was a fairly short walk, trundling our bags behind us to the hotel, which we found quite easily. We arrived a couple of hours before our check-in time, but the staff were happy to place our bags in a secure place which gave us a bit of time to explore the local area and grab a bite to eat. We returned to the hotel and the well presented reception area with smart and efficient English speaking staff. We were given a room and the rather over-burdened porter carried our bags for us...and he didn't even pause for a tip! The room we were initially given was a double, but it was tiny. On first glance there didn't appear room to lay our bags out and there was no bath, just a large walk-in shower. We got on with it all the same and started un-packing our stuff. However, within 5 minutes the reception called us to ask if we were satisfied with the room and I immediately told them we would have preferred one with a bath. The girl found that there was one available and within seconds the perspiring porter re-appeared to show us the alternative room. This room was both bigger and contained a bath, so we switched, happily. Following our move, the porter re-appeared with our bags and only paused for breat rather than a tip. The room suited our needs perfectly although the only English speaking channel we could get on the telly was CNN which we soon christened The Doom And Gloom Channel because everything on it was bad news or Saddam getting hanged. We had a room overlooking the small square in the hotel, nothing to see and not much circulation of air but we couldn't otherwise fault the room or the hotel for that matter. It was close to many of the Ancient Roman attractions and close to the Republicca Metro station from where we ventured beneath the Tiber to The Vatican. There were a number of decent restaurants and wine bars in the vicinity of the hotel which we tried, but I wouldn't recommend the Irish Bar just up the Via Nazionale...they charged us 10 euros for a pint and a half of Harp Larger!..stick to the Moretti (the beer with the old man's face on slurping a foaming pint). The breaksfast was one of those continental buffet selections which always pleases and the hotel bar was handy for a nightcap.
