If you choose this hotel I doubt very much you'll be disappointed, it contributed to our fantastic time in Rome...recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: KevEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 1st visit to Rome. This hotel was in a great location on one of the main streets from which it was very easy to reach the attractions and sights. Several attractions were within walking distance from the hotel and there were buses running round the clock up and down the street. Metro station also close by. Our room was at the front of the hotel was of a good size and cleaned daily. Good sized bathroom with clean towels also provided daily. Very busy street outside. Windows seemed to rattle and shake everytime a bus went passed! Overall though, a good choice if you are considering going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean, Room could be bigger”
Reviews.Author: alexdodo
Reviews.Content: An excellent base for exploring the city, we managed to walk to all of the major attractions and did not use public transport once on our 3 day stay in this hotel. The hotel reception in very smart, and the room was very clean and tidy with a large bathroom. The only complaint I would have with the room was that it was a little on the small side, but that would not stop me booking this hotel again on my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Bilberry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights here while in Rome with friends of ours who also stayed at this hotel. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome. The hotel is in a good location , walking distance only to Piazza Venezia, the most impressive building in Rome in our opinion.The bus stop is only yards from the hotel itself and plenty of nearby restaurants . I don't remember the name of the one we ate at, it is across the road from the hotel, up a bit and one turn to the left, a small family run restaurant where the food was excellent, the guy on the reception recommended it and it was very reasonable too. Hotel was spotless, the staff all spoke english and the room was nice too, no. 307 on the third floor facing the front , but I have to say with the windows closed very little noise to be heard ,despite passing traffic. Bed was v comfortable, bathroom marble ,really nice. Fully stocked fridge, and a bottle of champage,red rose and chocolates to greet us on arrival. We didn't have to pay any extra for this, we got a superior room and this was all included for 179 Euros a night which is reasonable in Rome as I checked out quite a few hotels. Passed the new section of the hotel too, the rooms looked nice from the corridor, with timber floors and more to the back of the hotel, I think they are slightly smaller than the front ones but looked lovely and maybe a bit quieter, with huge showers. Overall, we would definitely recommend this hotel to those visiting Rome and I passed quite a few of the other hotels we had considered booking but the Eurostars looked much superior in our opinion from the outside. We would return to this hotel again if we go back to Rome, do ring though, I got a much better rate this way than on their website or through any of the travel sites. Website is (---) and hotel is one in centre of Rome.The website pictures are accurate to reality. Restaurant is nice too, we only had breakfast there the two mornings and we were happy enough with it. Plenty to eat and choose from. Hot scrambed eggs /streaky rashers (not the same as the irish of course ) italian version,some kind of sausage,&onions . Cold meats variety,cheeses,rolls,toast,pastries,juices,tea&Coffee. Plenty adequate to start the day sightseeing with. Advise you to bring at least two very comfortable pairs of walking shoes, our feet were killing us at the end of two days,should have worn different shoes each day!!.Enjoy Rome, it is worth a trip, very nice city.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I booked!”
Reviews.Author: Pillow_Queen
Reviews.Content: The room was not what I booked, it was supposed to be a double superior room with all features listed on the lastminute.com ad. This is not what I was given, I compained but was not given any other choice. The room was furnished with quality fittings but it was very small (less than a meter around a 1 3/4 sized bed). I had no where to put my suitcase, and there was no desk & chair as advertised. I couldn't even get into the wardrobe as a bed side table blocked it in. Every conversation, toilet visit and snore in the next room was inescapably loud. On top of all this the one window showed only a view of external frames and scaffold, it left very little room for light. What was most disappointing was that the hotel was noticably not busy, yet they would not allow me to move to another room. I can only assume that all the other rooms are worse!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our purposes”
Reviews.Author: MaisieT
Reviews.Content: I took my Mum to Rome for her 60th birthday and since neither of us had been there before it was tricky to know where to stay. The International Palace turned out to be perfect- Rome is a small city anyway but everything is walkable from here. On our second day we left half an hour to walk to the Colosseum and were twenty minute early. When they say 500m to something they mean it. The hotel is far from fancy but it has everything you need and the staff are friendly and helpful. We didn't eat in the restaurant apart from breakfast which was ok but not great (very weird juice and coffee machines which are a bit of a travesty in a country which has some of the best coffee in the world!). For an affordable (through Expedia) central base it is perfect. Lovely deep baths to ease those exhausted over walked bodies too. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. Another tip- we saw the Roman Forum & Colosseum and the Vatican with Angel Tours and they were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Lolly88
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel from Nov 17-19th 2006. The location is excellent, within walking distance of all the main attractions & Termini Station. The hotel staff which we had any dealings with were polite & helpful - they recommended & booked a resaturant for us on our 1st night & arranged a taxi for our return to the airport. The room was tiny, but spotlessly clean & the bathroom was large (in comparison to the bedroom ). There was scaffolding outside our bedroom - which didnt surprise me as a number of reviewers on this website had mentioned it. There were no workmen around & thus no noise to speak of. The only gripe I would have about this hotel is that the breakfast is priced at €11 per person on their website details & it was in fact €15 per person -as we were heading back to the airport early on the Sunday morning, there was nowhere else open so we ate in the hotel - the food was fine, but overpriced at €15 I thought. However I would have no hesitation to stay in this hotel and apart from the breakfast issue - I felt we got value for money as the room was only €132 per night when we booked it. I would also recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul913
Reviews.Content: We booked the International Palace mostly based on the reviews we have read on this website. We were not dissapointed! The location was perfect on the Via Nazionale with easy access to the Metro and a bus stop outside the hotel. A short walk ( 10 mins ) takes you on a dirct road down to the Colliseum. The staff were pleasant and the hotel friendly and reasonable attentive. Our room on the 2nd floor was particularly quiet. It was spotlessly clean. The bathroom was also faultless decked mainly in marble. I was unable to find an area in the room which had not been cleaned. The food in the bar/restaurant was good, particularly the pizza. Breakfast was the usual continental buffet. Only criticism would be the bacon and the lack of meat. It was 99% fat! Aside from that I would recommend the hotel particularly for first time vistors given it's location, friendly service and cleanliness. Would definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: Kacer99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 night in October paying 200 euros per night, which we booked through HolidayCity. The hotel has an impressive lobby and was very easy to find being on the main Via Nazionale. We were quite happy with the room, it wasn't overly spatious but was immaculately clean and the bathroom was modernly furnished. Although our double room was 2 twins pushed together. Our bathroom accoutrements were replaced daily and a free Guardian greeted me every evening, which were nice touches. The breakfast was buffet style, with simple cooked foods, bacon scrambled eggs; my only gripe was that the coffee and tea came out of a machine. The restaurant, in the evening serves instantly forgettable food and we warn you to steer clear! As has been mentioned the hotel is superbly situated, only a 10 minute walk to the Termini and other majot attractions being only a few minutes walk away. We probably wouldn't have been so happy if we had paid $400 a night like a previous reviewer. All in all we were very happy with our stay but then again you don't come to Rome to stay in your hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and very clean”
Reviews.Author: travelfunandwise
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and the staff was very helpful. The location is very near the metro station and walking distance to the colosseum, Campo de Fiori and Piazza Navona. Our room was small but plenty fo room for two people. We had a small balcony that was nice for added light in the room. Breakfast was average for Italy...large selection of pastries, meats and cheeses. They also have scrambled eggs every morning. Overall we had no complaints with this hotel. Taxi from the termini station is only 10euro, if you have lots of luggage it is well worth the taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great location, Brilliant Buffet Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: W.Ritchie
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 15th October - 20th October to celebrate my fathers 60th birthday. Got a taxi easily from the airport straight to our hotel for 40 euros. Hotel is in a central location within easy walking location, Entrance was impressive, staff knowledgeable and thorough, room was excellent, cleanliness exceptional for a city hotel, strong power shower, comfy bed after a days trekking. Buffet breakfast included in our price sat us up for the day, plenty to choose from, different types of breads, meats, cheeses, yoghurts, fruits, teas coffees, fruit juices, scrammbled eggs, bacon etc. Porters very helpful with suitcases, taxi etc. Would recommend this hotel and would stay again. A little oasis in a Rome!

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: DrPiggy
Reviews.Content: This was our last stop (were in Venice and Florence earlier). Th is hotel was a big disappointment and I couldn't recommend it. Although perhaps the ongoing renovation is partially responsible, our rooms were inadequate. There was no airconditioning at all. The rooms were small, and our bed was on the floor! There were 2 twin mattresses stuck onto a box springs that sat on the floor (this was supposed to be a double). We had no bedspread either, just sheets. And we had no suitcase stand either, so we had to put our suitcases on the floor. The breakfast wasn't great, and I had to ask for things like plates, because the buffet ran out, and the stafff wasn't paying attention. Food was not replenished either. This accomodation almost ruined my time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Price!!”
Reviews.Author: tygerlily
Reviews.Content: Reception didn't acknowledge your presence...no smiles or greeting as you pass them every day. Breakfast is not included for almost $400 USD/nite if you book on any website but theirs. Room was tiny, especially compared to the other hotels in Italy we've stayed in. No clock in the room which was a big pain. The bathroom was small too and your legs banh into the shower when sitting on the toilet. Since it was the 1st for us in Rome, we thought the location was pretty central, but it isn't. You're better off staying at a hotel on or off of Via Corso. All in all, it was decent but not what was expected of a 4 star hotel OR one that we paid $400 USD a night for.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful Stay at the International Palace”
Reviews.Author: sujanuary
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Italy, where we spent a week in Rome. We found the International Palace to be a lovely hotel with a very friendly and helpful staff, in a convient and safe location. I would stay here again. Our breakfast was included with our room rate. The room was small but a vast improvement over our hotel in Florence. The only negatives were the single, SLOW elevator and the lack of easily available ice for in room service. The ice situation is common among European hotels it seems.

Reviews.Title: “Useful location, nice room but poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: St.Albans
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in mid-September on a very busy weekend in Roma. The location is good with the metro very close by and a short walk to the central attractions. Our room was on the top floor with no view to speak of. The room was large and spacious - we had to request a new room due to the stale smoke from the last 'non-smoking' guest. The staff handled this effectively. The renovation is not complete but they mask the ongoing work pretty well. However, there is work ongoing to restore some parts of the building .... but hey, this is Rome ! The biggest problem in the breakfast room, just how many tables can you fit into one room ? Getting to the buffet is a real hassle and it is completely self service - not an enjoyable morning experience. The cafe/bar is functional and not a place to spend too much time. The elevator is a problem - they need to get a service elevator in to working order pronto. In the end we resorted to walking the 6 floors - rather than waiting for the staff to move luggage, drop off housekeeping etc etc. Overall this is a reasonable hotel, which deserves a 3 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in the heart of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Ollie99
Reviews.Content: Here's a true 4 star hotel in the heart of Rome. The rooms were spacious, modern and clean...we almost didn't want to leave the hotel. The staff was very helpful and quick to respond to our every need. They arranged for transportation to the airport at a reasonable cost. It's very well located within minutes walking distance from all the great attractions. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “not a 4 star!”
Reviews.Author: #1tourguide
Reviews.Content: This hotel is no 4 star! Only one elevator for 5 floors of rooms, if there is a fire no one will get out on time.The front desk very unattentive, housekeeping has to use the same small elevator for all floors so..you wait at least 10 min each time you need to take the elevator. Rooms are extremely small! Not worth the price when there are so many other hotels in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “eurostars palace hotel is the best!!could not fault it”
Reviews.Author: Finn1
Reviews.Content: Just back after a four night stay at the "palace". The hotel was fab-staff friendly + helpful~immaculately clean rooms +spacious air-conditioning divine breakfast; tasty with a great selection to set you up for the day! Via Nazionale is such a central location,with a choice of metro,train,bus or taxi on your doorstop although we usually walked everywhere. We used stephano from romecabs[""]to pick 12 of us from the airport -great,reasonable and reliable service. All the sights are a stroll away ; the colloseum about 20 mins down the street -the trevi fountain and spanish steps also nearby. Rome is just fabulous we did not want to leave! We did the vatican tour with "Angel Tours" thanks to recommendations on trip advisor - it was amazing! Loads of nice restaurants throughout the city we did not have 1 bad meal during our stay -plenty of nice pizzarias off via nazionale. If you have the time and weather is good try to get to Villa Borghese up hill from Piazza di Popolo-beautiful parks lakes and stunning views of beautiful rome!! ENJOY

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and comfy. Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: JasonTormey
Reviews.Content: Young couple from Ireland, Very Clean and comfy. Would recommend. Parking 2 streets away from hotel. €25 per night. Breakfast was good. Very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but room very small”
Reviews.Author: LisaMc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Feb 2006. At first the hotel seemed grand as the entrance/ hallway is very impressive, but once given the key, I was informed that breakfast was not included with I thought I was (but did not question this as I'm not a big breakfast eater!). We then proceed to the lift that was very dodgy and would have opted for the stairs if I didn't have such a heavy case... girls and their shoes!! The Room was terribly small compared to other hotels I have stayed in for less. However as the is loads of things to see and do in Rome, the room was only used for sleeping and it was fit for that purpose, although it did get extremely warm at night. The location was good as it was in walking distance of the Colosseum, and had a bus stop and Metro very close by. But we took the opportunity to walk everywhere, and boy my feet hurt! I enjoyed Rome and the hotel was average, certainily not 4 stars though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good location”
Reviews.Author: Habfan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on bustling Via Nazionale. The room was quite large: a queen size bed, a desk, a closet with a hidden sink and hot plate and there was ample space for the 2 of us and our 4 oversized luggage! We were on the top floor so our room also had a balcony with a view of the busy Roman street. Nice touch. The TV was tiny, but had CNN and MTV in English. The granite bathroom had much to be desired. It was typically Italian in that it was not properly laid out. The bathroom itself was a good size, however, the sink and vanity were a little small . The glass door on the bathtub was not properly installed and so when we showered, the whole room got wet. The water pressure was very good which added to the mess in the bathroom. Amenities provided were a hair dryer, a comb, toothbrushes and toothpaste, a shaving kit, shampoo, soap and cream. The staff was very friendly and spoke English very well. They were very helpfull whenever we asked for information. The location was central. It took us 10 minutes to walk to the Trevi fountain and was also about 10 minutes to the Colosseum and ancient Rome. There were tons of shops around and we felt very safe in the area both in the day time and at night. I highly recomend this hotel, since the price, size, quality and location were all very satisfying.

Reviews.Title: “Good and safe choice”
Reviews.Author: CA+GR
Reviews.Content: A very good choice for a stay in Rome. - large enough room, very modern bathrooms, clean - excellent location: within 3min from all transportation options you will ever need (many buses stop right in-front), very safe area compared to the cheap hotels in the train station district. Ok, it would be nice if the price included breakfast. The staff were helpful enough (not as friendly as in other cities) and can help you with all your basic needs including transporation to the airport, purchasing various museum cards, bus routes, etc. We'd go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “3 stars”
Reviews.Author: SvenFost
Reviews.Content: I don't know the rules defining a 4 stars hotel in Italy, but I'm traveling worldwide for years and I can tell you that this has no common point with a 4 stars hotel and even less with a palace. The service is poor, the cleaning isn't done if you wake up after 11AM, the mini bar isn't refilled, the rooms are small, the TV is old and small, with only a couple of international channels, the breakfast is a nightmare with powder orange juice and coffee. I also got upset when they didn’t help me getting a taxi when I was lost in Rome at night. Some good points: good quality bed, central location and silent air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Service, Modern Room”
Reviews.Author: 5.10b
Reviews.Content: Location: near Piazza Republica and Termini Station (about 8 blocks or less than 10 minutes walk). You can walk to Trevi Fountain within 20 minutes easily. If you prefer to stay in another area, near the Pantheon is also very ideal central location. Service: Staff is very nice and speaks good English. They are happy to call for cabs for you, which was always easier than flagging them down at the stands (also cheaper b/c the hotels call for the cabs that uses meters instead of negotiating prices). From the hotel to Vatican City on a Saturday morning, the cab fare was only 7 Euros. Room: Very modern, marble floors in bathroom, halogen lights, nice showers, adjustable air condition. The room is small, barely have enough room to walk around the queen-size bed, which is not unusual for European hotels. The bathroom is of a nice size. Street Noise: None noticed. Surroundings: Bus #64 stops close to hotel. McDonalds is about 3 blocks away, fruit stands close to McD sell drinks for reasonable prices, couple cute cafes right across the street. I felt very safe to walk around at midnight around the hotel. Tripadvisor reviews and Forum really helped me plan this trip to Europe. Just thought I contribute something back by sharing my experiences. Thanks to all who posts tips and photos.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amyann1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the International Palace for 2 nights at the beginning of July. I have to say, I don't understand the negative reviews on this place. I thought the hotel was superb. It is in a fantastic location, right in the centre of Rome and close to almost everything, including a bus stop right outside the hotel for those sights that are a little bit further away. The rooms were on the small side, but decorated well. Air conditioning worked, the bathrooms were lovely, the bed was comfortable. The entry way into the hotel was gorgeous and the staff were very friendly and helpful. No request was too much trouble. I will definitely stay again on my next visit to Rome. One small item that I would mention is it is really not worth paying for the breakfast. It was not nice, definitely not worth the money and there are lovely cafe's just down the road that do cheaper and better breakfasts!

Reviews.Title: “Great Base”
Reviews.Author: Martyn_Megan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the International Palace for a 4 night stay to explore Rome and really couldn't ask for more. Its a comfortable, clean hotel with helpful staff, nice breakfasts with lots of choice, but the best thing about it is its location. Every sight is within walking distance and we only ever got the number 64 bus to go to the Vatican City but the great thing is that the stop is outside the hotel. The hotel also provides a great map to help get you around without getting lost There is some building work going on but we never heard any noise and to be honest you don't visit Rome to stay in your hotel room. Definately would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice rooms and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: barbq
Reviews.Content: Our family group of 14 stayed at tne Hotel Internationale for 3 nights beginning June 1, 2006. There is a older section and a newer section and they are both good. The older section has large rooms with beautiful antique furniture. In the newer section the rooms are a bit smaller but some of them have terraces. All rooms have new, modern bathrooms. The breakfast is the best we had on our 2 week trip. The location is half a block from the top of the Spanish Steps. It is quite as there is not too much traffic on the oneway street (Via Sistina). There is a roof top terrace with chairs, tables and plants with a beautiful view of the dome of St. Peters. Very nice place to relax. Would return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive”
Reviews.Author: Mildrilla
Reviews.Content: We were not impressed by this Hotel. We paid a high rate, and not even the breakfast was included. Too many rooms make the staff service less personalized, and a little cold. Room small.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Oceanblue60
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks at this hotel and loved it. Our first room was not all that great but they were quick to accommodate a room change. There was some renovation work going on at the time but when 32 million tourists visit the city in a 6 months period some things need to get done while you are there so you just have to make do. (Besides, you don't visit Rome for the hotel room!!!) The staff was extremely gracious, helpful and always accommodating. The housekeeping staff was always willing to help and kept the rooms spotless. The breakfast bar had enough variety to accommodate any visitors' typical breakfast meal and served it from 7h30 - 10am. The central location of the hotel is excellent. You are literally only a 15-20 minutes walk from any major site, shopping and if you prefer public transit it's at your door. There are amazing restaurants just around the corner and a couple of great pubs that serve happy hour till 8pm! All in all: Great trip, great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Listed as a 4 star, but a 3 star in my opinion!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beware of the lowest price advertised for the hotel. It is advertised for the Economy room. Apparently, the economy room can hold 2 people. That is true if you are both about 90 lbs. and under 5 foot tall. If you want to upgrade to the standard room, the hotel will charge an additional 50 euros per night. Also, there is quite a lot of construction going on in the hotel. The workers begin at 9 AM everyday. Lastly, the bathrooms really smell quite bad. But, the hotel is in a decent location. Not too far off from the sights, the metro, or the rail station.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Happy with the service and the room. The rooms did get very hot but hotel has A/C and big Italian vintage windows. The bathroom was clean and modern but small. The room service was really good and the food I enjoyed. the location is really good, 5 mins walk, from Via Corso (shopping area) and 15 from the spanish steps and Trevi fountain. Its worth the walk as theres so many beautiful buildings and parks. There is a Renault bar 2 minutes from the Hotel which does various cocktails and diner food. The hotel is surrounded by a few fashion shops and small restaurants. The hotel is on the main road but I was not disturbed by any noise. I have to agree the reception staff were very snobby (especially the females) but no problems

Reviews.Title: “International Palace - good base to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from staying for 3 nights at the Eurostar International Palace - Via Nazionale Rome. Location: great about a 10 min walk from the Termini station Rooms: we stayed in a standard double room. The room itself was on the small side, recently renovated & very clean. The room was very hot & we couldn't work out how to regulate the aircon! Bathroom: all marble, larger in comparison to room - very good. Decent toiletries! Hotel renovations: about half of the hotel has been renovated & half hasn't. Our room was probably one of the last to be renovated so really near to those in the process of being done! Because we couldn't work out the aircon, we slept with the window open, the builders commenced work at 7:20am!!!!! However, this wasn't too much of a problem because we wanted to be up & out to explore Rome. Food: didn't try the hotel breakfast (not incl in price of room 11 euros) there are plenty of self service cafes or waiter service places nearby. Would def stay in this hotel again despite the early start of the workmen!! Philippa Weare UK

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4*”
Reviews.Author: samantha6235
Reviews.Content: The International Palace is in a good location but not at a 4* standard. The hotel shakes due to trains underground, the fixtures were not fitted properly & the breakfast was very poor and not good value for money. The staff were quite friendly but could not supply an iron or adaptor saying that it was against the law???!! Overall stay was excellent only because we were out most of the time. Wouldnt advise this hotel as it is quite expensive, and you could probably find somewhere else with the same standards for much less.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: machar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days at the beginning of a trip to Italy. We arrived at reception very hot and very tired having just flown in and, to our delight, our room was ready unlike the poor family of 6 whose rooms were not. The room was a tad small but comfortable with good air-con and a lovely bathroom with a huge shower cubicle. One of the built in wardrobes was a tad strange having a lift up section containg a cooker... The staff were lovely and very helpful in getting us taxis etc. We walked everywhere from the hotel as it was so central and even though it was on a fairly busy road, we were never bothered by the traffic noise although we were at the back of the hotel. The hotels public areas were lovely and very impressive. You really felt as though you were staying somewhere very special when you walked in through the doors into the cool marble reception area. We were on a room only basis so I am unable to comment on the food.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel,would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The hotel was in a very good location, particularly for visits to the Colosseum and the Forum. The room was quite spacious and the housekeeping was excellent. All the staff were friendly, polite and helpful. We would recommend this hotel if you are considering a visit to this beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Snotty Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked the international Palace for it's location. It is located right in the middle of all of Rome's greatest sites. This was the only thing that was good about the hotel. The one elevtor was continously broken and it took up to 10 miniutes to arrive sometimes. Our room was so unbareably hot that we turned the heat off and opened to window; this did not solve the problem. The managment repeatedly told us that it was a matter of perception and that they didn't find the room hot, but if we wanted to we could switch rooms to one that was a dowgrade of our current room. We fought with them for 3 days, and nothing was resolved. We continued to sweat through the night and they continued to tell us we were silly. Meanwhile we spoke to guests in neighboring rooms and they were all having the same problem that we were. I would never stay at this hotel again. We enjoyed Rome a ton, but when we return we will be staying at "La Residenza" which is where my mother stays every time she goes (which is often) and says it is wonderful. Should have listened to mom!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful and central”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Rome for 3 nights to celebrate my 50th birthday. The hotel was excellent. The staff were really friendly and helpful, even organising transport from the airport for us. The room was small but adequate with very effective air conditioning (we had to turn it down so that we could warm up). Breakfast was a varied buffet, typical of almost any European hotel. There was a small pizza restaurant attached to the hotel. The hotel was in an ideal positon for exploring Rome. We walked everywhere even to St Peters which took about 25 minutes but there is a bus stop right outside the hotel. We would certainly return

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located hotel, with unhelpful and ignorant staff and management”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a valentines day surprise for my beautiful girlfriend to show her how much I love her. We arrived just after midnight to a warm reception where I was told not to expect breakfast. Fine I thought not a problem. I then went to my bedroom expecting a room similar to the one I had seen on the website. Unfortunately the room was hardly big enough to walk round and instead of the bed I had booked I was given alternative sleeping arrangements (single beds). I called the reception and asked for the issue to be resolved and was informed it would be in the morning. So I went to sleep, or tried to but was unfortunately woken up at the crack of dawn (about 6am) with building work outside my window. This went on for hours, how romantic not! I then went down to the reception to ask about the room change to be patronised and told that they had no double rooms. This has to be impossible as I booked one only 4 days before. After a significant amount of chewing bricks and talking later they finally said they could help and showed me what looked like the room I had booked. It was in fact 2 single beds shoved together but without the building site outside. 24 hours went by without incident until an expensive item went missing from our room without trace. We instantly reported it and the hotel claimed they would look into it and get back to us. They didn't. Instead they tried to inconvenience us as much as possible and then were extremely rude and obnoxious. Instead of trying to resolve the situation they told us to go to the police and make a statement. HOW HELPFUL! They then had the cheek to blame us for having items in our room it seemed. The manager then kept us waiting for well over an hour while he sat on his arse. He then came out and again was rude and not interested in what myself or my girlfriend had to say to him. He was completely uninterested and instead called us LIARS! While Rome was beautiful in every respect this little corner of Rome was not.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Richard-StNeots
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a superior room. It was very well decorated. The staff were very friendly. The only slight problem was that it was cold in the room and the air conditioning did not seem to be working. Overall it was worth the money and I would recommend. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the International Palace”
Reviews.Author: spuddywag
Reviews.Content: The International Palace is a superb hotel, in a great location, with everything you could want from a hotel in Rome. The room and bathroom were spotless, although not the largest room in the world, big enough. The bathroom was bigger than some reviews would suggest and the shower was great. Bed was very comfortable. Rooms had recently been refurbished and you could tell. The reception and foyer were comfortable and well-presented. We only went in the bar area once, which was nice, although was just at the side of the restaurant. We tended to go to the George Byron Cafe further up the road, which was a very nice bar. It's a 5 minute walk to the Via Veneto, and about 10 - 15 minutes walk everywhere else of note. The hotel is on the Via Nazionale so is a busy road, we were upgraded and our room was at the side, so the traffic noise, although we could hear it, didn't bother us. For the price we paid for the hotel and the cleanliness it shouldn't be as low as it is. Great value for money, what more do you want from a hotel ?

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exploring Rome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over the Thanksgiving holiday. It was our first trip to Rome and I would be hard pressed to think of a better place to call home base as we got to know the Eternal City for the first time. We were able to take the "Leonardo Express" from the airport right into the city and walk from the Termini station to the hotel (with a few moments of getting turned around along the way, but that was our fault, not the hotel's!) We were able to check right in. There was a little trouble locating our reservation at first, but the front desk folks were very nice about it. There seemed to be only one working elevator, but we never had to wait more than a few minutes. Our room was more than adequate, small but not by European standards. The bed was a little bit hard (just two single mattresses in a full-size frame) but we only needed a place to lay our heads for the evenings. The bathroom was fantastic, with loads of toiletries (including a shower cap which is important for us African-American women!) and warm towel bars. There was an in-room safe which could be programmed with your own secret code, so no worrying over passports and such. Only one large closet/armoire and no drawers, but there were shelves in the armoire so we did not have any trouble unpacking. The location was the really great part about the hotel! We walked to the Coliseum on our first day in Rome and it was a lovely walk and only took about 20 minutes (at a leisurely stroll). The subway station was a few short blocks away (and in the middle of a gorgeous piazza). From there, you can get to virtually anywhere you want to go in the whole city. If you prefer, you can catch a bus just across the street from the hotel to Vatican City and lots of other great points of interest. We didn't do the Continental breakfast as they stopped serving at 10 and we are definitely not early birds when we're on vacation. However, we did have dinner at the hotel restaurant and it was ok, not great but certainly not terrible. The waitstaff was excellent and they had a piano player/singer who gave good show (and will let you sing a song or two if you ask). Overall, the International Palace was a great choice for us. We got it through an Expedia package, but I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.. Rooms Beutiful but very small”
Reviews.Author: McCaffreyA
Reviews.Content: My whol;e family stayed in the international palace in a double and triple room. the double was so so small, the triple was fine tho. The rooms were elegantly decorated with lovely bathrooms. The entrance is truly stunning. One thing, The breakfasts are not included in the rate and costs 11 euros. We tried it once. The man took our money and as we sat down the cooks came out and took everything away, even switching off the coffee machine. I thought that this was very rude and we didn`t get our money back for 3 minutes of breakfast.. shocking In would defenitly stay here again tho

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice & Worth The Money”
Reviews.Author: StillPhone
Reviews.Content: Pay the extra couple of pounds and go for a Superior Room as they are the new ones I guess. Small but very nice, good bathroom and a great shower. The staff are friendly and always able to help out. The breakfast is good value at EUR11-00 although I would stay away from the machine coffee... I would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, not a 4Star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Internaitonal Palace is a good, clean hotel. But is not a 4star, the rooms are small, but so are all Rome hotels, at least these are modern and clean. Room service everyday. There was some building work going on, but to be honest we weren't in our rooms during the day, so this didn't affect us. The location is great, me and my husband walked everywhere (except for the Vatican, although we did walk back), Via Nazionale is the street to stay on for first time visiters to Rome, it's within walking distance of Termini (main train station) but not too near, as this area is a bit dodgey, and is near all the sights and has shops all round it - so you can get whatever you need. All in all, don't pay megga bucks for this as you will be disappointed, but at a resonable price this is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not 4-star”
Reviews.Author: Lucyspoileddog
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 12-day trip to Italy, including 4 nights at the International Palace in Rome. Although it was nice by European Standards, it didn't strike me as a 4-star hotel. The room was small but adequate, but was not well furnished. Besides the bed (large enough but not comfortable) there was only a small desk with a TV on top obscuring view of the mirror behind it. There was no chair for the desk or any other place to sit besides the bed. The bathroom was small but fine. The breakfast was fine for the first 3 mornings (plenty of food and space to sit) but on our last morning the room was packed and they were unable to keep up with the demand for basic food items such as juice, eggs and rolls. It was strange and left a poor last impression. The desk staff were polite but not terribly helpful. When we inquired about renting a car to drive to Tuscany the clerk (who was not busy at the time) merely handed over a few rental brochures for us to call ourselves. They never offered to do anything for us when we asked about restaurants or other information. Again, not what you would expect from a 4-star hotel. Be careful of the 64 bus that runs in front of the hotel! Keep your money in a money belt! We witnessed two incidents of theft, and thereafter decided to walk everywhere instead. Rome is a great city to walk in anyway, so no problem there.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome after staying at the International Palace for 5 nights. After reading some of the negative reviews I was a little concerned about what I might find. In truth, there was absolutely no need to worry. As we arrived at Ciampino at 23:30 we booked a car, through the hotel to pick us up. The car was waiting for us and got us to the hotel in 20 mins. Cost was a little more than a taxi but well worth the extra. The room was a triple and was large enough and situated at the front of the hotel. The room was clean, well decorated, with fabric instead of wall paper and the beds were comfortable. Bathroom was typical marble tiled hotel bathroom of a reasonable size with shower over the bath. Only downside to the room was traffic noise but after a couple of nights we got used to it. Also the TV could have had more English speaking channels, we got BBC World News but for some reason this mutated to CNN on our last 2 days. The hotel was decorated to an extremely high standard in the public areas and the breakfast room was large and well lit. Breakfast buffet comprised eggs, bacon, bread rolls, fruit, hams, cheese etc, more than enough for anyone. The staff were courteous and helpful. There was still building work going on when we were there and if you had a room at the back of the hotel you may have been more aware of it. Not sure if the front rooms are to be renovated as the rooms and corridors at the back were decorated in a completely different style ie less wood and more white plastic laminate in a moderner style. Overall, an excellent hotel and I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, bit expensive though”
Reviews.Author: mdevine72
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights, the location was ideal for all the sites. We were able to get to all the main atractions by foot - 15/20mins walk. For the vatican there is a bus every 10mins or so that will take you to the vatican though i recommend geting the metro at the top of the street. The hotel room was very clean and nicely furnished however it was very small. I booked through expedia and wasn't aware i had not booked breakfast with my booking. Breakfast was 11 euros per person per day which i found very expensive. So if you do book here check that you have included breakfast. There is currently work being carried out in the hotel, however this did not entirely affect my stay. All in all this was a nice hotel - good location though i felt it was a bit over priced for what you got.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: ondgo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. Warm and muggy while we were there. Room was smaller than my bathroom at home. A/C went out on the second night, and when we asked when it would be fixed they suggested we open the window. Big problem was there were scaffolding (construction going on) from the street to our window and it was very noisy> We asked for a fan, they didn't have one. We asked if it would be fixed before the evening, they weren't sure. The man at the desk picked up a call in the middle of our conversation and left me hanging for several minutes. I asked him if we could be moved if the A/C wasn't fixed, he said they were booked up. He then said there was nothing he could do for me except send up a fruit basket. How was that suppose to help cool the room and help us get a good night's sleep. Since the room was so small (which I know is the norm in Europe), it didn't take long to warm up. They finally called someone to come fix it. We will not stay at this hotel again. The only good thing about the hotel was the restaurant staff for ordering drinks.

Reviews.Title: “An ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel for 3 nights. Room was in the new wing. Although very small it was adequate. Very Clean and nice soft towels. Lovely bathroom with a good shower. TV didn't work but that didn't bother us as we spent hardly anytime in the room. Good breakfast in pleasant room. Staff were friendly enough. Good location. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Four stars a bit optimistic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had it only been rated as a three star I don't think I would have been disappointed. It was only for the pictures of the hotel being so grand, and lastminute telling us our very average price was a 75% discounted price, that made the hotel a bit of a let down. Other than this slight embellishment of the hotel's quality, the hotel itself was quite well located for all the sights and the nightlife. A ten minute walk to most attractions and a fairly cheap taxi ride to the further away destinations i.e. the vatican. It was clean, the rooms were a decent size and the staff were helpful, although I can't say we really came into contact with the staff other than to check in and check out. A word of warning. DO NOT BUY WINE FROM THE HOTEL BAR!!!! It was foul, in fact we're not even sure it was wine. Italy itself is fabulous and I would recommend it to anyone who doesn't have difficulty crossing roads!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many hotels, this is possibly one of the worst i have had the misfortune to visit. Do not trust the pictures - the real thing is a very big let down. The rooms were unbearably small and furnished cheaply - there was no-where to put our luggage (no space), the sliding wardrobe doors did not slide and you could see right through to the outside world from the shower cubicle. What was outside was a construction site (the hotel was still being built whilst we were there!!!) The bathroom was so small you could not dry yourself in comfort and the door had to be left open so that you could use the loo! The staff were surly and unhelpful, no english language TV and a request for ice was met with 4 ice cubes in a plastic bag!!! Room service was a joke. Even by Italian standards, this was in no way, shape or form even close to a four star hotel. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: Bev61
Reviews.Content: This was a surprise trip for my birthday from my husband. He had spent a long time reading reviews for hotels in Rome... We were not dissapionted at all.. Yes, the rooms and bathrooms were small, but the decor was very tasteful and elegant and were spotlessly clean. Staff very helpful and polite and the position, perfect for the main attractions. There are plenty of lovely restaurants within the vicinity. I certainly would not have any problems recommending this hotel. An extremely pleasant stay. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and i have to say that the Hotel was above expectations. It was clean and tidy, the room was good with enough room and a very good bathroom. The locations of the Hotel was spot on with everything within walking distance with the exception of the Vatican which was in easy reach using the number 64 bus which you could catch from across the street. The staff were very helpful and spoke excellent english. i would recommend this hotel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central location for the sites”
Reviews.Author: Myron
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Rome and the International Palace proved to be an excellent choice of hotel. Neither myself or my girlfriend spoke a word of Italian on arriving in Rome and we approached the International's front desk with trepidation. Thankfully we found the staff to be very helpful and friendly and most spoke pretty good English. The rooms were very clean and tidy, air conditioning was quiet and the maids were very unobtrusive. Unlike many hotels we've stayed in in the States we weren't once bothered by maids knocking on the door wanting to clean the room, even though on several occasions we had lazy days and didn't leave until 12 noon, yet each time we returned later in the day, the bed was made and fresh clean towels were in the bathroom. Despite being right in the heart of the Historical District, our main room was surprisingly quiet. We did however have to spend one night in a room at the front of the hotel looking out onto the main Via Nazionale road and that was a little noisy for us but then we live in a quiet area in the UK so we find any road noise unusual. Anyone used to city/town life probably wouldn't have been aware of typical city background noise but if you have a choice then request a room not right at the front. The location really couldn't have been better for all the major sites. The Metro is a 5 minute walk away and the main Bus 64 is literally right outside the hotel and if you're feeling energetic you really can easily walk to many sites such as the Colosseum and Forum in no time at all. The only downside is the restaurant which really lets the hotel down. We had dinner twice there and should have learnt our lesson the first time, the service was very fast and friendly but the food was poor. However there are some excellent pizzarias and restaurants literally minutes away including the sublime "Est! Est! Est!". I really wouldn't let the poor restaurant put you off the hotel though, simply eat at the much better places a stones throw away. All in all, we'd heartily recommend the hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Please Be Careful....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time choosing the hotel for our short break to Rome, and we were certainly not disappointed with the hotel. As many reviews already advise the rooms are very small. However they were spotless and decor was to a good standard. It was in an ideal location in terms of sightseeing, majority of main tourist attractions Trevi Fountain, Colosseum within walking distance with the exception of Vatican. Please Please be careful, I thought I was very careful with personal possessions, always kept my hand over by bag, zipped up etc. yet I fell prey to a pickpocket on no 64 bus to Vatican. I am sure the culprit was standing next to me on the bus with a jacket over his arm, which he used as cover to take my purse from my bag, the buses are so crowded, you tend not to worry when someone is standing close to you. It was only when we reached the queue at the vatican I realised my purse was not in my bag. We returned to the hotel to try and arrange for funds to be sent to us, having had most of our monet stolen. the staff at the hotel were very sympathetic, even sending the porter to the police station with us, as they said the police spoke little English. ( the hour and a half we waited at the police station,a further 6 people came in who had also been pickpocketed) It was therefore rather a contradiction in service, for the hotel to charge 1 euro for the phone call I made from reception to try and arrange for money to be sent to us. The receptionist did appear apologetic when telling us she would have to charge the call. We tried not to let it spoil our trip, the hotel is lovely and we felt the location and price would be very difficult to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: EssexDex
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 2 day trip to Rome. First time we've been there and the International Palace proved an excellent choice. The hotel itself is very impressive with the marbled entrenced lobby and receiption area and the room was no let down either. Not the biggest room going but very comfortable and the bathroom was imaculate. Couldnt ask for anything else. As i mentioned it was our first visit to Rome but with the aid of a pocket map we manged to STROLL from the hotel to the Vittoriano in 10mins giving us an excellent starting point for the Forum and Colosseum. Both evenings we walked over to Pantheon and the Piazza Navona, again no longer then 15mins walk. The Vitican was a bit further away but in 30 mins were at the Castel Sant'Angelo. Termini station was also only 10mins away. The perfect hotel as a base for sight seeing and at a good price. We would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Grandeur in a nutshell”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay at the International Palace was included in an excellent Expedia deal. I soaked up as much information as possible before confirming my trip, though one can never completely rely on pictures and descriptions. In this case, the imposing lobby of the hotel was not out of keeping with the room reserved for me, though admittedly it was small. The design and fittings were of high quality, and the bathroom particularly was beautifully decorated in marble. I did not expect much of a view at the price I was paying, and I didn't get one! This was not important to me: comfort and cleanliness take priority for accommodation. I note that other reviewers are by no means unanimous regarding their reactions: I assume that the rooms vary considerably. Certainly the bed in mine was too hard, but a couple of thick blankets under the bottom sheet solved that one. There is no doubt however that this is a well-run establishment with high standards and a professional manner with respect to guests and their needs. Before leaving however I did suggest to the Management that the restaurant service and food did not reflect the overall excellence. The location for me was perfect in that the hotel is situated in a fashionable and salubrious area with easy access to the best of old and new Rome.

Reviews.Title: “international palace rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend booked the romantic stay at the international. It said we would get a bottle of wine a red rose and chocolates and it did..well two single chocolates and a bottle of cheap sparkling vino!! But to be honest im just being fussy. The hotel is situated in an ideal location. Its a ten minute walk to most tourist spots like the Trevi fountain. There is building work going on at the moment. We stopped in the older part of the hotel but you could still hear the builders. The breakfast was a typical continetal one with scrammbled eggs and bacon to please us English!! I would recommend this hotel mainly for its locaton but its also kept to a higher standard than other places ive stopped. I have recommended it to family and friends and i would stop there again

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnsayers
Reviews.Content: This is a really lovley hotel, rooms, bathrooms, and public areas are lovley. Good Soundproofing could not hear a thing, beffet breakfast is very good and staff very pleasant. Buses stop right outside, No 64 very useful. Its about 10 - 15 mins walk from Termini Station I did it with a suitcase and I am nearly 50 but the 4 euro all day ticket for bus/tram and metro is good value. Definiltley recommend this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere !”
Reviews.Author: HobokenBen
Reviews.Content: Tiny room 7"x 12", less than 1" between foot of bed and sliding bathroom door. DO NOT GO BY PICTURE THEY POST! My room very sterile modern, very tiny and dark. Lots of construction noise, starting early in the morning, scafolding outside windows. no desk, no room service, no internet conecctions., only chair tucked into corner was unuseable Staff unable or unwillig do anything that didn't make a profit ( ie fix TV no sound on CNN the only english chn., would not seperate twin beds which where pushed together and had to do it myself, a request for ice was met with "try the bar" then "No ice, machine finished for today" at 7PM!! Book a tour where the hotel gets a fee they are very helpful ! Breakfast OK but selection limited and strange (onions and sliced franks ?) Location looks OK on map but on not convinent to walk to main tourist venues. Long walks, expensive taxi or bus rides to get to sights. Location dead and dark after dark. Long difficult walk from Termni with luggage. Many other hotels in Rome give better location and value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but shame they were refurbishing it...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for five days. When we arrived, it was late and we stood at the reception desk (the only people at the desk by the way) for about a minute before the night receptionist bothered to look up from the phone and acknowledge that we were there. He asked us to take a seat and we waited fifteen minutes before I insisted he check us in - he was annoyed as he had a problem to sort out. Not a good first impression for a four star hotel. We were in a newly refurbished part of the hotel, which as it turned out, they haven't finished working on yet. The room was very clean and modern with a large queen-sized bed, wooden floors and a stylish bathroom. However, we had a fine view of some scaffolding - it was right outside and a pipe was almost touching the window! On the first night our state of the art air conditioning system wasn't working and we reported it - it was fixed the next day. However it turns out that many rooms in that part of the hotel had the same problem. The General Manager sent a bottle of white wine to us and the others affected to apologise for the inconvenience - a nice gesture. The second morning we had to tolerate banging, drilling and so on from inside on our floor, and also outside in the courtyard. We complained again and the noise was reduced on subsequent days. Still, we felt perhaps the hotel should have closed this part down during completion of the works as it was still disruptive. Tumblers in the room were not changed once while we were there. On the positive side, the location is fantastic; we were practising our Italian but the staff spoke very good English; the bedroom, though a bit on the small side, was well appointed. We ate at the restaurant a couple of times and the food was fine. Despite my previous comments, we would probably stay there again - having made sure no work is being done anywhere in the building! The refurbishment problems mean this doesn't get four stars from us.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: Frank_Ontario
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the International Palace from June 6 to 8 and found the hotel to be very neat and clean. The front desk staff were nicely dressed, spoke fluent English, and were very helpful with information, making change, and recommending places to eat. They also had bellmen to assist with your luggage (and we had a ton since we were boarding a cruise ship on the 8th) After reading reviews in this forum in advance of booking here, I asked by e-mail for and received a larger room at no additional cost. The room was comfortable and the air conditioning worked well, but the English TV selection was limited to CNN and BBC news. No big deal but worth knowing in case you'd rather watch TV instead of sightseeing. If you have an electric razor, bring your own adaptor. Speaking of sightseeing, the hotel is close to everything, and restaurants are all around. We did take a taxi to St. Peters as it was hot out and a few miles away, but it could be walked if you wanted to. Unfortunately while we were here, the hotel restaurant was closed for renovations, and they had made arrangements with an establishment across the street for breakfasts. The food and coffee were poor, and we went to a Macdonalds the next day instead. Make sure their restaurant is in operation when you book. All in all, we enjoyed our stay at the International Palace, and hope to return to Rome for a week some time in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ana_NJ
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel. The location is great. The bus stops right by the entrance and the subway stop is just a few block away. The train station is near, but unless you travel with a backpack, I wouldn't recommend walking. Take any bus that goes from the Stazione to Via Nazionale. Room was of a good size - not "all suites" as Hotel advertises. Nice decor, clean modern bathrooms. It was quiet in our room (it was not facing the street), except for the construction noise one morning at around 8. We kept our windows open. The room had a little kitchenette in the closet! The breakfast was nice. There was even omelet and bacon! well they tried..... But there was plenty to eat, including selection of cold cuts, cheeses, fruits, yogurts, juices, and sweets. Very impressive entrance and attractive and clean common areas. The staff was cordial, but distant. We couldn't check in until almost 1PM We didn't try the restaurant, but there is plenty of places to eat around. We paid 156 Euro for a Double (booked on Venere) at the end of May. I thought it was a good value for money. I recommend if you get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a ten minute walk from the main railway station and a good location to explore all of Rome. The road Via Nazionale is busy, but once inside the sliding doors of the International Palace - the sound is gone and an impressive lobby greets you. The room was plenty big enough for two being clean and tidy. The bathroom was emmaculate in green and white marble. Breakfast was included, however after second day it was served at the restaurant across the road for unknown reasons - buffet affair - just what you need considering Italians only have a coffee and pastry for breakfast. The staff were efficient and quick at checking in and out. I would have no hesitation in a return visit to the hotel. Great base, clean quiet hotel - just what you need after all that walking !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: celestemonique
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location. The desk staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were small albeit clean and comfortable. I'd recommend it to a friend and stay there on my next visit to the eternal city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “prime Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable and clean hotel. Staff very helpful and polite. Always someone on the desk who spoke good English. Breakfast was OK but the refilling of the trays was very poor the first morning but improved after that. Well situated near the Termini station and easy walking distance to the Colliseum and many places of interest. Would certainly go back there . Only complaint the window was half covered in a shutter so the room was a bit dark but very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: giantdino
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights from Jan5-Jan11. The location is wonderful. You might walk to almost everywhere and bus stops are right in front of the hotel. The room we stayed is super small but extremely clean. Staff there were cold but helpful, except one lady, who was very warm.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location. Beautiful entrance. Just 15 to 20 mnt. walking distance to the historical centre (a.o. Collosseum, Trevi Fountain). Situated in the middel of shopping district Via Nazionale (shops are open from 9.00 to 20.00; during the siesta closed from 14.00 to 16.00)! Basic buffet breakfast (croissants, scrambled eggs, sausages) but enough choice (the cappucino machine is great!). 1 day ticket for the publlic transportation just 4 Euro (for the bus & metro), buy at the News stands. Nearby metro station is Republica, 15 mnt. walk from Termini. The room is not as big as the website shows (as most of the Italian hotels do), has its own safe (look near the minibar), is very clean and bathroom is decorated with beautiful marbles and the shower is great. However the bed needs a replacement though (a bit soft). Would recommend this hotel for everyone who loves affordable and comfortable hotels with a touch of Italian romantic style. Would love to stay here again next time...

Reviews.Title: “brilliant mini vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: brilliant mini vacation. my wife and i stayed 3 nights 4 days 9 to 12 jan 2005 and had a great holiday. Non stop sight seeing from start to finish. Hotel was well situated in walking distance of all sights. Hotel was just as i hoped it to be for the price.($140/night) More than adequate breakfast, clean bed linen and towels daily. Friendly helpful staff. some of the previous reviews gave me concern, i am pleased i went with my instincts. i can highly recommend this hotel and rome .

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: houseofpayne
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay here in Jan 2005. Great location.. walking diistance from the train station and many sites. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK...just”
Reviews.Author: Bobs-big-vacation
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in Decmeber 04. This was not our first choice as based on previous reviews, we had chosen the Metropole. However, builders had caused plumbing damage and after an embarassed wait of 20 minutes and free drinks from the bar, the manager thought on his feet, booked us a taxi and shipped us of to the four star International Palace. Well done manager! Trouble is ... the Palace is at best only a three star. Why? Despite the better neighbourhood, well presented building and lobby, the rooms are very basic e.g a single wooden chair, a T.V that with 50 channels only offers BBC World and poor quality images of CNN is hardly 'international' standard. Previous reviews commenting on small showers are accurate and true. On the other hand, it must be said the room was very clean and beds comfortable. The request for an extra pillow was dealt with quickly and without fuss. Breakfast quality was reasonable and enjoyable (but each to his own) and with some variety. However the seating arrangement was unusual and catered for parties of 9 or 10 (of which there were none) or instead required individual guests to take their breakfast with total strangers - not everybodies cup of tea! Location of the hotel is good for walking to all the sights. It is only about 10 minutes walk from the Termini also. There are several decent bars and restaurants nearby, hence we did not use the hotel restaurant. December was a good time to visit, 16 degrees was pleasant, there were little or no cues at the sights and it was warm enough to eat out. The beggars you read of were not the problem you would expect and a firm 'no' was all that was needed. Rome was good for a 3 night break. Did we get value for money? Due to the change of hotels I'm not sure we did... and we will never know.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it sets out to be”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On a recent weekend trip to Rome I found this hotel to be very disappointing. It really should not be a four star hotel, it's more like a three star if that. The hotel staff were not helpful. When I asked for an extra pillow I was informed that "The Hotel is full - we do not have any more pillows". After persisting they eventually got a pillow "from another hotel". When I asked for an iron and ironing board I was informed that they didn't have any in the hotel. The bathroom in my room had ants around the shower and basin. By this time I had given up talking to the hotel staff. Breakfast was served (or rather poorly set out) in a room that you would expect in a standard work setting. There were very few tables that sat 2 or 3 people, most were large tables seating at least 8 or 9. Guests were obviously uncomfortable in that situation. There was a reasonable buffet choice, if you didn't want hot food, but the standard was very poor. I certainly would not recommend this hotel to anybody. I felt that it was a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: okotis
Reviews.Content: This hotel should not be rated 4 star, 3 star would be more appropriate. The desk staff are not to helpful, but that is consistant with all desk staff at the 3 hotels we stayed in Italy. The hotel is located on a major bus route (64 and several others), and the stop is outside the hotel. The subway stop is 4 blocks away from the hotel. The breakfast is very good but must get there early before they start running out of food. The room was small but clean. The view was non existant and the mattresses were very hard. The shower stall had barely enough room to move in and if you are fat, forget it. My next visit to Rome I would prefer to stay in the area around Trevi, Piazza Navonna, or the Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Tmorron
Reviews.Content: My husband and i spent our first two nights of our 10 day tour of Italy at the International Palace. The entrance is beautiful, but don't get too excited. The rooms are nice but not as beautifull as the lobby. Rooms are small, but they all are in Rome. Comfortable, clean, and pleasant. Andres at the front desk was great. Very helpful and always trying his best to make our stay enjoyable, which he did. Breakfast in your room is a absolutly wonderful thing. The best way to start your day in the bustling city of Rome. Pricey but yet again so is everything in Rome. Very centrally located, quiet and near the Metro. Would stay again.

HotelInfo.Name: Eurostars International Palace
HotelInfo.Address: Via Nazionale 46, 00184 Rome, Italy
